label: Canal de Manosque
comment: The law of 7 July 1881 declared the construction of the Manosque canal to be of public utility. The acquisition of land and the works were carried out by the State between 1881 and 1926 at the request of Oswald Bouteille.
shortDescription: The law of 7 July 1881 declared the construction of the Manosque canal to be of public utility. The acquisition of land and the works were carried out by the State between 1881 and 1926 at the request of Oswald Bouteille.

label: Hameau de Piène Haute
comment: The hamlet of Piène Haute has 60 inhabitants in the winter and 150 in the summer.
shortDescription: The hamlet of Piène Haute has 60 inhabitants in the winter and 150 in the summer.

label: Tour du Fort
comment: Turret of the western front of the city wall, rebuilt in the decade 1370, during the reconstruction of the wall by the Community of inhabitants in the context of the Hundred Years War. It is classified as a Historical Monument by the list of 1875
shortDescription: Turret of the western front of the city wall, rebuilt in the decade 1370, during the reconstruction of the wall by the Community of inhabitants in the context of the Hundred Years War. It is classified as a Historical Monument by the list of 1875

label: Bibliothèque Aimée Coussy de Garde Colombe
comment:
The librarian welcomes you in a pleasant setting (85m2 and a comic space on the mezzanine). Reading area, organization of activities around books and writing
Access and consultation on site are free and open to all.
shortDescription:
The librarian welcomes you in a pleasant setting (85m2 and a comic space on the mezzanine). Reading area, organization of activities around books and writing
Access and consultation on site are free and open to all.

label: Place des Lices
comment: Places des Lices is one of Saint-Tropez's must-visit sites. Located in the heart of the city, it's an important gathering place with numerous shops, bars, restaurants and its market, held on Tuesdays and Saturdays.
shortDescription: Places des Lices is one of Saint-Tropez's must-visit sites. Located in the heart of the city, it's an important gathering place with numerous shops, bars, restaurants and its market, held on Tuesdays and Saturdays.

label: Eglise Sainte Catherine D'Alexandrie
comment: The church of St. Catherine is a second construction dating from the early 18th century. Its belfry, clock and sundial date from the same period. One can note on its facade a niche sheltering the statue of the Immaculate.
shortDescription: The church of St. Catherine is a second construction dating from the early 18th century. Its belfry, clock and sundial date from the same period. One can note on its facade a niche sheltering the statue of the Immaculate.

label: La Porte Charretière
comment:
This gate to a walled enclosure dates from the 13th or 14th century.
When it was built, it had a portcullis and drawbridge, neither of which have survived.
shortDescription:
This gate to a walled enclosure dates from the 13th or 14th century.
When it was built, it had a portcullis and drawbridge, neither of which have survived.

label: Cagnes-sur-Mer
comment: Ideally located between Nice and Cannes, the city draws its charm from the Mediaeval village of Haut-de-Cagnes whose Château-Musée Grimaldi dominates the city and where many artists and personalities, including Renoir, have stayed.
shortDescription: Ideally located between Nice and Cannes, the city draws its charm from the Mediaeval village of Haut-de-Cagnes whose Château-Musée Grimaldi dominates the city and where many artists and personalities, including Renoir, have stayed.
streetAddress: ['Mairie de Cagnes-sur-Mer', "Place de l'Hôtel de Ville"]

label: Plage du petit Boucharel
comment: To reach the beach of Petit Boucharel, you will cross a very luxuriant part of the coastal path.
shortDescription: To reach the beach of Petit Boucharel, you will cross a very luxuriant part of the coastal path.

label: Muséoscope du Lac
comment: Come on in for an amazing trip and discover the submergerd villages when Serre-Ponçon dam was built. It is a wonderful human adventure !
shortDescription: Come on in for an amazing trip and discover the submergerd villages when Serre-Ponçon dam was built. It is a wonderful human adventure !

label: Stèle de l'église Notre Dame du Thor
comment: It is a stele commemorating the soldiers who died in the two World Wars.
shortDescription: It is a stele commemorating the soldiers who died in the two World Wars.
streetAddress: ["Intérieur de l'église Notre Dame du Thor", 'Place Colonel Frume']

label: Bibliothèque
streetAddress: ['Société coopérative agricole des plantes à parfum de Provence']

label: Oratoire Saint-Laurent
comment: Saint Lawrence is the patron saint of shepherds and protects the flocks. The oratory dedicated to him reminds us of the importance of this activity in the region. The presence of briquettes testifies to the popular origin of the numerous oratories of Provence.
shortDescription: Saint Lawrence is the patron saint of shepherds and protects the flocks. The oratory dedicated to him reminds us of the importance of this activity in the region. The presence of briquettes testifies to the popular origin of the numerous oratories of Provence.

label: Chapelle des Pénitents Blancs
comment: This little chapel will surprise you by its beautiful painted coffered ceiling.
shortDescription: This little chapel will surprise you by its beautiful painted coffered ceiling.

label: La plage Dorée
comment: "No Tobacco" Beach. Since 2018 the beach "Dorée" has been classified as "excellent quality".
shortDescription: "No Tobacco" Beach. Since 2018 the beach "Dorée" has been classified as "excellent quality".

label: Conservatoire des outils anciens
comment: Interpretation centre on old tools and their use.
shortDescription: Interpretation centre on old tools and their use.

label: Place Garibaldi
comment: Since the Middle Ages, fairs and markets took place  on this square. In the XIX th century  was collected  there a tax on imported goods.
shortDescription: Since the Middle Ages, fairs and markets took place  on this square. In the XIX th century  was collected  there a tax on imported goods.

label: Plage du Rayolet
comment: This narrow stretch of sand protected by two headlands can be reached by authorised paths from the Rayolet district. Park along the road in the direction of Brusc, a few hundred metres after Coudoulière beach.
shortDescription: This narrow stretch of sand protected by two headlands can be reached by authorised paths from the Rayolet district. Park along the road in the direction of Brusc, a few hundred metres after Coudoulière beach.

label: Jeu Randoland : jeu de piste pour visiter, se balader, s'amuser en famille !
comment:
A playful stroll for young and old in the historic heart of Le Beausset
Walks in the form of a family treasure hunt.
shortDescription:
A playful stroll for young and old in the historic heart of Le Beausset
Walks in the form of a family treasure hunt.
streetAddress: ['Départ de la Maison du Tourisme', 'Esplanade Charles de Gaulle']

label: Abbaye Saint-Ruf
comment: Saint-Ruf Abbey was founded on the site of a 5th century Paleochristian necropolis near the via Agrippa, the Roman road to Arles, as shown by the discovery, during excavations in 1975, of about forty sarcophagi.
shortDescription: Saint-Ruf Abbey was founded on the site of a 5th century Paleochristian necropolis near the via Agrippa, the Roman road to Arles, as shown by the discovery, during excavations in 1975, of about forty sarcophagi.

label: 7 - Place de l'Eglise
comment:
J - The Bell Tower
The construction of the lower part of the bell tower probably predates that of the Church.
The bell tower attached to the north has a square of about 4m on the side and 10m in height.
Its more modern elevation dates from the 19th century.
shortDescription:
J - The Bell Tower
The construction of the lower part of the bell tower probably predates that of the Church.
The bell tower attached to the north has a square of about 4m on the side and 10m in height.
Its more modern elevation dates from the 19th century.

label: Eglise Notre-Dame de Venasque
comment: Romanesque church protected since ancient times by its practically impregnable situation, at the top of its steep rock, dominating the old Roman road has a treasure in its heart: The famous painting of the school of Avignon (1498), the crucifixion
shortDescription: Romanesque church protected since ancient times by its practically impregnable situation, at the top of its steep rock, dominating the old Roman road has a treasure in its heart: The famous painting of the school of Avignon (1498), the crucifixion

label: Médiathèque
comment: Books, comics, magazines, scores, CDs, DVDs... the media library of the Adrets de l'Estérel offers many books to borrow or to consult on site.
shortDescription: Books, comics, magazines, scores, CDs, DVDs... the media library of the Adrets de l'Estérel offers many books to borrow or to consult on site.

label: Musée de la Barma
comment: Barma Museum in Ristolas, permanent exhibition of paintings and singular art objects, books, based on the stories and legends of Queyras. Open all year round by reservation.
shortDescription: Barma Museum in Ristolas, permanent exhibition of paintings and singular art objects, books, based on the stories and legends of Queyras. Open all year round by reservation.

label: Stèle commémorative des soldats morts aux deux Guerres Mondiales
comment: It is a stele commemorating the soldiers who died in the two World Wars.
shortDescription: It is a stele commemorating the soldiers who died in the two World Wars.

label: Musée des Jouets Anciens et des Métiers d'Art
comment:
For more than 20 years, the museum has offered 158 surprising and educational fairy-tale settings for everyone from 4 to 99 years old in 11 rooms with seating.
Self-guided or guided visits by antique toy collectors or retired and volunteer craftsmen.
shortDescription:
For more than 20 years, the museum has offered 158 surprising and educational fairy-tale settings for everyone from 4 to 99 years old in 11 rooms with seating.
Self-guided or guided visits by antique toy collectors or retired and volunteer craftsmen.

label: Eglise Notre Dame du Serre
comment: The church of Notre-Dame-du-Serre probably dates from 1547.
shortDescription: The church of Notre-Dame-du-Serre probably dates from 1547.

label: Eglise Sainte Anne
comment: The church: at first a military chapel, was built between 1849 & 1851 on Father Olliver request. It became in 1929 the parish church of Sainte-Anne.
shortDescription: The church: at first a military chapel, was built between 1849 & 1851 on Father Olliver request. It became in 1929 the parish church of Sainte-Anne.

label: Calanque de Port d'Alon
comment:
Pebble beach far from the urban area and appreciated from families. 
Starting point for the Littoral path.
shortDescription:
Pebble beach far from the urban area and appreciated from families. 
Starting point for the Littoral path.
streetAddress: ["Calanque de Port d'Alon", 'Route de la calanque']

label: Église Notre-Dame de Bellevue
comment:
Situated at the former boundary of the village, it has been altered several times over the centuries.
The church comprises a nave with a square, vaulted choir as well as four bays and side chapels. A large wooden polychrome retable (The Apparition of the Virgin) can be seen here.
shortDescription:
Situated at the former boundary of the village, it has been altered several times over the centuries.
The church comprises a nave with a square, vaulted choir as well as four bays and side chapels. A large wooden polychrome retable (The Apparition of the Virgin) can be seen here.

label: Plage du Pansard
comment: Situated between the Bastidon Pine forest and the western limit of the town, a natural and sporting sandy beach par excellence, it will delight young and old alike.
shortDescription: Situated between the Bastidon Pine forest and the western limit of the town, a natural and sporting sandy beach par excellence, it will delight young and old alike.

label: Musée Matisse Nice
comment: In a fully renovated Genoese villa set in the olive grove in the Cimiez Gardens, this single-artist museum follows the artistic development of the painter who lived in Nice from 1917 to his death in 1954.
shortDescription: In a fully renovated Genoese villa set in the olive grove in the Cimiez Gardens, this single-artist museum follows the artistic development of the painter who lived in Nice from 1917 to his death in 1954.

label: Plan d'eau du Riou
comment:
This 16-hectare lake will delight nature lovers. Wooded beaches with grass and gravel.
Located between Eyguians and Saint Genis, it offers picnic tables, barbecue, playgrounds...
Free access and supervised swimming in summer on 2 beaches.
shortDescription:
This 16 ha lake will delight nature lovers. Beaches with trees, grass and gravel.
Located between Eyguians and Saint Genis, it offers picnic tables, barbecue, playgrounds...
Free access and swimming on 2 beaches (supervised on Friday).

label: Eglise Saint-Marc de Piene-Haute
comment: Built at the beginning of the 18th century, the main façade dominates a small square at the end of the hamlet. Its chevet and presbytery are founded on a sheer cliff 200 m above the Roya. A narrow rocky passage leads to the old castle, to the north.
shortDescription: Built at the beginning of the 18th century, the main façade dominates a small square at the end of the hamlet. Its chevet and presbytery are founded on a sheer cliff 200 m above the Roya. A narrow rocky passage leads to the old castle, to the north.

label: Eglise Notre-Dame de Beaulieu
comment: Discover a very beautiful building composed of a heterogeneous structure and which presents beautiful volumes. The opportunity to get acquainted with its rich furnishings.
shortDescription: Discover a very beautiful building composed of a heterogeneous structure and which presents beautiful volumes. The opportunity to get acquainted with its rich furnishings.

label: L’Espace Fours de Villard Saint Pancrace
comment: L'Espace Fours will make you discover different types of peasant ovens which allowed the villagers to make lime, plaster, as well as the know-how of yesteryear.
shortDescription: L'Espace Fours will make you discover different types of peasant ovens which allowed the villagers to make lime, plaster, as well as the know-how of yesteryear.

label: Quartier de Tamaris
comment: A luxury resort designed and created ex nihilo by Michel Pacha from 1880 (development of communication routes, a set of 70 villas in the neoclassical oriental style and chalet, 1 hotel, 2 casinos, gardens...). Protected area.
shortDescription: A luxury resort designed and created ex nihilo by Michel Pacha from 1880 (development of communication routes, a set of 70 villas in the neoclassical oriental style and chalet, 1 hotel, 2 casinos, gardens...). Protected area.

label: Le Bòri, pain de sucre des Espels
comment: The Bòri is a traditional dry-stone construction that served as a shelter temporaire durant during periods of agricultural work. It would date from the end of XIXème siècle
shortDescription: The Bòri is a traditional dry-stone construction that served as a shelter temporaire durant during periods of agricultural work. It would date from the end of XIXème siècle
streetAddress: ['Montée des genêts ou chemin du Relais']

label: Hôpital Saint Jacques
comment: Former hospital of the XVIIth century.
shortDescription: Former hospital of the XVIIth century.

label: La Belle de l'Aiguebelle : Sigottier
comment:
From the village of Sigottier an interesting geological sight can be admired: erosion has spectacularly carved the upper layers into a succession of pinnacles.
Formed by Tithonian limestone, the summital cliffs are the most evocative morphological feature of the local mountain landscape.
shortDescription:
From the village of Sigottier an interesting geological sight can be admired: erosion has spectacularly carved the upper layers into a succession of pinnacles.
Formed by Tithonian limestone, the summital cliffs are the most evocative morphological feature of the local mountain landscape.

label: Musée de la truffe du Ventoux
comment: The Tuber Melanosporum reveals itself around the multisensory table, an introduction to the textures and the flavours so specific of this "black diamond". In this museum you will learn about the origins, the methods to harvest and to cook.  The truffle will hold no secrets for you !
shortDescription: The Tuber Melanosporum reveals itself around the multisensory table, an introduction to the textures and the flavours so specific of this "black diamond". In this museum you will learn about the origins, the methods to harvest and to cook.  The truffle will hold no secrets for you !

label: Plage Nord du Plan d'eau d'Embrun
comment:
Located 2km from the city center , enjoy the pleasure of swimming in the Embrun lake.
The beach is under the label "Pavillon Bleu". "Pavillon Bleu" is a label which is symbol of an exemplary environnemental quality.
shortDescription:
Located 2km from the city center , enjoy the pleasure of swimming in the Embrun lake.
The beach is under the label "Pavillon Bleu". "Pavillon Bleu" is a label which is symbol of an exemplary environnemental quality.

label: Village de Mézel
comment: Village in the heart of the Asse Valley
shortDescription: Village in the heart of the Asse Valley

label: Jardin remarquable de Baudouvin
comment: The garden of Baudouvin, labeled « Jardin remarquable » (remarkable garden), is nowadays more beautiful than ever…
shortDescription: The garden of Baudouvin, labeled « Jardin remarquable » (remarkable garden), is nowadays more beautiful than ever…

label: L'Espace Géologique
comment: The permanent exhibition "The Scream of the Earth" in Chateau-Ville-Vieille invites you to discover the fantastic scenario of the appearance of the Alps.
shortDescription: The permanent exhibition "The Scream of the Earth" in Chateau-Ville-Vieille invites you to discover the fantastic scenario of the appearance of the Alps.

label: Eglise Saint Sauveur et son clocher tour
comment: This rather late building (13th / 14th century) was consecrated in 1372. Romanesque in its lower structures, the church is Gothic in its superstructures. The campanile, which dates from 1725, is classified as a Historic Monument.
shortDescription: This rather late building (13th / 14th century) was consecrated in 1372. Romanesque in its lower structures, the church is Gothic in its superstructures. The campanile, which dates from 1725, is classified as a Historic Monument.

label: Télégraphe de chappe
comment: Developed by the engineer Claude Chappe (1763-1805), the aerial telegraph or optical telegraph, used solely for military and political purposes, had at its peak 534 stations spread over 5000 km across Europe.
shortDescription: Developed by the engineer Claude Chappe (1763-1805), the aerial telegraph or optical telegraph, used solely for military and political purposes, had at its peak 534 stations spread over 5000 km across Europe.

label: Musée d'Art Sacré
comment: The Museum presents the municipal collection of Sacred Art from the 31 Chapels and Churches that still exist in the municipality. Aubusson tapestries, wooden statuary, goldsmith's art...
shortDescription: The Museum presents the municipal collection of Sacred Art from the 31 Chapels and Churches that still exist in the municipality. Aubusson tapestries, wooden statuary, goldsmith's art...

label: Grande Plage du Lavandou - Centre-Ville
comment: The Lavandou beach, with its long ribbon of golden  sands, is the largest of the twelves and a great family favorite. As soon as the summer season arrives, the  beach is immersed in a special, colourful atmosphere reminiscent of old-style holydays. Sandcatles and sunbathing on the beach, bathing in the sea.
shortDescription: The Lavandou beach, with its long ribbon of golden  sands, is the largest of the twelves and a great family favorite. As soon as the summer season arrives, the  beach is immersed in a special, colourful atmosphere reminiscent of old-style holydays. Sandcatles and sunbathing on the beach, bathing in the sea.

label: Domaine des Tilleuls d'Or
comment: Elisabeth and Ronald are happy to open the door of the Domaine des Tilleuls d'Or in Saint Cézaire sur Siagne to you, overlooking the main avenue of Florentine cypresses created by Jean Mus in the middle of the olive grove in restanques dating back to the monks of Lérins.
shortDescription: Elisabeth and Ronald are happy to open the door of the Domaine des Tilleuls d'Or in Saint Cézaire sur Siagne to you, overlooking the main avenue of Florentine cypresses created by Jean Mus in the middle of the olive grove in restanques dating back to the monks of Lérins.

label: Maison Gallis
comment:
Carved capital decorated with a medieval bestiary representing a running dog.
Column and capital of the ground floor: inscription by order of 10 December 1949.
shortDescription:
Carved capital decorated with a medieval bestiary representing a running dog.
Column and capital of the ground floor: inscription by order of 10 December 1949.

label: Musée Frédéric Dumas
comment: In April 1945, a trio of diving enthusiasts created an underwater study and research group.
shortDescription: In April 1945, a trio of diving enthusiasts created an underwater study and research group.

label: Viaduc du Caramel
comment: Built from 1908 to 1912, it was here that one enjoyed the most prestigious panorama of the tramway line that connected Menton-Sospel. Today he is nothing more than a silent witness to the existence of this line.
shortDescription: Built from 1908 to 1912, it was here that one enjoyed the most prestigious panorama of the tramway line that connected Menton-Sospel. Today he is nothing more than a silent witness to the existence of this line.

label: Calanque des Anglais
comment: Formed by 3 small creeks of 20 m, bordered by cliffs, accessible by small stairs, it offers many nooks and crannies, suitable for snorkeling and jumping.
shortDescription: Formed by 3 small creeks of 20 m, bordered by cliffs, accessible by small stairs, it offers many nooks and crannies, suitable for snorkeling and jumping.

label: Chemin de ronde
comment: Sheltered behind the walls of the Cité's fortifications and along the river Var, several exhibitions bear witness to the traditions, customs and history of the entrevalais.
shortDescription: Sheltered behind the walls of the Cité's fortifications and along the river Var, several exhibitions bear witness to the traditions, customs and history of the entrevalais.

label: Médiathèque Jean Salomone
comment: Media library offering books, magazines and DVDs. Subscription to be done directly at the media library. Free for 0-25 years old and 8,50€ per year for people over 26 years old.
shortDescription: Media library offering books, magazines and DVDs. Subscription to be done directly at the media library. Free for 0-25 years old and 8,50€ per year for people over 26 years old.

label: Pont médiéval de Châteauneuf-de-Chabre
comment: Below the road, along the Méouge river, the Romanesque three-arch bridge gave access to an old mill of which only the ruins remain and which was swept away during a flood of the Méouge in 1901.
shortDescription: Below the road, along the Méouge river, the Romanesque three-arch bridge gave access to an old mill of which only the ruins remain and which was swept away during a flood of the Méouge in 1901.

label: Oratoire Saint Jean
comment: This oratory is dated 1866, restored in 1934 and around 1980.
shortDescription: This oratory is dated 1866, restored in 1934 and around 1980.

label: 4 - Porte Sarrazine
comment: Last vestige of the fortifications built in the 12th century. This name is explained by the architectural type of closure of the post office "a Sarrasine" which means "with a harrow", it was closed with wooden planks.
shortDescription: Last vestige of the fortifications built in the 12th century. This name is explained by the architectural type of closure of the post office "a Sarrasine" which means "with a harrow", it was closed with wooden planks.

label: Salle des Mariages Jean Cocteau
comment: Along with the Bastion, it is Cocteau's other priceless gift Painted between 1957 and 1958, it magnificently represents the lovers of Menton, whose arabesques rub shoulders with the mythological figures dear to the poet: Orpheus, Eurydice, the Centaurs...
shortDescription: Along with the Bastion, it is Cocteau's other priceless gift Painted between 1957 and 1958, it magnificently represents the lovers of Menton, whose arabesques rub shoulders with the mythological figures dear to the poet: Orpheus, Eurydice, the Centaurs...
streetAddress: ['17 rue de la République', 'Mairie de Menton - Place Ardoïno']

label: Jardin des Orangers - MIP
comment: A pleasant garden, bordering the International Perfume Museum at the entrance to the historic center of Grasse,
shortDescription: A pleasant garden, bordering the International Perfume Museum at the entrance to the historic center of Grasse,

label: Village de Beynes
comment: At an altitude of 793 m, the village of Beynes dominates the Asse plain.
shortDescription: At an altitude of 793 m, the village of Beynes dominates the Asse plain.

label: Plage du Pin de Galle
comment: Beach adapted to families.
shortDescription: Beach adapted to families.

label: Plages publiques BoccaCabana
comment: From Cannes-la-Bocca to Mandelieu-la-Napoule.
shortDescription: From Cannes-la-Bocca to Mandelieu-la-Napoule.

label: Sanctuaire Notre Dame de Lumière et son jardin
comment: Occupied since the Mesolithic (9000 years BC), the site was a post house in the Middle Ages.
shortDescription: Occupied since the Mesolithic (9000 years BC), the site was a post house in the Middle Ages.

label: Plage de Sylvabelle
comment: The large steps on the side of the cliff that lead to the beach do not discourage lovers of this wild coastline. Overlooked by lush vegetation, this haven of peace is a lovely place to relax.
shortDescription: The large steps on the side of the cliff that lead to the beach do not discourage lovers of this wild coastline. Overlooked by lush vegetation, this haven of peace is a lovely place to relax.

label: Château de Roquebrune
comment: Built in the 10th century, it was originally the dungeon of a fortress encompassing the entire village. Panoramic view of Monaco, the sea, Cap Martin and the village.
shortDescription: Built in the 10th century, it was originally the dungeon of a fortress encompassing the entire village. Panoramic view of Monaco, the sea, Cap Martin and the village.

label: Médiathèque Le Clos Saint Louis
comment:
Public library.
Different areas are available to you: news, youth, adult, multimedia research…
shortDescription:
Public library.
Different areas are available to you: news, youth, adult, multimedia research…

label: Place du château
comment: In this area stand a tower built by the Counts of Provence and the surrounding walls which  enclosed the city in the XIV th century
shortDescription: In this area stand a tower built by the Counts of Provence and the surrounding walls which  enclosed the city in the XIV th century

label: Plage de Pampelonne
comment:
Long sandy beach (4.5 km), classified as a 'remarkable natural space' at the origin of the 'Tropezian myth': We bathe there, we bask there, we eat there, we also dance there ...
For a quiet bath in season, come in the morning before 10 a.m. and in the evening after 7 p.m.
shortDescription:
Long sandy beach (4.5 km), classified as a 'remarkable natural space' at the origin of the 'Tropezian myth': We bathe there, we bask there, we eat there, we also dance there ...
For a quiet bath in season, come in the morning before 10 a.m. and in the evening after 7 p.m.

label: Plage du Touring
comment: Small sandy beach from which you can admire the city of Toulon, its port, its harbor and the mountains that overhang it.
shortDescription: Small sandy beach from which you can admire the city of Toulon, its port, its harbor and the mountains that overhang it.

label: Calades : Rues caladées
comment: Some streets of the village are still cobbled
shortDescription: Some streets of the village are still cobbled

label: Plage du Canadel, la plage du Débarquement
comment: The sandy beach of Canadel is knowned by the Provencal Landings that took place at midnight on Aujust 14-15th, 1944, it  is now a peaceful beach and appreciated for its underwater landscape.
shortDescription: The sandy beach of Canadel is knowned by the Provencal Landings that took place at midnight on Aujust 14-15th, 1944, it  is now a peaceful beach and appreciated for its underwater landscape.

label: Place de la Dîme
comment: It takes its name from the tithe (crop tax) collection office that was set up there before the Revolution.
shortDescription: It takes its name from the tithe (crop tax) collection office that was set up there before the Revolution.

label: La Maison du Bois
comment: La Maison du Bois is a contemporary museum, with 3 discovery zones, where you can find out more about the timber industry and mountain forests.
shortDescription: La Maison du Bois is a contemporary museum, with 3 discovery zones, where you can find out more about the timber industry and mountain forests.

label: 3 - Place du Lieutenant Isnard
comment: On this square near the fountain, we distilled the "fiery aqua" (brandy) and stored the stills.
shortDescription: On this square near the fountain, we distilled the "fiery aqua" (brandy) and stored the stills.

label: Plages ombragées d'Artignosc
comment: Serenity at the edge of the water. Lake Artignosc is locateds in the "basses Gorges" betwee, Monpesat and Artignosc sur Verdon. Quinson's reservoir caused the birth of this small lake.
shortDescription: Serenity at the edge of the water. Lake Artignosc is locateds in the "basses Gorges" betwee, Monpesat and Artignosc sur Verdon. Quinson's reservoir caused the birth of this small lake.

label: Monument du Maquis de Gassin
comment: Commemorative plaque "Rhine and Danube"
shortDescription: Commemorative plaque "Rhine and Danube"

label: Eglise du Sacré-Coeur
comment: The Church of the Sacred Heart is the parish church of Castellane. Located in the main square, its construction dates back to the end of the 19th century. A weather vane can be seen at the top of the bell tower.
shortDescription: The Church of the Sacred Heart is the parish church of Castellane. Located in the main square, its construction dates back to the end of the 19th century. A weather vane can be seen at the top of the bell tower.

label: Eglise Saint André des Cordeliers
comment: Discover a church whose first construction dates back to the year 1240.
shortDescription: Discover a church whose first construction dates back to the year 1240.

label: Laragne-Montéglin
comment: Laragne-Montéglin is one of the southernmost communes of the Hautes-Alpes department, halfway between Grenoble and Marseille.
shortDescription: Laragne-Montéglin is one of the southernmost communes of the Hautes-Alpes department, halfway between Grenoble and Marseille.

label: Jardin de l'abbaye de Valsaintes
comment:
A timeless stroll…in a garden like no other!
Visit  the church and the garden "remarkable" composed of more than 550 varieties of roses, a dry garden and a vegetable garden in permaculture. Guided tours of the garden / history and Gregorian chant
shortDescription:
A timeless stroll…in a garden like no other!
Visit  the church and the garden "remarkable" composed of more than 550 varieties of roses, a dry garden and a vegetable garden in permaculture. Guided tours of the garden / history and Gregorian chant

label: Église Saint-Michel

label: La porte de ville et le château
comment:
Vestige of the fortifications built in the 13th and 14th centuries, a pointed arch gate built in the Early Middle Ages: the entrance to the burg.
Now the entrance porch to the seigniorial residence (private) whose stairwell is decorated with ornamental plasterwork.
This so-called "former château" was converted in the 17th century.

The seat of a priory founded by Queen Bertha in 960, Antonaves is now a small village positioned as a "balcony" over Le Buëch Plain.

The Chateau de Picomtal dominates the lake of Serre-Ponçon.
From a watchtower in the XIth century, a first castle comes to life in the XIVth century then is enlarged in the XVIth. It is a place of welcome for visits and its rooms.
French garden redesigned at the end of the 20th century.

Sandy beach with shower and toilet, equipped with a first aid station and forbidden to dogs.


A bit of history


Forum Julii is the name that the Romans gave to the city of Fréjus some two thousand years ago when they made it one of the most important and most important cities in Europe.

June to mid September : Wednesday & Saturday at 6.30 pm, Sunday at 11.00 am and 6.30 pm
July to early September : mass in Barbigoua, Saturday at 7.00 pm

label: Village de Faucon
comment: The little village of Faucon affords a splendid panorama of Mont Ventoux. You will be charmed by the houses built of local stone, the famous slate, lending a special character to the ancient walled city.
shortDescription: The little village of Faucon affords a splendid panorama of Mont Ventoux. You will be charmed by the houses built of local stone, the famous slate, lending a special character to the ancient walled city.

label: Plage République
comment: The beach of the Republic is a sandy beach, with shower and toilets, forbidden to dogs and provided with a first aid post.
shortDescription: The beach of the Republic is a sandy beach, with shower and toilets, forbidden to dogs and provided with a first aid post.

label: Clocher Saint-Jean
comment:
This bell tower with its twin openings, very characteristic of the first Romanesque art, is the only surviving vestige of the ancient priory Sanctis Johannes.
It is not visited but is visible from the road.
shortDescription:
This bell tower with its twin openings, very characteristic of the first Romanesque art, is the only surviving vestige of the ancient priory Sanctis Johannes.
It is not visited but is visible from the road.

Nice little beach surrounded by dikes with an amazing view of St Tropez's Citadelle. 
Proximity of restaurant.
shortDescription:
Nice little beach surrounded by dikes with an amazing view of St Tropez's Citadelle. 
Proximity of restaurant.

shortDescription: Roche-la-Croix is a stone (19th century) and reinforced concrete (20th century) complex - evidence of the relentless escalation of the arms race.

shortDescription: Manfredo Borsi, 1900-1967 a ceramics painter in Provence

label: Cabine à livres

Bring, borrow, share books!
The old telephone booth in Place du Bon-Vent in Peipin has been fitted out with several multicoloured shelves. They are designed to hold books, available to all, and with free access.
shortDescription:
Bring, borrow, share books!
The old telephone booth in Place du Bon-Vent in Peipin has been fitted out with several multicoloured shelves. They are designed to hold books, available to all, and with free access.

label: MHeMO, Maison d'histoire et de mémoire

shortDescription: The exhibition, the first in France dedicated to the Harkis the museum traces the story of the arrival of 25 families in a village in Provence. mhemo.ongles@orange.fr

label: Cathédrale Notre-Dame du Bourguet
comment: The central nave, choir and transept date from the beginning of the 13th century and are the first attempt to adapt Gothic art in the Pays d'Oc to Romanesque art. The side aisles date from the 17th century and the fortified cathedral was part of the defensive rampart.
shortDescription: The central nave, choir and transept date from the beginning of the 13th century and are the first attempt to adapt Gothic art in the Pays d'Oc to Romanesque art. The side aisles date from the 17th century and the fortified cathedral was part of the defensive rampart.

shortDescription: The Municipal Library of Saint-Cyr-sur-Mer offers a large choice of books (more than 17,000) and digital media (600 CDs and 200 DVDs), responding to its initial mission: promote public reading.

Politician, several times Minister and President of the Council, Nobel Peace Prize in 1926.
There are a few large houses built on solid foundations formed on large blocks of cut stone.

Politician, several times Minister and President of the Council, Nobel Peace Prize in 1926.

shortDescription: In a life-size reconstructed setting: abyss, waterfall, underground river, frescoes and prehistoric traces, you will discover the world of speleology and the research and exploration carried out on the Fontaine-de-Vaucluse site.

shortDescription: Admire the frescoes and the sculptures in the three chapels. All accessible to the public thanks to the booklet available to visitors and to the exhibition retracing the history of the building.

It is now a municipal cultural center.

Build in the heights of the Cap Sicié range in 1879, its mission was to protect the space included between Les Sablettes and the open sea. Today Peyras remains the only German Flak battery in Europe.

shortDescription: Wandering through the picturesque streets of this village classified among the most beautiful in France, you will have the opportunity to discover a dozen ancient gates dating back to the times when the village expanded outside its first ramparts.

comment: Public library.

shortDescription: The village of Villecroze-les-Grottes has preserved its authenticity and its medieval character. We are in a maze of narrow streets with vaulted passages, arcades, squares, campanile and fountains.

label: Église de l'Immaculée Conception
comment: With its bell tower topped by a campanile, the church of La Farlède is easy to find. Built in the centre of the village in the 18th century, it was consecrated to the Virgin Mary under the name of the Immaculate Conception.
shortDescription: With its bell tower topped by a campanile, the church of La Farlède is easy to find. Built in the centre of the village in the 18th century, it was consecrated to the Virgin Mary under the name of the Immaculate Conception.

shortDescription: The church of Notre Dame des Maures dates from the 7th century

shortDescription: Museum devoted to the life and career of a great sailor from Provence and his companions: François-Joseph Paul Count of Grasse (1722-1788).

label: Visite de la Filature du Valgaudemar
comment: Come and discover the work of a spinner and our beautiful industrial heritage. The Filature du Valgaudemar, created in 1830, worked the wool of the sheep of the valley which was used to dress the inhabitants of this region with cold and rigorous winters...
shortDescription: Come and discover the work of a spinner and our beautiful industrial heritage. The Filature du Valgaudemar, created in 1830, worked the wool of the sheep of the valley which was used to dress the inhabitants of this region with cold and rigorous winters...

shortDescription: In 1873, it was decided to set up a simple entrenched post on the Gros Cerveau massif, armed with long-range artillery pieces.

label: Village perché de Ventavon

shortDescription: In the middle of apple orchards and sunflower fields, Ventavon is a pretty fortified village around its church St Lawrence (12th century) and its magnificent castle (private) of the 15th century.

label: La Cathédrale Saint-Siffrein

shortDescription: Saint Siffrein Cathedral, named after the Bishop, patron of Carpentras in the 7th century, is a beautiful example of southern Gothic architecture, characterized by unified space and strong wall space

label: Palais de l'Europe

shortDescription: Remnant of the French Riviera spirit of the early 20th century, it was previously the municipal casino built in 1908. Today it houses the tourist office, the library, 1 theatre with 730 seats, several reception rooms.

label: Passage des Greniers
comment: This former outbuilding was located behind the Hôtel de Pochet (now the Hôtel de Ville). The consuls had the communal granaries installed there in 1774. An engraved stone on the wall of the Town Hall recalls the location of these granaries.
shortDescription: This former outbuilding was located behind the Hôtel de Pochet (now the Hôtel de Ville). The consuls had the communal granaries installed there in 1774. An engraved stone on the wall of the Town Hall recalls the location of these granaries.

The Lapidary Museum or the Antiquities Gallery of the Calvet Museum displays Greek, Roman, Gallo-roman and Paleochristian collections in a presentation that has been slowly renewed. The old chapel of the Jesuit College (XVIIth century), an example of the Baroque architecture, houses a rich collection.
.

The Lapidary Museum or the Antiquities Gallery of the Calvet Museum displays Greek, Roman, Gallo-roman and Paleochristian collections in a presentation that has been slowly renewed. shortDescription: The Colline des Lutins is a discovery and playful farm. A place of appeasement and relaxation for the whole family located in the heart of nature on the border of the Alpes de Haute Provence and Hautes-Alpes.

label: Porte des Cordeliers

label: La Grave
comment: In the heart of the Ecrins Massif, the village of La Grave (1450m), labelled as one of the most beautiful villages in France, has set up its stone and slate houses on a sunny slope facing the imposing 3,983m high peak of La Meije.
shortDescription: In the heart of the Ecrins Massif, the village of La Grave (1450m), labelled as one of the most beautiful villages in France, has set up its stone and slate houses on a sunny slope facing the imposing 3,983m high peak of La Meije.

label: Parfumerie Fragonard - Usine des fleurs
comment: This modern factory on the outskirts of Grasse opened in 1986 and is equipped with the most up-to-date machinery for producing and packaging our products.
shortDescription: This modern factory on the outskirts of Grasse opened in 1986 and is equipped with the most up-to-date machinery for producing and packaging our products.

label: Musée de Saint-Paul-sur-Ubaye : Outils, gestes et travaux
comment: The museum of Saint-Paul-sur-Ubaye is dedicated to agricultural work, transport techniques and obsolete professions.
shortDescription: The museum of Saint-Paul-sur-Ubaye is dedicated to agricultural work, transport techniques and obsolete professions.

label: L'hôtel de ville
comment: The impressive new town-hall was inaugurated in 1857.
shortDescription: The impressive new town-hall was inaugurated in 1857.

label: Les rampes et l'Hôtel Pretti de Saint-Ambroise
comment: Located opposite the Saint-Michel ramp, in the Genoese Baroque style, it comprises three floors and the date of 1649 is still visible on the façade. The building protected as a historic monument (16 November 1989) is still privately owned.
shortDescription: Located opposite the Saint-Michel ramp, in the Genoese Baroque style, it comprises three floors and the date of 1649 is still visible on the façade. The building protected as a historic monument (16 November 1989) is still privately owned.

label: La Ciappea
comment: Association created for the rehabilitation of old vineyards, planks, dry stone walls as well as the cultivation of aromatic plants, table grapes and wine in La Ciappea, La Brigue (Roya Valley).
shortDescription: Association created for the rehabilitation of old vineyards, planks, dry stone walls as well as the cultivation of aromatic plants, table grapes and wine in La Ciappea, La Brigue (Roya Valley).

label: Elevage Bel'Âne - Ferme pédagogique
comment: In this pretty miniature donkey park you can stroke the donkeys, brush them, play with the donkeys, understand their way of life, walk through the vermiculture farm and learn a lot about the life of these little individuals.
shortDescription: In this pretty miniature donkey park you can stroke the donkeys, brush them, play with the donkeys, understand their way of life, walk through the vermiculture farm and learn a lot about the life of these little individuals.

label: Plage du Cheiron à Castellane
comment: At the edge of the lake of Castillon, aquatic space delimited by buoys (July/August) supervised.
shortDescription: At the edge of the lake of Castillon, aquatic space delimited by buoys (July/August) supervised.

label: Maison musée « Faure-Vincent Dubois »
comment: The Faure-Vincent Dubois House, Historical Monument, is a museum house. It is located in the village of Cervières and offers visitors a moment immersed in the daily life of mountain peasants in the heart of the 18th century.
shortDescription: The Faure-Vincent Dubois House, Historical Monument, is a museum house. It is located in the village of Cervières and offers visitors a moment immersed in the daily life of mountain peasants in the heart of the 18th century.

label: Palais Ricci des Ferres
comment: Former palace of the Counts Blancardi, one of the noblest houses of the city. A commemorative plaque marks the passage of Pope Pius VII on August 10, 1809 in this place.
shortDescription: Former palace of the Counts Blancardi, one of the noblest houses of the city. A commemorative plaque marks the passage of Pope Pius VII on August 10, 1809 in this place.

label: La Médiathèque de Cavalaire
comment:
The library of Cavalaire provides you with more than 43 000 books, 60 newspapers and magazines,  2000 DVD to rent or to see directly at the Mediatheque.
Besides, it presents every month exhibitions of quality as well as video projections.
shortDescription:
The library of Cavalaire provides you with more than 43 000 books, 60 newspapers and magazines,  2000 DVD to rent or to see directly at the Mediatheque.

label: La place Honoré II et les remparts
comment:
Place Honoré II is a small square at the entrance of the Old Town - Porte Saint-Antoine, at the foot of the Basilica Saint Michel.
It bears the name of the Prince of Monaco (1597 - 1662) responsible for many beautiful buildings of Menton including the basilica.
shortDescription:
Place Honoré II is a small square at the entrance of the Old Town - Porte Saint-Antoine, at the foot of the Basilica Saint Michel.
It bears the name of the Prince of Monaco (1597 - 1662) responsible for many beautiful buildings of Menton including the basilica.

label: Le château féodal de Mison
comment:
The Mévouillon famùily built this fortress during the 13th century.
The building was organised around a central courtyard and four main buildings flanked by square towers. Two gates gave access to it.
shortDescription:
The Mévouillon famùily built this fortress during the 13th century.
The building was organised around a central courtyard and four main buildings flanked by square towers. Two gates gave access to it.

label: Nécropole nationale
comment: Military Necropolis of Canada
shortDescription: Military Necropolis of Canada

label: La plaque commémorative Napoléon
comment: The plaque commemorates the passage of the Emperor to Sisteron, in the former hostelry of the Bras d'Or.
shortDescription: The plaque commemorates the passage of the Emperor to Sisteron, in the former hostelry of the Bras d'Or.

label: Plage Zamenhof
comment: Located next to the beach of the Martinez hotel on the boulevard de la Croisette, the Zamenhof beach in municipal management of Cannes offers a friendly welcome and quality services.
shortDescription: Located next to the beach of the Martinez hotel on the boulevard de la Croisette, the Zamenhof beach in municipal management of Cannes offers a friendly welcome and quality services.

label: Plage Les Ruisses
comment: Quiet beach, located in a nature reserve.
shortDescription: Quiet beach, located in a nature reserve.

label: Abbaye du Thoronet
comment:
A Cistercian wonder in the heart of the Var’s forest !
Built at the end of the 12th Century, the Thoronet Abbey is one of the “3 Provençal Sisters”. Celebrated by the book “Les Pierres Sauvages”, the church & monastery strongly express the Cistercian idealism, full of simplicity & rigour that St Benoit inspired.
shortDescription:
A Cistercian wonder in the heart of the Var’s forest !
Built at the end of the 12th Century, the Thoronet Abbey is one of the “3 Provençal Sisters”. Celebrated by the book “Les Pierres Sauvages”, the church & monastery strongly express the Cistercian idealism, full of simplicity & rigour that St Benoit inspired.

label: Buste de Raimbaut de Vacqueyras
comment: This bronze bust was inaugurated on 14 August 1899 in the presence of the founder of the Félibrige, Frédéric Mistral, and the cicadas and félibres of Paris who offered this bronze bust.
shortDescription: This bronze bust was inaugurated on 14 August 1899 in the presence of the founder of the Félibrige, Frédéric Mistral, and the cicadas and félibres of Paris who offered this bronze bust.

label: Drap
comment:
Drap is a commune of the South, a peaceful and wooded village.
Ideally situated at the entrance to the Paillon Valley and a few kilometres from the Mediterranean coast, Drap is worth a visit.
shortDescription:
Drap is a commune of the South, a peaceful and wooded village.
Ideally situated at the entrance to the Paillon Valley and a few kilometres from the Mediterranean coast, Drap is worth a visit.

label: Plage Rondelli
comment: This tiny beach just before the port of Garavan offers one of the most beautiful views of the old town. Monitored in the summer, a rescue post on the dike and composed of sand, made rare in Menton, it very popular by families.
shortDescription: This tiny beach just before the port of Garavan offers one of the most beautiful views of the old town. Monitored in the summer, a rescue post on the dike and composed of sand, made rare in Menton, it very popular by families.

label: Place Forte de Mont-Dauphin
comment: Monument inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List under the Vauban fortifications.
shortDescription: Monument inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List under the Vauban fortifications.

label: Le jardin des papillons
comment: It is a wonderful haven of peace and discovery: a garden of 7000 m2 at an altitude of 650 meters in a wild scrubland and more than 3000 plants for the Provencal butterfly.
shortDescription: It is a wonderful haven of peace and discovery: a garden of 7000 m2 at an altitude of 650 meters in a wild scrubland and more than 3000 plants for the Provencal butterfly.

label: Plage des Maurettes
comment:
At the level of the train station, beach in natural elements - Restaurants beach and nautical base - First aid post in summer - Beach anti-smoking - Showers and WC. Handi-beach and PMR access.
Free parking (paying in summer) and bicycle park.
shortDescription:
At the level of the train station, beach in natural elements - Restaurants beach and nautical base - First aid post in summer - Beach anti-smoking - Showers and WC. Handi-beach and PMR access.
Free parking (paying in summer) and bicycle park.

label: Ribeyret
comment: This typically Provencal burg sits at the foot of Maraysse Mountain. Lavender, almond trees, lamb breeding and farming fill the surrounding hillsides.
shortDescription: This typically Provencal burg sits at the foot of Maraysse Mountain. Lavender, almond trees, lamb breeding and farming fill the surrounding hillsides.

label: Hôtel Issautier
comment: This sponge cake house is distinguished by an inner courtyard, a sort of patio, now closed and by a staircase leading to the different floors of the house via intermediate galleries.
shortDescription: This sponge cake house is distinguished by an inner courtyard, a sort of patio, now closed and by a staircase leading to the different floors of the house via intermediate galleries.

label: Vestiges du château féodal et jardin des Vintimilles
comment: Located on the hill overlooking the village, the ruins of the feudal castle can be visited freely with the help of explanatory panels affixed to the walls.
shortDescription: Located on the hill overlooking the village, the ruins of the feudal castle can be visited freely with the help of explanatory panels affixed to the walls.

label: Plage du Château - Plage publique

shortDescription: La Plage du Château is a public beach located between the yacht harbour and the Château.

label: Le Fort Carré d'Antibes
comment: This defensive building was once a circular tower dating back to 1550 on the site of the Saint-Laurent Chapel. Its construction was perfected under Vauban's command and adapted to the evolution of fire-arms and military siege techniques. Today, the Fort is classified as an historic monument.
shortDescription: This defensive building was once a circular tower dating back to 1550 on the site of the Saint-Laurent Chapel. Its construction was perfected under Vauban's command and adapted to the evolution of fire-arms and military siege techniques. Today, the Fort is classified as an historic monument.

label: Médiathèque intercommunale de Volx
comment:
The Media Library of Volx is a friendly place whose mission is to allow everyone access to books and culture.
Located between the town hall and the rural foyer, it offers a vast choice of documents including press, DVD, CD and digital resources.
shortDescription:
The Media Library of Volx is a friendly place whose mission is to allow everyone access to books and culture.

label: Villecroze - Village médiéval
comment: Discover all the old village, classified "village of character of the Var". Pedestrian, it offers you a labyrinth of alleys with its vaulted passages, its arcades, its flowered squares and the soft sound of fountains.
shortDescription: Discover all the old village, classified "village of character of the Var". Pedestrian, it offers you a labyrinth of alleys with its vaulted passages, its arcades, its flowered squares and the soft sound of fountains.

comment: Small beach in Grimaud.
shortDescription: Small beach in Grimaud.

label: Ancienne Caserne
comment: This building was built by French military engineers when Italy joined Germany and Austria in the Triple Alliance hostile to France.
shortDescription: This building was built by French military engineers when Italy joined Germany and Austria in the Triple Alliance hostile to France.

comment: P - Cross of Lorraine, symbolically installed on this Place des Patriotes as a sign of freedom and recalling this fight during the Second World War.
shortDescription: P - Cross of Lorraine, symbolically installed on this Place des Patriotes as a sign of freedom and recalling this fight during the Second World War.

comment: The Champsaur lake welcomes you on its site in the middle of nature, on the banks of the Drac, and offers many fun activities: supervised swimming, water slide, canoeing, pedal boats, trampoline, fishing, wakeboarding, towed buoy...
shortDescription: The Champsaur lake welcomes you on its site in the middle of nature, on the banks of the Drac, and offers many fun activities: supervised swimming, water slide, canoeing, pedal boats, trampoline, fishing, wakeboarding, towed buoy...

Square with elements of the 13th, 15th and 17th century.
The facades and roofs of the buildings and the floor of the square are inscribed MH (18 March 1947)

Square with elements of the 13th, 15th and 17th century.

comment:
Beach adapted to families.
Golden sand and pebbles, with progressive water depth, 150 meters long. One toilet 
An exceptionally protected natural environment.
1 paying car-park, one first-aid station during the summer season (Tel 04 94 27 53 82)

label: Rue de Bréa
comment: Formerly known as "New" then "Pantless" during the Revolution, it took the name "Bréa" in 1865 to pay tribute to a large family of notables of the city.
shortDescription: Formerly known as "New" then "Pantless" during the Revolution, it took the name "Bréa" in 1865 to pay tribute to a large family of notables of the city.

label: Hameau de Libre
comment:
This hamlet of about 80 inhabitants is situated at an altitude of 600 meters and is renowned for the cultivation of its olive groves.
In 1947, all travel was by foot, on donkeys, mules or men.
shortDescription:
This hamlet of about 80 inhabitants is situated at an altitude of 600 meters and is renowned for the cultivation of its olive groves.

shortDescription: In Estoublon, the fields of olive trees give the landscape a very Provençal colour.

label: Fort Maginot de Castillon
comment: This fort of the Maginot line, built in the 1930s under the ruins of the village, was intended to stop possible Italian attacks. It was the target of Allied bombing raids in 1944 to repel German troops.
shortDescription: This fort of the Maginot line, built in the 1930s under the ruins of the village, was intended to stop possible Italian attacks. It was the target of Allied bombing raids in 1944 to repel German troops.

label: Le Fort de Buoux
comment:
This stronghold has developed over the centuries from an oppidum.
It is part of a whole strategic defence system, from the Combe de Lourmarin to Sivergues and beyond, as a calculated protection of the Apt valley.
shortDescription:
This stronghold has developed over the centuries from an oppidum.
It is part of a whole strategic defence system, from the Combe de Lourmarin to Sivergues and beyond, as a calculated protection of the Apt valley.

label: Boulevard de Garavan
comment: Garavan long 3 kms, bordered by pepper and carob trees, is the sweetest area of Menton and therefore of all the French Riviera leads from the Italian border to the old town of Menton. The gardens of acclimatization are still numerous.
shortDescription: Garavan long 3 kms, bordered by pepper and carob trees, is the sweetest area of Menton and therefore of all the French Riviera leads from the Italian border to the old town of Menton. The gardens of acclimatization are still numerous.

shortDescription: Comprising a succession of 3 pools, the reservoir was used to capture and preserve fish.

label: Basilique Métropolitaine Notre-Dame des Doms
comment:
The metropolitan basilica was built in the 12th century, and underwent renovations in the 15th and 17th centuries. The basilica was built on the Rocher des Doms and overlooks the Rhone valley. The bell tower is now crowned by a gilded statue of the Blessed Mary.
After two years of extensive renovation work, the Basilica reopened on Holy Thursday March 24 2016. 

Your visit is welcome, please observe discretion at all times and particularly during liturgical services.
shortDescription:
The metropolitan basilica was built in the 12th century, and underwent renovations in the 15th and 17th centuries. The basilica was built on the Rocher des Doms and overlooks the Rhone valley. The bell tower is now crowned by a gilded statue of the Blessed Mary.
After two years of extensive renovation work, the Basilica reopened on Holy Thursday March 24 2016. 

Your visit is welcome, please observe discretion at all times and particularly during liturgical services.
streetAddress: ['Basilique Métropolitaine ND des Doms', 'Place du Palais des Papes']

label: Ruines du château des Forbins

label: Le Conservatoire des Terrasses de Cultures
comment:
The conservatory is spread over 5 hectares.

One notices elements of small heritage, characteristic of Provence: the cistern, the aiguier, and of course the "bancau" or restanques, built in this place sheltered from the Mistral, facing south.
shortDescription:
The conservatory is spread over 5 hectares.

The church was built in 1863 and opened on 18 april 1864. The wall paintings of the apse show the four evangelists( st Marc, st Mathieu, st Jean, st Luc) and the apostles St Pierre and St Paul, painted from 1871 to 1877;
times of mass: Saturday 6...

label: Parc Olbius Riquier
comment: This traditional 19th century landscaped garden was Olbius Hippolyte Antoine Riquier’s gift to the town in 1868. It comprises of 17 acres of lawns, large trees, winding alleys and even a lake and a greenhouse designed for tropical plants and birds. A convention linking it to Paris’ Jardin d’Acclimatation defines the garden as a place to grow, create and study the adaptation of tropical species to the climate of the region. The garden plans were drawn in 1869 by landscape architects Pierre Barillet-Deschamps and Georges Aumont who also worked on many Parisian gardens. Many exotic species of palm trees, bamboos and succulents are found there, as are a small zoo and a playground for children.
shortDescription: This traditional 19th century landscaped garden was Olbius Hippolyte Antoine Riquier’s gift to the town in 1868. It comprises of 17 acres of lawns, large trees, winding alleys and even a lake and a greenhouse designed for tropical plants and birds. A convention linking it to Paris’ Jardin d’Acclimatation defines the garden as a place to grow, create and study the adaptation of tropical species to the climate of the region. The garden plans were drawn in 1869 by landscape architects Pierre Barillet-Deschamps and Georges Aumont who also worked on many Parisian gardens. Many exotic species of palm trees, bamboos and succulents are found there, as are a small zoo and a playground for children.

label: Paroisse Notre Dame de la Mer
Le camp des Cabanes Vieilles
comment: The Camp of  "Cabanes Vieilles" is a high-altitude barracks built in the 1980s to accommodate troops on maneuvers. They were violently bombed at the beginning of the Authion offensive. Presence of a Stuart M5A1 tank.

label: Plage de Saint-Aygulf

Exposed to the wind, it is a well-known kitesurfing and windsurfing spot.

Vast expanse of fine sand, or cove with mineral worn by time, each beach is unique, bordered by a promenade hemmed with palm trees or overhung by a path.

Exposed to the wind, it is a well-known kitesurfing and windsurfing spot.

Free and open access.

Free and open access.

label: Plage des Peïras

Les Peiras beach at Les Issambres is on the Fréjus road, just after San Peire Port.
This sandy, well-sheltered beach stretches for just over 100 metres.

Les Peiras beach at Les Issambres is on the Fréjus road, just after San Peire Port.

label: Village de Villedieu
comment: The village of Villedieu was a headquarters of the Knights Hospitaller of St John of Jerusalem in the Middle Ages, and a Templar fiefdom belonging to the Roaix Command. It is situated on the edge of the Drôme, in a hilly landscape of vineyards, olive groves, and pine forests.

comment: The municipal media library welcomes you in the old town hall in the heart of the village. In a warm and friendly space, you will be able to discover our collections, spend a moment of relaxation, borrow, research, exchange?
shortDescription: The municipal media library welcomes you in the old town hall in the heart of the village. In a warm and friendly space, you will be able to discover our collections, spend a moment of relaxation, borrow, research, exchange?

shortDescription: Former metalliferous and ore processing deposit, the most productive zinc deposit in Europe at the end of the 19th century, housing the remains of surface installations and a gallery accessible by guided tour.

label: Mines de Bruoux

shortDescription: Take a trip to the heart of the Ochre! Vertiginous cliffs in flamboyant colours and gigantic maze of galleries make up a unique and mysterious setting where man's toil blends with the beauty of the landscape.

shortDescription: Ideally located in the immediate vicinity of the Jean Jaurès parking lot, at 8 bis de la rue Nationale.

shortDescription: Oratory located on the path of the Carleva to be discovered once passed in front of the chapel St Antoine Ermite and the gate of Genoa.

comment: Mison is dominated by the remains of a once very imposing castle from which you can admire a beautiful view of the Buëch valley.
shortDescription: Mison is dominated by the remains of a once very imposing castle from which you can admire a beautiful view of the Buëch valley.

label: Glacière
comment: The Manosque cooler probably dates from du XVIIIe siècle. It is located at du Moulin Neuf, Chemin de Champ de Pruniers.

comment: Built from 1675 and inaugurated in 1685.
shortDescription: Built from 1675 and inaugurated in 1685.

shortDescription: Around the lake of Saint Cassien, a beach has been set up with a softer access in the water adapted to children with a bathing surveillance station

label: Eglise Notre Dame des Ormeaux
comment: From Easter to November 1st, mass at 9:00 am. All year round at 11:00 am.
shortDescription: From Easter to November 1st, mass at 9:00 am. All year round at 11:00 am.

label: Musée Marceau Constantin
comment: The Marceau Constantin Museum is a unique discovery in rural areas. This former student of André Lhote and Ossip Zadkine, acclaimed by the world critics, is today by his village St Christol d'Albion which dedicates a Museum to him. By means of the audioguides in English you will spend a very special moment hearing the painter's comments !
shortDescription: The Marceau Constantin Museum is a unique discovery in rural areas. This former student of André Lhote and Ossip Zadkine, acclaimed by the world critics, is today by his village St Christol d'Albion which dedicates a Museum to him. By means of the audioguides in English you will spend a very special moment hearing the painter's comments !

label: Banon
comment: Banon is a village in the Alpes-de-Haute-Provence, on a mountainside overlooking a valley. The sky is a brilliant blue, the sun shines 300 days a year. The climate is dry, ideal to feel good.
shortDescription: Banon is a village in the Alpes-de-Haute-Provence, on a mountainside overlooking a valley. The sky is a brilliant blue, the sun shines 300 days a year. The climate is dry, ideal to feel good.

label: Musée d'Art et d'Histoire
comment: Since 1933, Orange’s Museum has been located in a 17th Centuryprivate mansion, once home to Georges Van Cuyl, a Dutch gentleman who the Prince of Orange had instructed to carry out the arming of the hill Château.
shortDescription: Since 1933, Orange’s Museum has been located in a 17th Centuryprivate mansion, once home to Georges Van Cuyl, a Dutch gentleman who the Prince of Orange had instructed to carry out the arming of the hill Château.

shortDescription: Jean Marais' tomb in the Old Cemetery of Vallauris.

label: Les Jardins du Palais des papes
comment: The Gardens at the Palace of the Popes have only recently re-opened and are a new feature of the visit. The gardens provide visitors with a relaxing space and add to a deeper understanding of the entire Palace.
shortDescription: The Gardens at the Palace of the Popes have only recently re-opened and are a new feature of the visit. The gardens provide visitors with a relaxing space and add to a deeper understanding of the entire Palace.

label: Pont-Frontière
comment: This building replaces a first bridge built in the middle of the 15th century by the general salt gabelier, to whom the Duke of Savoy grants the monopoly of this precious commodity in exchange for the construction and maintenance of the road and bridges.
shortDescription: This building replaces a first bridge built in the middle of the 15th century by the general salt gabelier, to whom the Duke of Savoy grants the monopoly of this precious commodity in exchange for the construction and maintenance of the road and bridges.

label: Hameau des Sablettes
comment: A 19th century seaside resort. Bombed by the Allies in 1944 and rebuilt between 1950 and 1953 by Fernand Pouillon, the hamlet of Les Sablettes offers visitors an exceptional view of Cap Sicié and the Deux Frères.
shortDescription: A 19th century seaside resort. Bombed by the Allies in 1944 and rebuilt between 1950 and 1953 by Fernand Pouillon, the hamlet of Les Sablettes offers visitors an exceptional view of Cap Sicié and the Deux Frères.

label: Musée du Patrimoine
comment: Located in a former oil mill and cork factory, the museum invites you to an enriching journey into the past, thanks to a collection of objects from everyday life in the 19th century.
shortDescription: Located in a former oil mill and cork factory, the museum invites you to an enriching journey into the past, thanks to a collection of objects from everyday life in the 19th century.

shortDescription: Public Library

label: Lac du Lauzet-Ubaye

shortDescription: The main asset of Le Lauzet-Ubaye is undoubtedly its lake, a marvel of nature in which the surrounding high peaks are reflected.

label: Le Lac de Monteux - Eco-Quartier de Beaulieu
comment: Situated in the heart of the EcoQuartier de Beaulieu, Lake Monteux Provence is a leisure base open every day of the year for the whole family at the gates of Avignon, with the Mont Ventoux as a backdrop.
shortDescription: Situated in the heart of the EcoQuartier de Beaulieu, Lake Monteux Provence is a leisure base open every day of the year for the whole family at the gates of Avignon, with the Mont Ventoux as a backdrop.

label: La verrerie de Biot ®
comment: Created in 1956 by Eloi Monod, La Verrerie de Biot ® invented 'bubbled glass'. It has obtained the 'Entreprise du Patrimoine Vivant' (EPV) label, a mark of recognition of rare know-how.
shortDescription: Created in 1956 by Eloi Monod, La Verrerie de Biot ® invented 'bubbled glass'. It has obtained the 'Entreprise du Patrimoine Vivant' (EPV) label, a mark of recognition of rare know-how.

shortDescription: The botanical garden of the Balaguier museum was created in 2008 around the plants' voyage and the botanical garden of Toulon's navy.

shortDescription: A museum to bring back childhood emotions

label: Nossage-et-Bénévent
comment: Now a tranquil spot, Nossage-et-Bénévent has not always been a haven of peace: Les Baronnies, which were very quickly converted to Protestantism, suffered at the hands of both Catholic and Huguenot troops.
shortDescription: Now a tranquil spot, Nossage-et-Bénévent has not always been a haven of peace: Les Baronnies, which were very quickly converted to Protestantism, suffered at the hands of both Catholic and Huguenot troops.

label: Bastide du Broundet
comment: "Maison de reposance" of Louis Lombard, Marquis de Gourdon, mayor of Grasse in 1815, when Emperor Napoleon I returned from Elba Island and took brief hours of rest there on the night of March 2 to 3.
shortDescription: "Maison de reposance" of Louis Lombard, Marquis de Gourdon, mayor of Grasse in 1815, when Emperor Napoleon I returned from Elba Island and took brief hours of rest there on the night of March 2 to 3.

shortDescription: Approach the goat, the sheep, the cows or the duck to learn about them in this educational farm at the foot of Mont Ventoux.

shortDescription: This is the main square in Roquebrune-sur-Argens where most of the village’s local events are held.

shortDescription: The garden offers a walk with Spanish accents full of charm and nostalgia imagined by Vicente Blasco Ibanez, with its gazebo overlooking the sea, benches and pergolas, everything here is reminiscent of the Andalusian and Valencia patios.

shortDescription: Relics of an aqueduct built in the 15th century to supply Grimaud with water from the ‘Pan Caou’ spring.

shortDescription: Small village in the heart of the Grand Luberon, Peypin d'Aigues is distinguished by the richness of its architectural stone hamlets and the extent of its forest where descendants of multiple torrents.

shortDescription: Lotus and water lilies populate the basin, the collections of daturas embalm in this garden rich in colors and scents or have acclimatized some specimens of extinct species, such as the Sophora Toromiro native to Easter Island.

The sandy beaches of Lido and Agay are the most extensive in the municipality of Saint-Raphael, occupying almost the entire bay
It hosts the Handiplage, a nautical base and restaurants.
shortDescription:
The sandy beaches of Lido and Agay are the most extensive in the municipality of Saint-Raphael, occupying almost the entire bay

shortDescription: Founded by Augustus in 14 BC, Cemenelum was proclaimed the capital of Alpes Maritimae, an ancient Roman Province.

label: Musée Lou Ferouil
comment: Pierre-Guy Martelly, master blacksmith, will welcome you to relive 40 trades of the past and the local stories related to them. At the end of the visit, he will light up his forge to create sculptures for you.
shortDescription: Pierre-Guy Martelly, master blacksmith, will welcome you to relive 40 trades of the past and the local stories related to them. At the end of the visit, he will light up his forge to create sculptures for you.

shortDescription: Along the road in the hamlet of Rourebeau an explanatory panel will give you some anecdotes on the passage of Napoleon on 5 March 1815.

shortDescription: This former church occupied by the Récollets exhibits major works by the artist Louise Bourgeois, made especially for this place: baptismal fonts in Carrara marble, a confessional with tapestry works, ...

comment: One of the first cultural centers in the hill-country behind Nice where one can see original exhibitions of painting, sculpture, patchwork. Worth a visit for Jean-Pierre Augier's sculptures.
shortDescription: One of the first cultural centers in the hill-country behind Nice where one can see original exhibitions of painting, sculpture, patchwork. Worth a visit for Jean-Pierre Augier's sculptures.

label: Monument à l'Impératrice Elisabeth d'Autriche
comment: In order to commemorate the stays of Empress Elisabeth of Austria, known as "Sissi", this obelisk commissioned from the architect Tersling by Mrs. Lucy of Montgomery, testifies to the attachment of her friends and admirers.
shortDescription: In order to commemorate the stays of Empress Elisabeth of Austria, known as "Sissi", this obelisk commissioned from the architect Tersling by Mrs. Lucy of Montgomery, testifies to the attachment of her friends and admirers.

comment: Along the coastline between Saint-Tropez and Gassin, there is a wide sandy beach facing the ‘Les Maures’ mountain range which is shared between private institutions and coastline open to the public.
shortDescription: Along the coastline between Saint-Tropez and Gassin, there is a wide sandy beach facing the ‘Les Maures’ mountain range which is shared between private institutions and coastline open to the public.

comment: Feel like a walk? Go to the historical garden...
shortDescription: Feel like a walk? Go to the historical garden...

label: Collégiale Saint Martin
comment: Saint Martin Church, built between 1704 and 1711, shelters many pieces of art from the XVIIIe century. On the plain and symmetrical facade, to the left, you can recognise Saint Ferreol statue (patron saint of Lorgues) Virgin Mary in the very centre and Saint Martin to the right. The architect Veirier of Aix was entrusted with building this monument and Frejus Bishop, i.e. Bishop de Fleury ( the last cardinal minister under Louis XV) blessed the laying of the first stone in 1704. It took almost 25 years to build  this monument.
shortDescription: Saint Martin Church, built between 1704 and 1711, shelters many pieces of art from the XVIIIe century. On the plain and symmetrical facade, to the left, you can recognise Saint Ferreol statue (patron saint of Lorgues) Virgin Mary in the very centre and Saint Martin to the right. The architect Veirier of Aix was entrusted with building this monument and Frejus Bishop, i.e. Bishop de Fleury ( the last cardinal minister under Louis XV) blessed the laying of the first stone in 1704. It took almost 25 years to build  this monument.

label: Eglise de Ribiers
comment: Ribiers Church was rebuilt in the aftermath of the Wars of Religion in the 16th century using the many remnants of the previous building.
shortDescription: Ribiers Church was rebuilt in the aftermath of the Wars of Religion in the 16th century using the many remnants of the previous building.

label: Musée de l'Annonciade
comment: A museum dedicated to painters who use colour. Remarkable collections of paintings which serve as a reminder that Saint-Tropez was an active centre for avant-garde art at the start of the 20th century due to Signac discovering this charming little fishing harbour in 1892.
shortDescription: A museum dedicated to painters who use colour. Remarkable collections of paintings which serve as a reminder that Saint-Tropez was an active centre for avant-garde art at the start of the 20th century due to Signac discovering this charming little fishing harbour in 1892.

label: Fontaine circulaire
comment:
Located on the old main street, the fountain was used for the domestic uses of the villagers, for the travelers  and for the herds that could drink there.
The fountain is inscribed MH on 10/12/1949
shortDescription:
Located on the old main street, the fountain was used for the domestic uses of the villagers, for the travelers  and for the herds that could drink there.

comment: A true cultural venue located in the heart of the village, the media library was inaugurated on 3 May 2003 and offers a varied cultural programme throughout the year.
shortDescription: A true cultural venue located in the heart of the village, the media library was inaugurated on 3 May 2003 and offers a varied cultural programme throughout the year.

label: Refuge d'Art "Les Thermes"
comment:
Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
internationally recognized, which imagines a project combining contemporary art
and safeguarding rural heritage in the protected territory of the Haute-Provence Geopark, around Digne les Bains.
shortDescription:
Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
