label: Tour Ripert
comment: The architecture of the Ripert Tower is in the Romanesque tradition. It is square in shape and 17 metres high and has three floors and a terrace, to which a small structure has been added in order to house the bell of the dock. Originally, the tower had no stairs: access to the different floors was by rope or wooden ladders. Today, the Ripert Tower is equipped with view indicators and offers beautiful views of the landscapes of Haut Vaucluse and Drôme provençale.
shortDescription: The architecture of the Ripert Tower is in the Romanesque tradition. It is square in shape and 17 metres high and has three floors and a terrace, to which a small structure has been added in order to house the bell of the dock. Originally, the tower had no stairs: access to the different floors was by rope or wooden ladders. Today, the Ripert Tower is equipped with view indicators and offers beautiful views of the landscapes of Haut Vaucluse and Drôme provençale.

label: Musée "Reflets d'un monde rural"
comment: The “Reflections of a Rural World” ethnographic museum, housed in the Chateau’s former stables, is a chance to discover or rediscover the traditional activities practiced in the Grasse region between 1900 and 1950.
shortDescription: The “Reflections of a Rural World” ethnographic museum, housed in the Chateau’s former stables, is a chance to discover or rediscover the traditional activities practiced in the Grasse region between 1900 and 1950.

label: Sainte-Marie
comment: Sainte-Marie is very close to the famous village of Pomerol, where Le Col de la Fromagère, which connects it to Rosans, is worth the detour for geological curiosities. Sainte-Marie owes its name to a prior of Bodon Abbey in Saint-May to which the village belonged.
shortDescription: Sainte-Marie is very close to the famous village of Pomerol, where Le Col de la Fromagère, which connects it to Rosans, is worth the detour for geological curiosities. Sainte-Marie owes its name to a prior of Bodon Abbey in Saint-May to which the village belonged.

label: Plage du Sable d'Or - Plage publique
comment: The Beach of the Golden sand is a public beach. Situated on the roadside, near the district of Napoule.
shortDescription: The Beach of the Golden sand is a public beach. Situated on the roadside, near the district of Napoule.

label: Roue à augets de l'ancien moulin à farine
comment: The new flour mill of Manosque was built in the XVth century by the Community of Manosque when it regained the right to grind.
shortDescription: The new flour mill of Manosque was built in the XVth century by the Community of Manosque when it regained the right to grind.

label: Château de Solliès-Pont
comment: With its brick façade, its towers and its sale roof that makes it unique, the castle of Solliès-Pont is the architectural landmark of the village.
shortDescription: With its brick façade, its towers and its sale roof that makes it unique, the castle of Solliès-Pont is the architectural landmark of the village.

label: Château-Musée  Lascaris
comment: The Lascaris, Counts of Ventimiglia, were the first lords of Gorbio. The stronghold of Gorbio is already mentioned in 1040. The Lascaris castle was built in the 12th century. Today the castle-museum houses the works of the Indian painter Raza.
shortDescription: The Lascaris, Counts of Ventimiglia, were the first lords of Gorbio. The stronghold of Gorbio is already mentioned in 1040. The Lascaris castle was built in the 12th century. Today the castle-museum houses the works of the Indian painter Raza.

label: Musée Jean-Honoré Fragonard - Collection Hélène & Jean-François Costa
comment:
The Fragonard Museum is set within the Hôtel de Villeneuve, a magnificent historic building that has reclaimed its original luster of a grand 18th-century Grasse mansion.
Dedicated to Grasse’s most famous son, painter Jean-Honoré Fragonard (1732-1806), the museum displays over a dozen major works by this great artist.
shortDescription:
The Fragonard Museum is set within the Hôtel de Villeneuve, a magnificent historic building that has reclaimed its original luster of a grand 18th-century Grasse mansion.
Dedicated to Grasse’s most famous son, painter Jean-Honoré Fragonard (1732-1806), the museum displays over a dozen major works by this great artist.

It is classified as a historical monument by the list of 1875.

Friendship of veterans and victims of war in Le Lavandou and surrounding areas.
the A.C.V.G welcomes you to associate yourself with its objectives.

the A.C.V.G welcomes you to associate yourself with its objectives.

label: La Piarre : histoire d'eau

shortDescription: The greatest wealth of the village whose name means stone is water. 60 inhabitants have 5 wash houses where water abounds in all seasons, remnants of a past when agriculture was flourishing and the exploitation of silver mines was successful.

label: Musée de la Géologie de la Maison du Parc

shortDescription: Set in th beautiful vaulted cellars of th "Maison du Parc", the museum invites you to discover the geological richness of this territory, the landscapes and rocks diversity and an extraordinary collection of fossils.

label: Église Notre-Dame de la Nativité de Lagrand

shortDescription: A transit and residential area, Lagrand has retained the Our Lady of the Nativity Church from the 12th and 14th centuries, vestige of a very important former priory. It was built in black limestone quarried in Eyguians.

label: Le potager d'un curieux

shortDescription: Conservatory garden of rare or ancient vegetables, flowers and aromatic herbs. For 20 years, these plants, including about 50 varieties of tomatoes and 200 varieties of perennials, have been grown in this extraordinary garden.

label: Château de Piène Haute

shortDescription: Located at the end of the rocky ridge on which the village is located. One can see from this castle, the tower of the Cruella in Breil sur roya, the hamlet of Libre, the village of Fanghetto.

shortDescription: Like a green lung in the heart of the city, this garden, created centuries ago by monks, is today reinvented by gardeners, artists and botanists...

shortDescription: Ideally situated in an agricultural plain between the Siou-Blanc and Maures massifs, the commune of Solliès-Pont has 11,500 inhabitants. Its ideal location, topography and tranquillity make it a very popular commune.

Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
internationally recognized, which imagines a project combining contemporary art
and safeguarding rural heritage in the protected territory of the Haute-Provence Geopark, around Digne les Bains.
shortDescription:
Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist

label: Cimetière marin
comment: It was relocated in 1776 to the Pré des Pêcheurs and then to its current location in 1815. This is one of the rare seaside cemeteries in France and enjoys breathtaking views over the Gulf of Saint-Tropez and ‘Les Canebiers’ bay.
shortDescription: It was relocated in 1776 to the Pré des Pêcheurs and then to its current location in 1815. This is one of the rare seaside cemeteries in France and enjoys breathtaking views over the Gulf of Saint-Tropez and ‘Les Canebiers’ bay.

comment: A chapel nestled in nature decorated with frescoes of the 15th century, built on the remains of a pagan temple overlooking the 7 springs whose mysterious intermittency was long attributed to the divine power...
shortDescription: A chapel nestled in nature decorated with frescoes of the 15th century, built on the remains of a pagan temple overlooking the 7 springs whose mysterious intermittency was long attributed to the divine power...

label: Le monastère de Ganagobie

shortDescription: The monastery of Ganagobie, classified as a historical monument, is located on the bank of the Durance, between Peyruis and Lurs, on the plateau crowned with rocks. It is a Clunsian priory founded around the 10th century.

label: La Porte de Gênes

shortDescription: Saint Siffrein, bishop of Carpentras, would have had a first chapel built in Saint Antoninus. This one was built next to the present site.

label: La Maison du Patrimoine

M - The Washhouse
Built in 1894, it was used until the 1970s by the most courageous washerwomen! Its particularity is that it has always been covered.

From its two promontories, this "butterfly village" awaits you.
Clinging to the foothills of the highest area of ​​the Luberon, it will welcome you in its soft shadows.

comment: La Banque,  museum  of Cultures and Landscapes (Hyeres museum) found it place in the magnificiant former extension of the Bank of France. Full of emotions and knowledge, this new Museum will raise as the emblematic cultural place in Hyères.

shortDescription: Facing the Gulf of Saint-Tropez, the botanical garden is an oxygen injection! Discover the luscious greens and the numerous mediterranean plants authentic to our region by strolling through the the alleys of the botanical garden.

label: Ancienne fabrique de plâtre et de chaux Rolland
comment:
The former Rolland factory was a private plaster and lime manufacturing industry.
The inscription of this monument dates from June 17, 1996.
You will find its ruins in the commune of Le Caire in the Hautes Terres de Provence.
shortDescription:
The former Rolland factory was a private plaster and lime manufacturing industry.
The inscription of this monument dates from June 17, 1996.
You will find its ruins in the commune of Le Caire in the Hautes Terres de Provence.

shortDescription: The Villa Aurélienne stands in the heart of a 24-hectare park, characterized by its Mediterranean-type vegetation, and is home to superb remains of the Roman Aqueduct.

label: Château fort de Malmort
comment: The fortified castle of Malmort valiantly defended centuries during the entrance of the Upper Roya: this structure today in ruins, quoted since the 13th century, was restored in the 17th century and played an important role in the revolutionary wars.
shortDescription: The fortified castle of Malmort valiantly defended centuries during the entrance of the Upper Roya: this structure today in ruins, quoted since the 13th century, was restored in the 17th century and played an important role in the revolutionary wars.

label: Paléogalerie
comment: The Paléogalerie universe is avant-gardiste on how work with stones used to be. Between a museum and an art galery, Paléogalerie is an exceptionnal exhibition of fossils from Provence. Come and discover all sorts of creatures that lived under your feet a 100 million years back.
shortDescription: The Paléogalerie universe is avant-gardiste on how work with stones used to be. Between a museum and an art galery, Paléogalerie is an exceptionnal exhibition of fossils from Provence. Come and discover all sorts of creatures that lived under your feet a 100 million years back.

label: Collégiale
comment: The collegiate church of Barjols dates from the 11th century and is one of the oldest in the diocese. It is classified as a Historic Monument. To see: organ, Van Loo's painting and reliquary.
shortDescription: The collegiate church of Barjols dates from the 11th century and is one of the oldest in the diocese. It is classified as a Historic Monument. To see: organ, Van Loo's painting and reliquary.

label: Eglise Russe

shortDescription: It was the Danish architect Tersling who built, in 1892, this small Russian church whose interior is richly decorated with wall paintings by Prince Gagarin, and many icons.

label: L'Androuno (la rue la plus étroite du monde)
comment: The Androuno is the narrowest street of the World : at its narrowest point, tt measures 29 centimeters wide (11.41 inches), letting only one person pass at a time! It presents all the picturesque charm of the perched village of Gassin.
shortDescription: The Androuno is the narrowest street of the World : at its narrowest point, tt measures 29 centimeters wide (11.41 inches), letting only one person pass at a time! It presents all the picturesque charm of the perched village of Gassin.

label: Domaine Privé du Cap Martin

shortDescription: In 1889, the wild Cape Martin, a former hunting estate of the Princes of Monaco, changed its face. From the Grand Hotel of Cape Martin to the prestigious villas, Cape Town becomes a private estate where all the greats of this world come together to spend the winter.

shortDescription: Alexandra David-Neel, a woman of letters, was the first European woman to enter the forbidden city of Lhasa, Tibet, in 1924.

shortDescription: In 1830 there was still a hous raised on a gantry  above the street.

shortDescription: The Victoria Violet, grown in Tourrettes-sur-Loup since 1880, blooms from mid-October to mid-March. During the season, come and discover all the subtleties of this small delicate flower.

Close to the port, all in fine sand, family and very pleasant, it is the largest beach of Bormes- les -Mimosas.
- Parking nearby

comment: The oppidum is located on the hill of Castellas, overlooking at 349 meters of altitude the left bank of the Gapeau. We are in the presence of the ruins of a fortification testifying to a Ligurian or pre-Roman settlement. There is no marked path leading to the site.
shortDescription: The oppidum is located on the hill of Castellas, overlooking at 349 meters of altitude the left bank of the Gapeau. We are in the presence of the ruins of a fortification testifying to a Ligurian or pre-Roman settlement. There is no marked path leading to the site.

shortDescription: Cette immense usine de parfumerie, contemporaine, offre une superbe vue sur l'église baroque du village et la mer. La visite gratuite et guidée de la parfumerie est doublée de celle du laboratoire de cosmétiques.

shortDescription: Once located on the seafront, near a small cape that will give it its name, it is now far from it following the construction of the Bonaparte wharf. It is connected to Quai Monléon by Rue Ciapetta.

label: Château d'Arzeliers
comment:
Inhabited since the 12th century, the hamlet is overlooked by the ruins of the feudal castle destroyed during the Wars of the Religion in the late 16th century.
The heart of the village is centred around the church dedicated to Saint Marcellin. This natural site offers an exceptional panoramic view of the surrounding "perched" villages.
shortDescription:
Inhabited since the 12th century, the hamlet is overlooked by the ruins of the feudal castle destroyed during the Wars of the Religion in the late 16th century.

A library shared between Barret sur Méouge and Eourres is the guarantee of a wide variety of books for readers in the Méouge Valley!

label: Château de Simiane
comment:
The castle of Simiane is inspired by the Renaissance.
During the 18th century, it was owned by Louis of Simiane. He married Pauline Adhémar of Monteil, grand-daughter of the famous Madame de Sévigné.
shortDescription:
The castle of Simiane is inspired by the Renaissance.

label: Eglise Saint Louis
comment:
Built in 1855 and damaged during world war two, the Saint Louis Church has been transformed throughout the years. The bell tower has been replaced thanks to Father Hélin, local member of the French resistance.
The choir has been renovated with handmade fresco painted by the artist Jean-Baptiste Garrigou in 2009.
shortDescription:
Built in 1855 and damaged during world war two, the Saint Louis Church has been transformed throughout the years. The bell tower has been replaced thanks to Father Hélin, local member of the French resistance.
The choir has been renovated with handmade fresco painted by the artist Jean-Baptiste Garrigou in 2009.

label: Plage Hyde Beach

shortDescription: Located on the mythical boulevard de La Croisette, the private beach of the Hyde Beach Cannes and its pontoon over the sea invite you to enjoy a relaxing (and gastronomic) experience with your feet in the sand, your eyes in the blue.

label: Chapelle Saint-Roch
comment: The chapel dates from the seventeenth century.
shortDescription: The chapel dates from the seventeenth century.

label: Eglise Notre Dame de l'Annonciation
comment:
The church started to be built in 1594 and in 1678 a side nave was added to the original structure, right on the place where the former one dedicated to Saint Trophyme was built.  The original sanctuary can still be seen within the church and the main nave supporting a barrel vault  leads to a five panel apse crowned with ogival arches. Transvers arches are built on thin columns decorated with capitals that strenghthen the vault. As for the side naves, they are lined with small chapels  topped with an half point vault. 

"Les Beaux Arts" classified the main altarpiece, a XVIth century font as well as  the bas relief of a XVII century door.
shortDescription:
The church started to be built in 1594 and in 1678 a side nave was added to the original structure, right on the place where the former one dedicated to Saint Trophyme was built.  The original sanctuary can still be seen within the church and the main nave supporting a barrel vault  leads to a five panel apse crowned with ogival arches. Transvers arches are built on thin columns decorated with capitals that strenghthen the vault. As for the side naves, they are lined with small chapels  topped with an half point vault. 

"Les Beaux Arts" classified the main altarpiece, a XVIth century font as well as  the bas relief of a XVII century door.

Sofas and armchairs invite you to relax.

label: Musée de Préhistoire Régionale de Menton
comment: The first museum in the town of Menton was created in 1878.  The natural history and archaeology collection, as it was created by its first curator Stanislas Bonfils, is still to be found in the current museum and shows the evolution of the lifestyle of prehistoric men in the Alpes-Maritimes region, as well as in the regions of Provence and Liguria.
shortDescription: The first museum in the town of Menton was created in 1878. shortDescription: Come and push the huis from the fortress of Mornas. Many ladies and lords will tell you in an original, playful, interactive way, the habits and customs of the Middle Ages!

label: Musée Picasso
comment: While searching for a studio, Pablo Picasso came across the Château Grimaldi and decided to work there in 1946. He completed dozens of works that he later donated to the Museum. You'll also see works by Ernst, Magnelli, Picabia, Balthus, Atlan, Hartung.
shortDescription: While searching for a studio, Pablo Picasso came across the Château Grimaldi and decided to work there in 1946. He completed dozens of works that he later donated to the Museum. You'll also see works by Ernst, Magnelli, Picabia, Balthus, Atlan, Hartung.

label: Courthézon
comment:
“A Heritage, a region and the pleasure of welcoming"
5,388 inhabitants
shortDescription:
“A Heritage, a region and the pleasure of welcoming"
5,388 inhabitants

label: Porte  Sarrazine
comment: The main entrance door of the old fortification dating from the 14th century, with its still well-preserved machicolations.
shortDescription: The main entrance door of the old fortification dating from the 14th century, with its still well-preserved machicolations.

label: Eglise Notre Dame de l'Assomption
comment: The exact date when Notre Dame de l'Assomption chapel was built is not known. However, the oldest written document mentioning its existence dates back to 1055. Of a romanic style, it shelters wall painting dating back to the XIXth century.
shortDescription: The exact date when Notre Dame de l'Assomption chapel was built is not known. However, the oldest written document mentioning its existence dates back to 1055. Of a romanic style, it shelters wall painting dating back to the XIXth century.

label: Le Moulin à grains de Villar d'Arène
comment: The Villar d'Arène grain mill, the last of its time still in working order, is a long, solid building dating from the beginning of the 18th century. It still has the systems that allowed it to operate at the time.
shortDescription: The Villar d'Arène grain mill, the last of its time still in working order, is a long, solid building dating from the beginning of the 18th century. It still has the systems that allowed it to operate at the time.

label: Musée provençal du Costume et du Bijou
comment: Former residence of the Marquise de Cabris, Mirabeau’s sister, the Clapier-Cabris mansion has housed the Musée Provençal du Costume et du Bijou (the Provence Costume and Jewelry Museum) since 1997.
shortDescription: Former residence of the Marquise de Cabris, Mirabeau’s sister, the Clapier-Cabris mansion has housed the Musée Provençal du Costume et du Bijou (the Provence Costume and Jewelry Museum) since 1997.

label: La Maison du Tuilier
comment: At no. 20 of the avenue de la gare, formerly known as rue de la Tuilerie, there is a house built in 1776, whose totally atypical brick façade bears witness to family know-how.
shortDescription: At no. 20 of the avenue de la gare, formerly known as rue de la Tuilerie, there is a house built in 1776, whose totally atypical brick façade bears witness to family know-how.

label: Hôtel d'Astier
comment: A 16th century mansion with a pretty courtyard with an Italian Renaissance loggia. It is also a cultural centre where contemporary art rubs shoulders with theatre and music in all its forms. Several artists are installed in this place.
shortDescription: A 16th century mansion with a pretty courtyard with an Italian Renaissance loggia. It is also a cultural centre where contemporary art rubs shoulders with theatre and music in all its forms. Several artists are installed in this place.

label: Musée du Patrimoine
comment: History and functioning of the old electric turbine ; corn mill (demonstration of grind-stones), objects used in daily life in the 19th century...
shortDescription: History and functioning of the old electric turbine ; corn mill (demonstration of grind-stones), objects used in daily life in the 19th century...

label: Entrepierres
comment: Sitting on the fold of a ravine, known locally as "Detroit", the mediaeval village Entrepierres is aptly named.
shortDescription: Sitting on the fold of a ravine, known locally as "Detroit", the mediaeval village Entrepierres is aptly named.

label: Musée des Voûtes - Patrimoine Trigançois
comment: Photo exhibition of the Trigançois heritage in the heart of the village.
shortDescription: Photo exhibition of the Trigançois heritage in the heart of the village.

label: Musée des Explorations du Monde
comment: Here, you're invited on a fantastic world tour, from the archaeology of the Mediterranean basin to ethnology and primitive art on all five continents.
shortDescription: Here, you're invited on a fantastic world tour, from the archaeology of the Mediterranean basin to ethnology and primitive art on all five continents.

label: Calanque Saint-Barthélémy
comment: From this panoramic site of Cap Roux, classified as a remarkable site, in the background a small steep cove of 20 m of red gravel. View on the bay of Cannes, Antheor and the Ile des Vieilles.
shortDescription: From this panoramic site of Cap Roux, classified as a remarkable site, in the background a small steep cove of 20 m of red gravel. View on the bay of Cannes, Antheor and the Ile des Vieilles.

label: Aqueduc Romain
comment: Over a distance of about 40 km, the Aqueduct led the waters of the Foux and the Siagnole (Mons) to the highest point of Fréjus.
shortDescription: Over a distance of about 40 km, the Aqueduct led the waters of the Foux and the Siagnole (Mons) to the highest point of Fréjus.

label: Palais de la Gabelle
comment: The medieval house, listed as historical monuments  in 1949, where the Viguier lived, bears the signature of the master : "Maistre Francist me fecit". This is the only example of civil architecture signed by the department.
shortDescription: The medieval house, listed as historical monuments  in 1949, where the Viguier lived, bears the signature of the master : "Maistre Francist me fecit". This is the only example of civil architecture signed by the department.

label: Eglise Notre-Dame de Nazareth
comment: Very beautiful Romanesque church from the 12th century. Exceptional organ case.
shortDescription: Very beautiful Romanesque church from the 12th century. Exceptional organ case.

label: La chapelle Sainte Croix
comment: The primitive chapel, then built on the summit, would have been built from 1500 to 1504, according to the abbot Bourgues, priest of Bedoin from 1903 to 1908, and historian.
shortDescription: The primitive chapel, then built on the summit, would have been built from 1500 to 1504, according to the abbot Bourgues, priest of Bedoin from 1903 to 1908, and historian.

label: La Maison du Chocolat et Cacao
comment: The Maison du Chocolat & Cacao opened in June 2015. It occupies an 18th-century chapel.
shortDescription: The Maison du Chocolat & Cacao opened in June 2015. It occupies an 18th-century chapel.
streetAddress: ["Chapelle des Soeurs de la Charité de Nevers, Rue de l'Hospice"]

label: Eglise Saint Nicolas
comment: Saint-Nicolas is the most beautiful example of flamboyant gothic style built in Provence.
shortDescription: Saint-Nicolas is the most beautiful example of flamboyant gothic style built in Provence.

label: Citromuseum
comment: Whether you are a car enthusiast or just curious...
shortDescription: Whether you are a car enthusiast or just curious...

label: Handiplage de San Peïre aux Issambres
comment:
A “Handiplage” beach with disabled facilities opened at Les Issambres in 2016.
More than 300 bathers in 2017! About thirty volunteers from the municipal staff are on hand to help disabled people wishing to use the dedicated equipment.
shortDescription:
A “Handiplage” beach with disabled facilities opened at Les Issambres in 2016.
More than 300 bathers in 2017! About thirty volunteers from the municipal staff are on hand to help disabled people wishing to use the dedicated equipment.

label: Refuge d'Art "Col de l'Escuichière"
comment:
Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
internationally recognized, which imagines a project combining contemporary art
and safeguarding rural heritage in the protected territory of the Haute-Provence Geopark, around Digne les Bains.
shortDescription:
Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
internationally recognized, which imagines a project combining contemporary art
and safeguarding rural heritage in the protected territory of the Haute-Provence Geopark, around Digne les Bains.

label: Jardin Remarquable de la Maison du Cygne
comment: In its new setting, the landscaped garden features 13 themed zones with explanatory and interactive panels to guide visitors on their visit.
shortDescription: In its new setting, the landscaped garden features 13 themed zones with explanatory and interactive panels to guide visitors on their visit.
streetAddress: ['209 avenue de la Coudoulière', 'Bois de La Coudoulière']

label: Le Portail de l'Ouest
comment: Leaning against the surrounding wall, The West Portal is an ancient medieval gate that protected the entrance to the fortified village of La Turbie.
shortDescription: Leaning against the surrounding wall, The West Portal is an ancient medieval gate that protected the entrance to the fortified village of La Turbie.

label: Espace muséal Witold Gombrowicz
comment: The museum area Gombrowicz is open to the public on the 2nd floor of the Villa Alexandrine.
shortDescription: The museum area Gombrowicz is open to the public on the 2nd floor of the Villa Alexandrine.

label: Maison Jean Vilar
comment: A resource centre founded in 1979 by the Jean Vilar Association, in partnership with Avignon and the Performing Arts Department at the Bibliothèque nationale de France.
shortDescription: A resource centre founded in 1979 by the Jean Vilar Association, in partnership with Avignon and the Performing Arts Department at the Bibliothèque nationale de France.
streetAddress: ['Maison Jean Vilar - 8 rue de Mons', 'Montée Paul Puaux']

label: Mémorial du Mitan
comment: This monument commemorates the so called "Dragoon" operation, i.e. the landing in Provence on 15th August 1944.
shortDescription: This monument commemorates the so called "Dragoon" operation, i.e. the landing in Provence on 15th August 1944.

label: Plage Saint-Clair
comment: Nestling quietly at the foot of pinewoods, Saint-Clair is blessed with a special climate which sets it apart from the other beaches. It is smaller and more secretive than the neighbouring beach of the Lavandou.
shortDescription: Nestling quietly at the foot of pinewoods, Saint-Clair is blessed with a special climate which sets it apart from the other beaches. It is smaller and more secretive than the neighbouring beach of the Lavandou.

label: Médiathèque Simonne et Jean Lacouture
comment: The library, originally an association, became in September 2007 a municipal media library installed in renovated premises, route de la Fontaine, on nearly 300 m².
shortDescription: The library, originally an association, became in September 2007 a municipal media library installed in renovated premises, route de la Fontaine, on nearly 300 m².

label: Col de Castillon - Site de l’ancien village
comment: Col de Castillon. Site of two ancient villages of Castillon, with the remains of the old church. A loop allows to make the tour of the old village. Magnificent panoramic view. Starting point of hikes and pass appreciated by cyclists.
shortDescription: Col de Castillon. Site of two ancient villages of Castillon, with the remains of the old church. A loop allows to make the tour of the old village. Magnificent panoramic view. Starting point of hikes and pass appreciated by cyclists.

label: La Balme des fées
comment: Butterfly farm ideally located in Malaussène, overlooking the Var valley.
shortDescription: Butterfly farm ideally located in Malaussène, overlooking the Var valley.

label: Hôtel de Rocher (Maison Reynaud de la Gardette)
comment: A beautiful doorway gives access to the interior of the building which houses a superb Provencal celling dated XVIIIth century.
shortDescription: A beautiful doorway gives access to the interior of the building which houses a superb Provencal celling dated XVIIIth century.

label: Cloitre de la Cathédrale
comment: The cloister is part of a Catholic ensemble, a beautiful architectural unit, built between the fifth and fourteenth century on the ancient city founded by Julius Caesar in 49 BC.
shortDescription: The cloister is part of a Catholic ensemble, a beautiful architectural unit, built between the fifth and fourteenth century on the ancient city founded by Julius Caesar in 49 BC.

label: Calanque du Fournas
comment:
The calanque du Fournas is located between the calanque of Santa-Lucia and the beach of La Péguière on the coastal path.
Composed of pebbles and shaded thanks to the various pines which border it, it is a calm beach and little frequented even in summer.
shortDescription:
The calanque du Fournas is located between the calanque of Santa-Lucia and the beach of La Péguière on the coastal path.
Composed of pebbles and shaded thanks to the various pines which border it, it is a calm beach and little frequented even in summer.

label: Musée de Préhistoire des Gorges du Verdon
comment: Located in Quinson, in the heart of the Verdon, the Gorges du Verdon Museum of Prehistory presents the results of archaeological digs carried out in the Verdon for over 50 years.  Designed by the architect Norman Foster, the museum is one of the biggest Musuem of Prehistory in Europe.
shortDescription: Located in Quinson, in the heart of the Verdon, the Gorges du Verdon Museum of Prehistory presents the results of archaeological digs carried out in the Verdon for over 50 years.  Designed by the architect Norman Foster, the museum is one of the biggest Musuem of Prehistory in Europe.

label: MAB - Musée Jean Aicard / Paulin-Bertrand
comment: Installed in the family home "Les Lauriers Roses" of the poet and novelist Jean Aicard, this museum presents the daily universe of the writer: books, souvenirs, personal objects, drawings left intact in the office and the library.
shortDescription: Installed in the family home "Les Lauriers Roses" of the poet and novelist Jean Aicard, this museum presents the daily universe of the writer: books, souvenirs, personal objects, drawings left intact in the office and the library.
streetAddress: ['705 avenue du 8 mai 1945', 'Villa les lauriers roses']

label: Musée Municipal de Sault
comment:
The museum was founded in 1859 by Henri Chrestian. The items go through the span of the four periods of history of France on the local scale except the mummy brought from Egypt by an inhabitant from Sault. The museum contains also  fossils and a mineralogical collection.
Open from July 1 to August 31 from Monday to Saturday 3:00 p.m - 6:00 p.m
shortDescription:
The museum was founded in 1859 by Henri Chrestian. The items go through the span of the four periods of history of France on the local scale except the mummy brought from Egypt by an inhabitant from Sault. The museum contains also  fossils and a mineralogical collection.
Open from July 1 to August 31 from Monday to Saturday 3:00 p.m - 6:00 p.m

label: Fort de Mont-Alban
comment: Perched at a height of 222 metres, Fort Mont Alban attests to the city of Nice's past. Nowadays, it offers a spectacular panorama of the entire Côte d'Azur, from the Italian Riviera to the Estérel Massif.
shortDescription: Perched at a height of 222 metres, Fort Mont Alban attests to the city of Nice's past. Nowadays, it offers a spectacular panorama of the entire Côte d'Azur, from the Italian Riviera to the Estérel Massif.

label: Maison du Terroir et du Patrimoine
comment: In the heart of the Provençal village of La Cadière d´Azur in the Var, a 16th century chapel, recently restored, house "Maison du Terroir et du Patrimoine" (MTP) of the Community of Agglomeration Sud Sainte Baume.
shortDescription: In the heart of the Provençal village of La Cadière d´Azur in the Var, a 16th century chapel, recently restored, house "Maison du Terroir et du Patrimoine" (MTP) of the Community of Agglomeration Sud Sainte Baume.

shortDescription: The Puimichel observatory offers evenings of stargazing

label: Ecomusée du Cheminot Veynois
comment:
The 'L'écomusée du Cheminot Veynois' retraces the railway history of Veynes and offers an immersion in the world of railways, from 1850 to the present day.

Collection of railway equipment, reconstructions and films. Railway garden.
shortDescription:
The 'L'écomusée du Cheminot Veynois' retraces the railway history of Veynes and offers an immersion in the world of railways, from 1850 to the present day.

Collection of railway equipment, reconstructions and films. Railway garden.

comment:
TEMPORARY CLOSURE OF PUBLIC VISITS
As the health safety requirements following the COVID-19 pandemic
pandemic cannot be guaranteed for the reception of the public,
the public visits will remain closed during the summer and autumn of 2021

label: Eglise Paroissiale Sainte Marguerite
comment: Former chapel of the 13th century, enlarged in the 15th century, and redesigned in the 17th century. Inside, several interesting elements including a copy of Michelangelo's "Last Judgment" reduced 54 times. This church is part of the "Baroque Road".
shortDescription: Former chapel of the 13th century, enlarged in the 15th century, and redesigned in the 17th century. Inside, several interesting elements including a copy of Michelangelo's "Last Judgment" reduced 54 times. This church is part of the "Baroque Road".

label: Musée du santon
comment: Collection of Provencal santons in terracotta and raw clay, as well as international cribs in wood, glass, wax... collection of dressed santons illustrating the old trades of yesteryear.
shortDescription: Collection of Provencal santons in terracotta and raw clay, as well as international cribs in wood, glass, wax... collection of dressed santons illustrating the old trades of yesteryear.

comment: Beach restaurant and snack bar at La Petite Afrique.
shortDescription: Beach restaurant and snack bar at La Petite Afrique.
streetAddress: ['Plage de la petite Afrique', 'Port de plaisance']

label: Église Sainte-Madeleine au Vieil Eyguians
comment: Situated below the village, under the ramparts, and devoid of gutters, the church has always suffered from the permanent dampness that eats away at its ornamental coverings.
shortDescription: Situated below the village, under the ramparts, and devoid of gutters, the church has always suffered from the permanent dampness that eats away at its ornamental coverings.

label: Les fortifications d'Aubignan
comment: To be discovered in freedom with the lectern as a support.
shortDescription: To be discovered in freedom with the lectern as a support.

label: Cucuron
comment: Cucuron is a Provencal village of 2000 inhabitants. Boasting 300 days of sunshine a year, this is a magnificent base for exploring the Luberon South Side
shortDescription: Cucuron is a Provencal village of 2000 inhabitants. Boasting 300 days of sunshine a year, this is a magnificent base for exploring the Luberon South Side

label: Le Chemin de la Mémoire - La Navale
comment: Course museum of a dozen panels dedicated to the memory of the shipyards of La Seyne departing from the Shipyard gate to the bascule bridge.
shortDescription: Course museum of a dozen panels dedicated to the memory of the shipyards of La Seyne departing from the Shipyard gate to the bascule bridge.

label: Le mur de la peste
comment: The Plaque Wall testifies to the "Great Plague" that was the cause of 126,000 deaths in Provence (more than 20% of the population of the Comtat). It is estimated that the epidemic went forward 45 kilometers per month.
shortDescription: The Plaque Wall testifies to the "Great Plague" that was the cause of 126,000 deaths in Provence (more than 20% of the population of the Comtat). It is estimated that the epidemic went forward 45 kilometers per month.

label: Jardin Alexandre 1er
comment: Located in the city centre, it is an integral part of the new Chalucet Creativity and Knowledge district, where the media library, the School of Fine Arts, the Kedge and Camondo schools are located.
shortDescription: Located in the city centre, it is an integral part of the new Chalucet Creativity and Knowledge district, where the media library, the School of Fine Arts, the Kedge and Camondo schools are located.

label: Plage Vegaluna
comment: The Vegaluna private beach is the must-see beach of Cannes la Croisette, which will seduce you with its relaxed atmosphere and its setting that skillfully combines sobriety, trendiness, elegance and family spirit.
shortDescription: The Vegaluna private beach is the must-see beach of Cannes la Croisette, which will seduce you with its relaxed atmosphere and its setting that skillfully combines sobriety, trendiness, elegance and family spirit.

label: Linteaux sculptés
comment: All along the pedestrian street (rue de France and rue Cotta), magnificent lintels dating from the 17th and 18th centuries decorate the entrance doors of period bourgeois houses
shortDescription: All along the pedestrian street (rue de France and rue Cotta), magnificent lintels dating from the 17th and 18th centuries decorate the entrance doors of period bourgeois houses

shortDescription: Located on the path going up to Les Crotté, there remains today only a wall of this site.

label: Chapelle Notre-Dame de Pitié
comment: The chapel of Our Lady of Pity, located away from the town centre, dates from the 17th century.
shortDescription: The chapel of Our Lady of Pity, located away from the town centre, dates from the 17th century.

label: Pont des Tuves
comment: Genoese bridge, restored several times, which crosses the river Siagne and has a very beautiful look. It was for a long time the only passage between Montauroux and St Cézaire sur Siagne.
shortDescription: Genoese bridge, restored several times, which crosses the river Siagne and has a very beautiful look. It was for a long time the only passage between Montauroux and St Cézaire sur Siagne.

shortDescription: Entrechaux is dominated by its medieval castle. The village is at the intersection of the Route des Princes d’Orange, the Toulourenc and Ouvèze rivers.

label: La Tour d'Aigues
comment: Bordered by the Luberon and the Durance, La Tour d’Aigues is located in the heart of the Pays d’Aigues. Its name relates to water, “aïgo” in Provençal, particularly water coming from Aix: South Luberon was called Pays d’Aix (Pagus Aquensis).
shortDescription: Bordered by the Luberon and the Durance, La Tour d’Aigues is located in the heart of the Pays d’Aigues. Its name relates to water, “aïgo” in Provençal, particularly water coming from Aix: South Luberon was called Pays d’Aix (Pagus Aquensis).

shortDescription: Exhibition of old machines (SNCF historic steam and electric locomotives, trams, old cars). Presentation of  the history of the SNCF railway line at Col de Tende.

Tuesdays and Fridays from 14h to 17h.

shortDescription: Situated on the Gabriel Péri squarewhich was, under the Ancien Régime (before the French Revolution of 1792), the main square of the village of Ramatuelle.

label: Eglise Saint Victor

shortDescription: Trans en Provence church is dedicated to Saint Victor. Built in the XIIIth century, it was surrounded by the churchyard.

label: Parc Castel des deux Rois
comment: For some fine family activities, go to the Parc Castel des Deux Rois on the Mont Alban hill. Children's attractions, a change of scene for parents, all with a magical view over the entire city of Nice.
shortDescription: For some fine family activities, go to the Parc Castel des Deux Rois on the Mont Alban hill. Children's attractions, a change of scene for parents, all with a magical view over the entire city of Nice.

shortDescription: Lending library of books to the curists.

label: Centre International d'Art Contemporain
comment: Last born of the art centres of the Alpes-Maritimes, the Vieux Château de Carros has become a place of cultural and international exchanges. High-level exhibitions and retrospectives and a programme widely open to the world.
shortDescription: Last born of the art centres of the Alpes-Maritimes, the Vieux Château de Carros has become a place of cultural and international exchanges. High-level exhibitions and retrospectives and a programme widely open to the world.

label: Plage du Rossignol
comment: This beach pays handsome tribute to the song of the bird after which it is named. Holidaymakers at Rossignol beach, set in the intimacy of a wild creek, may enjoy sunbathing.
shortDescription: This beach pays handsome tribute to the song of the bird after which it is named. Holidaymakers at Rossignol beach, set in the intimacy of a wild creek, may enjoy sunbathing.

label: Jardin public : Parc du Pian
comment: The Parc du Pian, listed in the Inventory of Historic Monuments since 1955, is an exceptional olive grove laid out in terraces facing the sea. 540 olive trees, some of which are several hundred years old, flourish on an area of 3 hectares.
shortDescription: The Parc du Pian, listed in the Inventory of Historic Monuments since 1955, is an exceptional olive grove laid out in terraces facing the sea. 540 olive trees, some of which are several hundred years old, flourish on an area of 3 hectares.

label: Musée Promenade
comment: The Musée-Promenade is the interpretation centre of the UNESCO Geopark of Haute-Provence. Visitors stroll through a large shady park where paths and streams cross and where waterfalls and contemporary artworks build an enchanting setting.
shortDescription: The Musée-Promenade is the interpretation centre of the UNESCO Geopark of Haute-Provence. Visitors stroll through a large shady park where paths and streams cross and where waterfalls and contemporary artworks build an enchanting setting.

label: Bibliothèque - médiathèque de Rosans
comment:
The Rosans media library is located in the heart of the village.
Free loan for 3 weeks of books, DVDs, CDs.
Passage of the bookmobile of the departmental lending library, twice a year
Wifi in free access.
shortDescription:
The Rosans media library is located in the heart of the village.
Free loan for 3 weeks of books, DVDs, CDs.

label: Visan
comment: Highland of the Popes since 1344, Visan, a fortified town leaning onto an amphitheatre of warm and colored hills, dominates a plain which spreads out its cultures into a beautiful sunset. Its winding streets, bordered with mansions dating from the XVIIth and XVIIIth centuries, attract you with their balance and beauty. The landscape around the village is full of harmonious compositions of brilliant pinewood of Alep and an infinite land of vineyards lit by sunbeams.
shortDescription: Highland of the Popes since 1344, Visan, a fortified town leaning onto an amphitheatre of warm and colored hills, dominates a plain which spreads out its cultures into a beautiful sunset. Its winding streets, bordered with mansions dating from the XVIIth and XVIIIth centuries, attract you with their balance and beauty. The landscape around the village is full of harmonious compositions of brilliant pinewood of Alep and an infinite land of vineyards lit by sunbeams.

label: Eglise  Saint Michel
comment: Catholic church.
shortDescription: Catholic church.

label: Parc du Château
comment: With its hundred-year-old trees, its rich palm grove, its lake and the contemporary sculptures spread all around, this botanical garden is not only a real open-air museum ideal for relaxation but also a setting for numerous cultural events.
shortDescription: With its hundred-year-old trees, its rich palm grove, its lake and the contemporary sculptures spread all around, this botanical garden is not only a real open-air museum ideal for relaxation but also a setting for numerous cultural events.

comment:
Museum open all year round by appointment.
Minerals and fossils.
shortDescription:
Museum open all year round by appointment.
Minerals and fossils.

shortDescription: Main place in the village of Grimaud.

comment: Open Mondays and Fridays from 5 to 6.30 pm.
shortDescription: Open Mondays and Fridays from 5 to 6.30 pm.

label: Valréas
comment: Important city in the Papal States, Valréas has kept from its past a rich heritage : nearly a thousand years of history to be discovered, with some exceptional events, a prestigious wine, and an important economic and touristic activity. An eco-friendly holiday place, a town in bloom, the capital of the Enclave with a population of 10 000 inhabitants, is a regional economic pole.
shortDescription: Important city in the Papal States, Valréas has kept from its past a rich heritage : nearly a thousand years of history to be discovered, with some exceptional events, a prestigious wine, and an important economic and touristic activity. An eco-friendly holiday place, a town in bloom, the capital of the Enclave with a population of 10 000 inhabitants, is a regional economic pole.

label: Stèle des combattants de la guerre d'Indochine
comment: Stele in homage to the veterans of the Indochina War (1945-1954)
shortDescription: Stele in homage to the veterans of the Indochina War (1945-1954)

label: Villelaure
comment: Stop in our village, it's fun exploring a maze of narrow streets, a multitude of ancient houses, fountains, the church and its place,
shortDescription: Stop in our village, it's fun exploring a maze of narrow streets, a multitude of ancient houses, fountains, the church and its place,

label: Fort de Saint-Ours Haut
comment: Saint-Ours Haut Fort, together with Roche-la-Croix, blocked off the road leading to the Col de Larche mountain pass - a role that both forts performed very successfully in June 1940, before the Armistice.
shortDescription: Saint-Ours Haut Fort, together with Roche-la-Croix, blocked off the road leading to the Col de Larche mountain pass - a role that both forts performed very successfully in June 1940, before the Armistice.

label: Plage de la Garde Vieille
comment: Fine gravel beach extending for about 60 meters. On the left there are some trees with a natural pool.
shortDescription: Fine gravel beach extending for about 60 meters. On the left there are some trees with a natural pool.

label: Plage du Layet
comment: Tucked away in a cove, Le Layet is a little beach reserved for naturist. An exceptional site well away from prying eyes…
shortDescription: Tucked away in a cove, Le Layet is a little beach reserved for naturist. An exceptional site well away from prying eyes…

label: Médiathèque de La Condamine-Châtelard
comment:
The media library invites discovery, entertainment, intellectual awakening and intergenerational encounters.

2 rooms for adults and children. Reading area.

Free subscription.
shortDescription:
The media library invites discovery, entertainment, intellectual awakening and intergenerational encounters.

2 rooms for adults and children. Reading area.

Free subscription.

comment:
Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
internationally recognized, which imagines a project combining contemporary art
and safeguarding rural heritage in the protected territory of the Haute-Provence Geopark, around Digne les Bains.
shortDescription:
Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
internationally recognized, which imagines a project combining contemporary art
and safeguarding rural heritage in the protected territory of the Haute-Provence Geopark, around Digne les Bains.

label: Bibliothèque municipale  Pauline Roland
comment:
Access to the public library is free. To enrol you will need an ID card or passport, proof of where you are staying and parental permission for children under 14.
membership is free for local residents, non locals and holiday makers. Internet Fre WifiA...
shortDescription:
Access to the public library is free. To enrol you will need an ID card or passport, proof of where you are staying and parental permission for children under 14.
membership is free for local residents, non locals and holiday makers. Internet Fre WifiA...

label: Parc et Jardin du Château de Brantes
comment:
The Domaine de Brantes, in Sorgues was created by the Del Bianco family in 1619. The Del Bianco family came from Florence and settled in Avignon where they were assigned as paymaster for the pontifical troops.  
The first hot-air balloon took off from this estate in 1784.
shortDescription:
The Domaine de Brantes, in Sorgues was created by the Del Bianco family in 1619. The Del Bianco family came from Florence and settled in Avignon where they were assigned as paymaster for the pontifical troops.  
The first hot-air balloon took off from this estate in 1784.

label: Village perché de Tende
comment: A partire dal Medioevo, le case furono costruite sul versante sud, con vista sulla Roya. Il villaggio attuale ha conservato la sua caratteristica disposizione medievale, con strade che corrono parallele al pendio, collegate da vicoli perpendicolari, i "carugiu".
shortDescription: A partire dal Medioevo, le case furono costruite sul versante sud, con vista sulla Roya. Il villaggio attuale ha conservato la sua caratteristica disposizione medievale, con strade che corrono parallele al pendio, collegate da vicoli perpendicolari, i "carugiu".

label: Rue des Maures
comment: Formerly called rue des Maugo, the Provencal name for mauve. It is found in the land register of 1830 under the name rue des Mauves.
shortDescription: Formerly called rue des Maugo, the Provencal name for mauve. It is found in the land register of 1830 under the name rue des Mauves.

label: Bibliothèque  Multimédia
comment:
Nicole is there to welcome you and advise you.
Large choice of books : novels, comics, regional books, history books, books on nature,... for adults.
Very nice library for children.
A large choice of DVD.
shortDescription:
Nicole is there to welcome you and advise you.
Large choice of books : novels, comics, regional books, history books, books on nature,... for adults.
Very nice library for children.
A large choice of DVD.

label: Grillon
comment: Former limit of the northern Papal State, two towers dominate the impressive and massive city walls : the belfry is surmounted with a wrought iron bell and the church bell tower fitted with an octagonal arrow made of stone.
shortDescription: Former limit of the northern Papal State, two towers dominate the impressive and massive city walls : the belfry is surmounted with a wrought iron bell and the church bell tower fitted with an octagonal arrow made of stone.

label: La ferme agriculturelle
comment: An urban & organic micro-farm, the agricultural movement is launched!
shortDescription: An urban & organic micro-farm, the agricultural movement is launched!
streetAddress: ['Chemin de la Projette', 'Ile de la Barthelasse']

label: Moydans
comment: Le Risou dominates the valley from a height of 1,181 m, with its perched rock and chapel at the summit dedicated to Saint John the Baptist. At the foot, the village Moydans has existed since the 18th century.
shortDescription: Le Risou dominates the valley from a height of 1,181 m, with its perched rock and chapel at the summit dedicated to Saint John the Baptist. At the foot, the village Moydans has existed since the 18th century.

label: Village primitif
comment: The primitive village was built on the rocky spur and bordered by the Combe ravine. This group of dwellings on the west side and their rafters were part of the defence system. To the south, the only gate of the primitive village, the Portalet.
shortDescription: The primitive village was built on the rocky spur and bordered by the Combe ravine. This group of dwellings on the west side and their rafters were part of the defence system. To the south, the only gate of the primitive village, the Portalet.

label: Les ruines de la Vière
comment: In the heart of the village of Esparron-de-Verdon, engulfed under ivy and hackberry trees, hide the ruins of the historical centre of the village: the ruins of Vière.
shortDescription: In the heart of the village of Esparron-de-Verdon, engulfed under ivy and hackberry trees, hide the ruins of the historical centre of the village: the ruins of Vière.

label: Collégiale Saint Pierre
comment:
Listed historic monument. Only remnant of the old
town of Six Fours. Part Romanesque from the XIth century and enlarged in 1608.
shortDescription:
Listed historic monument. Only remnant of the old
town of Six Fours. Part Romanesque from the XIth century and enlarged in 1608.

label: Bibliothéque de Sigottier
comment:
The Sigottier library is part of the departmental network of libraries.
The bookmobile passes every 6 months.
Loan of books.
shortDescription:
The Sigottier library is part of the departmental network of libraries.
The bookmobile passes every 6 months.
Loan of books.

label: Mine de Cuivre
comment: A few kilometres from Saint-Véran, as you go down the valley on the road to Clausis, you can see the remains of copper ore mining: the 45% rich bornite.
shortDescription: A few kilometres from Saint-Véran, as you go down the valley on the road to Clausis, you can see the remains of copper ore mining: the 45% rich bornite.

label: Plage de Fabrégas
comment:
To the south of the town, this cove with fine black sand is sheltered from the wind. It is popular with families because the water is shallow for quite a way out.

Away from the main road, there is a free car park close by.
shortDescription:
To the south of the town, this cove with fine black sand is sheltered from the wind. It is popular with families because the water is shallow for quite a way out.

Away from the main road, there is a free car park close by.

label: Méreuil
comment: Golden golds, scarlet boskop, juicy pears and golden apricots are on all the tables of Le Buëch, barely picked from their trees asleep under the generous sun of our hillsides.
shortDescription: Golden golds, scarlet boskop, juicy pears and golden apricots are on all the tables of Le Buëch, barely picked from their trees asleep under the generous sun of our hillsides.

label: Synagogue / Musée Juif Comtadin
comment: Located in the heart of the old "quarry", street in Provencal, the synagogue of a very great originality is remarkably preserved. The architectural formula of the Comtat synagogues, only preserved in Cavaillon and Carpentras, is unique in the world.
shortDescription: Located in the heart of the old "quarry", street in Provencal, the synagogue of a very great originality is remarkably preserved. The architectural formula of the Comtat synagogues, only preserved in Cavaillon and Carpentras, is unique in the world.

label: Jardin de Pied-Vaurias
comment: This remarkable site located at the western entrance to the town, at the foot of Valréas, is a wooded hill where families find a relaxing setting with games adapted for children.
shortDescription: This remarkable site located at the western entrance to the town, at the foot of Valréas, is a wooded hill where families find a relaxing setting with games adapted for children.

label: Promenade du Barri
comment: This walk is located on the old covered way ("bàrri" means rampart in Provencal).
shortDescription: This walk is located on the old covered way ("bàrri" means rampart in Provencal).

label: Plan d'eau de Champbeau
comment: Situated in a green setting with a shaded lawn at the exit of the village towards Sisteron, the lake has a water slide, a central diving board, children's games, a small bowls and football pitch, picnic tables...
shortDescription: Situated in a green setting with a shaded lawn at the exit of the village towards Sisteron, the lake has a water slide, a central diving board, children's games, a small bowls and football pitch, picnic tables...

label: Village de Marcoux
comment: The village of Marcoux is built on "taps", black marls.
shortDescription: The village of Marcoux is built on "taps", black marls.

label: Ruhl Plage
comment: Ruhl Plage welcomes you to our sun-drenched terraces, lounge and sea-view restaurant in the heart of the capital of the Côte d'Azur.  We have a range of services, always to the highest standards.  80 private cabins with showers are available.
shortDescription: Ruhl Plage welcomes you to our sun-drenched terraces, lounge and sea-view restaurant in the heart of the capital of the Côte d'Azur.  We have a range of services, always to the highest standards.  80 private cabins with showers are available.
streetAddress: ["(Face à l'hôtel Méridien)", '1 Promenade des Anglais']

label: Église Saint Jean-Baptiste
comment: Built in 1668, it collapsed in 1698 and was rebuilt from 1729 on according to the plans of Pierre Sénès. The church was devastated and its furniture destroyed in 1793 during the siege of Toulon.
shortDescription: Built in 1668, it collapsed in 1698 and was rebuilt from 1729 on according to the plans of Pierre Sénès. The church was devastated and its furniture destroyed in 1793 during the siege of Toulon.

label: Pierre de l'Escourenche
comment: Rites are sometimes attached to marriage or motherhood, as here.
shortDescription: Rites are sometimes attached to marriage or motherhood, as here.

label: Eglise Saint Joseph
comment: This XVIth century church is remarkable for its ogival arches, its unique nave as well its two chapels. Listed as an historic monument, it shelters several outstanding sculptures as well as XVIth and XVIIth century paintings.
shortDescription: This XVIth century church is remarkable for its ogival arches, its unique nave as well its two chapels. Listed as an historic monument, it shelters several outstanding sculptures as well as XVIth and XVIIth century paintings.

label: Domaine Saint-Jacques du Couloubrier
comment:
The Saint-Jacques du Couloubrier estate is considered as a reference for
typical Grasse landscape.
shortDescription:
The Saint-Jacques du Couloubrier estate is considered as a reference for
typical Grasse landscape.

label: Plage de Pardigon
comment:
This fine sandy beach located on a natural and protected coastline is a very good windsurfing spot.
·	 Free volleyball court.
·	 Catering nearby
·	 Disabled access.
shortDescription:
This fine sandy beach located on a natural and protected coastline is a very good windsurfing spot.
·	 Free volleyball court.
·	 Catering nearby
·	 Disabled access.

label: Château du Barroux
comment: The construction of the Renaissance-style castle was ordered by Henri de Rovilhasc. Built between 1539 and 1544 the final appearance was exactly as it is today.
shortDescription: The construction of the Renaissance-style castle was ordered by Henri de Rovilhasc. Built between 1539 and 1544 the final appearance was exactly as it is today.

label: Les jardins de Vives-Eaux
comment: Botanical garden of aromatic and medicinal plants, library, exhibitions, animations...
shortDescription: Botanical garden of aromatic and medicinal plants, library, exhibitions, animations...

label: Le jardin romain de Caumont-sur-Durance
comment: See the biggest pool which existed in Gaul - 65 m long - in the heart of the garden of Roman inspiration.
shortDescription: See the biggest pool which existed in Gaul - 65 m long - in the heart of the garden of Roman inspiration.

label: Musée archéologique de Fréjus
comment: The Museum hosts temporary exhibitions presenting the results of excavations at historic sites.
shortDescription: The Museum hosts temporary exhibitions presenting the results of excavations at historic sites.

label: La place de l'Ange
comment: In the 1900s, an elm tree shaded the square. Many small shops surrounded it. The houses of the notables were already quite degraded but people still went to fetch water from the old fountain...
shortDescription: In the 1900s, an elm tree shaded the square. Many small shops surrounded it. The houses of the notables were already quite degraded but people still went to fetch water from the old fountain...

label: Mausolée de la Chèvre d'or
comment: Classified Historical Monument in 1943, this building dates from the time when the Romans lived on the lands biotoises. This mausoleum, a legacy of the Gallo-Roman civilization, owes its name to an ancient legend.
shortDescription: Classified Historical Monument in 1943, this building dates from the time when the Romans lived on the lands biotoises. This mausoleum, a legacy of the Gallo-Roman civilization, owes its name to an ancient legend.

label: Plage de Passable (sous-concédée)
comment: Facing the bay of Villefranche, the Plage de Passage is a mythical spot on Cap-Ferrat with its lush vegetation.
shortDescription: Facing the bay of Villefranche, the Plage de Passage is a mythical spot on Cap-Ferrat with its lush vegetation.

label: La Maison du Soleil
comment: Unique in France! This scientific center is dedicated to the observation of the Sun and the understanding of its relationship with our environment.
shortDescription: Unique in France! This scientific center is dedicated to the observation of the Sun and the understanding of its relationship with our environment.

label: Sorbiers
comment: Sorbiers is a small Provencal village that houses the vestiges of a 17th century château that is unusual in having conserved five rows of Genoise tiles.
shortDescription: Sorbiers is a small Provencal village that houses the vestiges of a 17th century château that is unusual in having conserved five rows of Genoise tiles.

label: Eglise paroissiale Saint-Georges
comment:
Of the old church, destroyed in 1390 by Raimond de Turenne then in 1574
by the baron of Germany, only two pillars and a dedication of 1539
dedication of 1539.
shortDescription:
Of the old church, destroyed in 1390 by Raimond de Turenne then in 1574
by the baron of Germany, only two pillars and a dedication of 1539
dedication of 1539.

label: Plaque en mémoire de Damase Arbaud
comment: This marble plaque was erected on 30 May 1976 in memory of Damase Arbaud (1814-1876), doctor, historian and Mayor of Manosque from 1843 to 1848.
shortDescription: This marble plaque was erected on 30 May 1976 in memory of Damase Arbaud (1814-1876), doctor, historian and Mayor of Manosque from 1843 to 1848.

label: Plage de Cavalière
comment: This long stretch of fine sand fringed by the pine trees of Cavalière caters to all tastes : windsurfing, badminton, pedaloes, volleyball, diving, parascending, water skiing, jet-skiing, catamaran, ect… The choice is yours !
shortDescription: This long stretch of fine sand fringed by the pine trees of Cavalière caters to all tastes : windsurfing, badminton, pedaloes, volleyball, diving, parascending, water skiing, jet-skiing, catamaran, ect… The choice is yours !

label: Eglise Saint Louis
comment:
A mix of Romanesque and Gothic styles, this thirteenth century building offers a beautiful display of 19th c.
stained-glass windows produced by the Metz-based Maréchal workshop.
shortDescription:
A mix of Romanesque and Gothic styles, this thirteenth century building offers a beautiful display of 19th c.
stained-glass windows produced by the Metz-based Maréchal workshop.

label: Mausolée aux insurgés
comment: This mausoleum-rotunda, built in 1885, houses the remains of the Var phalanx that was martyred in the 1851 coup d'état led by Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte.
shortDescription: This mausoleum-rotunda, built in 1885, houses the remains of the Var phalanx that was martyred in the 1851 coup d'état led by Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte.

label: Parc Thérèse Cazelles
comment: Seaside wooded park in Les Issambres.
shortDescription: Seaside wooded park in Les Issambres.

label: Les noms des rues des soldats
comment: Oraison is one of the only cities in France to have all its streets in the city centre with names of people who died during the first and second world wars.
shortDescription: Oraison is one of the only cities in France to have all its streets in the city centre with names of people who died during the first and second world wars.

label: Bibliothèque municipale Roger Frison-Roche
comment: Municipal library
shortDescription: Municipal library

label: Ancienne église Notre Dame de Nazareth et sa tour hexagonale
comment: Notre-Dame-de-Nazareth was built in the 13th century.
shortDescription: Notre-Dame-de-Nazareth was built in the 13th century.

label: Musées en vitrine
comment:
Exhibitions on the themes of Provence, the life of the past, the customs, the know-how of our elders.
Christmas theme
Some themes present clothes, objects, tools, festivals, ceremonies
The windows change regularly
shortDescription:
Exhibitions on the themes of Provence, the life of the past, the customs, the know-how of our elders.
Christmas theme
Some themes present clothes, objects, tools, festivals, ceremonies
