label: Galimard
comment: Perfumery founded in Grasse in 1747. Free guided tour of our Museum, perfume creation workshops.
shortDescription: Perfumery founded in Grasse in 1747. Free guided tour of our Museum, perfume creation workshops.

label: Hôtel de Tingry
comment: This elegant 18th century residence was built by Joseph Balthazard des Laurents. It has a beautiful porch and its courtyard was once paved with pebbles from the Durance.
shortDescription: This elegant 18th century residence was built by Joseph Balthazard des Laurents. It has a beautiful porch and its courtyard was once paved with pebbles from the Durance.

label: Jardin Maria Serena
comment: The garden around the villa is an invitation to exoticism. Reputed to be the most temperate in France, it houses a large collection of palm trees, a Dracaena Drago and a collection of Cycadaceae. At the foot of the cliffs of the Italian border
shortDescription: The garden around the villa is an invitation to exoticism. Reputed to be the most temperate in France, it houses a large collection of palm trees, a Dracaena Drago and a collection of Cycadaceae. At the foot of the cliffs of the Italian border

label: Sommet du Laquina
comment: Located on the Lambert Plateau in the Collobrières Hills.
shortDescription: Located on the Lambert Plateau in the Collobrières Hills.

label: Abbaye Notre-Dame de l’Annonciation
comment: Born of the desire to lead the Benedictine life in the wake of Dom Gérard, founder of Sainte-Madeleine du Barroux, the community counts nearly thirty nuns, who follow the Rule of St Benedict in a life of prayer and work withdrawn from the world.
shortDescription: Born of the desire to lead the Benedictine life in the wake of Dom Gérard, founder of Sainte-Madeleine du Barroux, the community counts nearly thirty nuns, who follow the Rule of St Benedict in a life of prayer and work withdrawn from the world.

label: Oratoire Notre-Dame des Sources
comment: Statue in a cave-like rock cavity
shortDescription: Statue in a cave-like rock cavity
streetAddress: ['Hameau de Viévola', 'Intersection de la RD6204 et de la balise 359, au niveau de la Madone de Viévola']

label: Eglise Saint-Antoine
comment: A small church dating from 1688, it has been renovated many times over the past centuries.
shortDescription: A small church dating from 1688, it has been renovated many times over the past centuries.

label: Monument aux morts
comment: Memorial to the men of Les Salles sur Verdon who died during the First World War (1914-1918)
shortDescription: Memorial to the men of Les Salles sur Verdon who died during the First World War (1914-1918)

label: Gibet du Mont Justicier
comment: Since the Middle Ages, Mont Justicier has been the place where the condemned were executed. The gallows consisted of two pilasters joined by a horizontal beam. One of these shafts still remains, the other has been reduced to a stump.
shortDescription: Since the Middle Ages, Mont Justicier has been the place where the condemned were executed. The gallows consisted of two pilasters joined by a horizontal beam. One of these shafts still remains, the other has been reduced to a stump.

label: Plage de la Fossette
comment: A little strip of sand tucked in between two rocky headlands, La Fossette possesses the discret charm of the desert islands of our dreams, but is far more accessible than its counterparts in the Pacific! What bliss to lounge on the beach, lulled by soothing sound of the waves.
shortDescription: A little strip of sand tucked in between two rocky headlands, La Fossette possesses the discret charm of the desert islands of our dreams, but is far more accessible than its counterparts in the Pacific! What bliss to lounge on the beach, lulled by soothing sound of the waves.

label: Maison Musée et Chemin de ronde
comment: The Maison Musée is a bourgeois house from the early 20th century opening onto the covered way and its towers, fitted out as an exhibition space, and a garden area. An emotional visit, for young and old.
shortDescription: The Maison Musée is a bourgeois house from the early 20th century opening onto the covered way and its towers, fitted out as an exhibition space, and a garden area. An emotional visit, for young and old.

label: Chapelle ND de Jérusalem dite chapelle Cocteau
comment: The last chapel designed by Jean Cocteau
shortDescription: The last chapel designed by Jean Cocteau

label: Château du Marquis de Sade
comment: In 2001, Pierre Cardin bought the Château du Marquis de Sade and undertook major work to consolidate and secure the site. Since then, the courtyard of the Château and its adjoining quarries have hosted an annual music and theatre festival.
shortDescription: In 2001, Pierre Cardin bought the Château du Marquis de Sade and undertook major work to consolidate and secure the site. Since then, the courtyard of the Château and its adjoining quarries have hosted an annual music and theatre festival.

label: Les Unités de Camping
comment:
The result of an exchange between Le Corbusier and Robert Rebutato, these 5 camping units built in 1956 are minimum recreational habitats inspired by the architect's Cabanon.
Booking Mandatory.
shortDescription:
The result of an exchange between Le Corbusier and Robert Rebutato, these 5 camping units built in 1956 are minimum recreational habitats inspired by the architect's Cabanon.
Booking Mandatory.

label: Le Village fortifié et les portails de l'enceinte médiévale
comment: Discover the walls of the ancient medieval city of La Turbie by strolling through the medieval streets of the village.
shortDescription: Discover the walls of the ancient medieval city of La Turbie by strolling through the medieval streets of the village.

label: Mémorial du Rhône et Cimetière Américain
comment:
A unique place where you can learn about lives of the ‘Americans in Provence’ 
Free guided tours are available – please call beforehand to make a reservation.
shortDescription:
A unique place where you can learn about lives of the ‘Americans in Provence’ 
Free guided tours are available – please call beforehand to make a reservation.

label: La Batterie Napoléonienne
comment: Under the Cape Camarat, stone remains of a Napoleonic battery, reflect the coastal defense against possible attacks by the sea at the time of the blockade of 1804.
shortDescription: Under the Cape Camarat, stone remains of a Napoleonic battery, reflect the coastal defense against possible attacks by the sea at the time of the blockade of 1804.

label: Refuge d'Art "La Ferme Belon"
comment:
Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
internationally recognized, which imagines a project combining contemporary art
and safeguarding rural heritage in the protected territory of the Haute-Provence Geopark, around Digne les Bains.
shortDescription:
Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
internationally recognized, which imagines a project combining contemporary art
and safeguarding rural heritage in the protected territory of the Haute-Provence Geopark, around Digne les Bains.

label: Ecomusée sous-marin de Cannes par Jason deCaires Taylor
comment: The sculptures of the Cannes underwater eco-museum, created by the famous British international artist Jason deCaires Taylor, a great fan of the city, took their place a few dozen metres from the shore of the island of Sainte-Marguerite.
shortDescription: The sculptures of the Cannes underwater eco-museum, created by the famous British international artist Jason deCaires Taylor, a great fan of the city, took their place a few dozen metres from the shore of the island of Sainte-Marguerite.

label: Village de Roaix
comment: The wine-making village of Roaix, clinging to a hillside, is recognized for the quality of its wine, today produced under Côtes du Rhône Villages appellation.
shortDescription: The wine-making village of Roaix, clinging to a hillside, is recognized for the quality of its wine, today produced under Côtes du Rhône Villages appellation.

label: Musée National de la Marine
comment: A true memory of the Arsenal, the National Museum of the Navy in Toulon recalls the place of the Navy in this war harbour and illustrates it with an exceptional collection of models ships.
shortDescription: A true memory of the Arsenal, the National Museum of the Navy in Toulon recalls the place of the Navy in this war harbour and illustrates it with an exceptional collection of models ships.

label: Piscine d'été de Saint-Auban
comment: Summer swimming pool in Saint Auban A unique innovating concept in France!  This place of recreation is sowed with grass green, the site is equipped with a chute, a massage seat, a rapid river and water cannons.
shortDescription: Summer swimming pool in Saint Auban A unique innovating concept in France!  This place of recreation is sowed with grass green, the site is equipped with a chute, a massage seat, a rapid river and water cannons.

label: Stèle Canadair Pélican 41
comment: Headstone in memory of the crew members who died on board of the Pelican 41 on March 8, 2004.
shortDescription: Headstone in memory of the crew members who died on board of the Pelican 41 on March 8, 2004.

label: Le château
comment: The Château d'Oraison was certainly built after the medieval period
shortDescription: The Château d'Oraison was certainly built after the medieval period

label: Site du Château et Jardin Médiéval
comment: Viewpoint perched on the side of a rocky spur, the remains of the medieval castle dominate Sainte-Agnès from the top of their 800 meters: from here one enjoys a magical 360° view of the bay of Menton, the Mediterranean sea and the mountains
shortDescription: Viewpoint perched on the side of a rocky spur, the remains of the medieval castle dominate Sainte-Agnès from the top of their 800 meters: from here one enjoys a magical 360° view of the bay of Menton, the Mediterranean sea and the mountains

label: Parc Chico Mendes
comment: The biggest public park in Avignon, with six hectares of parkland, located outside the city walls, in the Pont des Deux Eaux quarter.
shortDescription: The biggest public park in Avignon, with six hectares of parkland, located outside the city walls, in the Pont des Deux Eaux quarter.

label: Château de Lourmarin
comment: Listed historical monument since 1973.
shortDescription: Listed historical monument since 1973.

label: Château-Musée d'histoire naturelle
comment: At the top of the medieval village of Tourrette-Levens, in the tower of the castle, there is the Butterfly and Natural History Museum.
shortDescription: At the top of the medieval village of Tourrette-Levens, in the tower of the castle, there is the Butterfly and Natural History Museum.

label: Village provençal
comment: Birthplace of the great cook Auguste Escoffier, this small inland village has kept its authenticity. Very popular for its picnics on the banks of the Loup, its green spaces, its market gardens... and its food shops.
shortDescription: Birthplace of the great cook Auguste Escoffier, this small inland village has kept its authenticity. Very popular for its picnics on the banks of the Loup, its green spaces, its market gardens... and its food shops.

label: Eglise St François de Paule
comment: Built between 1744 and 1749, this magnificent church features a baroque curved and counter-curved "façade", typical of western Provencal religious architecture at the time. Listed monument.
shortDescription: Built between 1744 and 1749, this magnificent church features a baroque curved and counter-curved "façade", typical of western Provencal religious architecture at the time. Listed monument.

label: Jardin des heures
comment:
The former garden of the Observantine Convent, renamed the "Garden of the Hours",
has been redesigned and is accessible to visitors.
shortDescription:
The former garden of the Observantine Convent, renamed the "Garden of the Hours",
has been redesigned and is accessible to visitors.

label: L’Eglise Saint-Pierre aux Liens
comment: The Church of Saint Peter in Chains was rebuilt in 1840, on the same site a the primitive church, Notre-Dame des 7 Douleurs (Our Lady of the 7 Sorrows).
shortDescription: The Church of Saint Peter in Chains was rebuilt in 1840, on the same site a the primitive church, Notre-Dame des 7 Douleurs (Our Lady of the 7 Sorrows).

label: Promenade Adrien Beaumont
comment: Besides being a choice spot for strollers alongside San Peïre beach, the Promenade is the site of a Monday morning market as well as a bric-a-brac market (private and professional sellers) on Fridays between April and October, and a night market during the summer season.
shortDescription: Besides being a choice spot for strollers alongside San Peïre beach, the Promenade is the site of a Monday morning market as well as a bric-a-brac market (private and professional sellers) on Fridays between April and October, and a night market during the summer season.

label: Site de Vière à Ongles
comment: The origins of the Vière à Ongles site date back to the protohistoric period. It is on its tracks that a first village was probably established in the 12th century.
shortDescription: The origins of the Vière à Ongles site date back to the protohistoric period. It is on its tracks that a first village was probably established in the 12th century.

label: Le temple
comment: The temple has been open for worship since 1967. It is surmounted by a bell that Mr. and Mrs. Julian donated in September 2003.
shortDescription: The temple has been open for worship since 1967. It is surmounted by a bell that Mr. and Mrs. Julian donated in September 2003.

label: Village de Solliès-Ville
comment: The history of Solliès-Ville is very rich. Solliès-Ville was the principal fortified place of the region and played a major role in Provence’s history.
shortDescription: The history of Solliès-Ville is very rich. Solliès-Ville was the principal fortified place of the region and played a major role in Provence’s history.

label: Eglise Sainte Philomène
comment: 19th century classic church built in the heart of the old city centre.
shortDescription: 19th century classic church built in the heart of the old city centre.

label: Eglise Saint - Laurent
comment: Saint Laurent Church
shortDescription: Saint Laurent Church

label: Grotte de Sainte Marie Madeleine et circuit de la Sainte Baume
comment: After a climb of about 40 minutes along a winding path and up steps looking out on the life-size depiction of the Crucifixion of Jesus, you arrive at the esplanade of the cave, with an exceptionally beautiful panorama before you. The temperature inside is 13°C, in winter and summer. To the right of the cave entrance, against the rock face, is a seminary that is still active.
shortDescription: After a climb of about 40 minutes along a winding path and up steps looking out on the life-size depiction of the Crucifixion of Jesus, you arrive at the esplanade of the cave, with an exceptionally beautiful panorama before you. The temperature inside is 13°C, in winter and summer. To the right of the cave entrance, against the rock face, is a seminary that is still active.

label: La Ferme Béridon
comment: Come and discover, alone or in a group, a farm and its human, animal and natural environment.
shortDescription: Come and discover, alone or in a group, a farm and its human, animal and natural environment.

label: Plage du Festival
comment: The Festival Beach: a dream setting where the azure blue sea and the coconut palms combine to offer the most beautiful of moments.
shortDescription: The Festival Beach: a dream setting where the azure blue sea and the coconut palms combine to offer the most beautiful of moments.

label: Village de Puget-Rostang
comment: The medieval village of Puget-Rostang, perched on a rock at the confluence of the Mairola and Riou d'Auvare rivers, is built in a horseshoe around its keep.
shortDescription: The medieval village of Puget-Rostang, perched on a rock at the confluence of the Mairola and Riou d'Auvare rivers, is built in a horseshoe around its keep.

label: Hôtel Particulier Tavernier
comment: This private residence was that of Admiral Louis-François de Faucher" naval commander during the occupation of Corsica by France in 1764.
shortDescription: This private residence was that of Admiral Louis-François de Faucher" naval commander during the occupation of Corsica by France in 1764.

label: Musée de la Résistance
comment: Museum of the Resistance. Camping-cars area.   Drinks and postcards.
shortDescription: Museum of the Resistance. Camping-cars area.   Drinks and postcards.

label: Musée National Picasso "La Guerre et la Paix"
comment: The former Romanesque chapel of Vallauris Castle houses the National Picasso Museum "War and Peace", a monumental composition painted on isorel panels.
shortDescription: The former Romanesque chapel of Vallauris Castle houses the National Picasso Museum "War and Peace", a monumental composition painted on isorel panels.

label: Eglise Saint Laurent
comment:
Beautiful 14th-15th-century church and sundials.

The church is a listed historic monument with a lovely Lombard Romanesque style bell tower and a stone porch supported by stone columns that have sculpted capitals (leaves and heads).
shortDescription:
Beautiful 14th-15th-century church and sundials.

The church is a listed historic monument with a lovely Lombard Romanesque style bell tower and a stone porch supported by stone columns that have sculpted capitals (leaves and heads).

label: Médiathèque de Barcelonnette
comment: Throughout the year, the structure at the head of Les Colporteurs, a network of media libraries in the Ubaye valley, invites you to discovery, entertainment and intellectual awakening.
shortDescription: Throughout the year, the structure at the head of Les Colporteurs, a network of media libraries in the Ubaye valley, invites you to discovery, entertainment and intellectual awakening.

label: Tour des Gens d’Armes
comment: Tower in the southwestern corner of the city wall, defended by archères (single firing slot) and crossbars (cruciform slot). The tower owes its name to the mounted gendarmerie who used it as a hayloft in the 19th century.
shortDescription: Tower in the southwestern corner of the city wall, defended by archères (single firing slot) and crossbars (cruciform slot). The tower owes its name to the mounted gendarmerie who used it as a hayloft in the 19th century.

label: Plage de Passable
comment: This beach is located on the west side of the peninsula and benefits from an ideal sunny situation. It has an unobstructed view of the bay of Villefranche-sur-Mer.
shortDescription: This beach is located on the west side of the peninsula and benefits from an ideal sunny situation. It has an unobstructed view of the bay of Villefranche-sur-Mer.

label: Eglise Sainte-Cécile
comment: Isolated in the middle of the plain, the church of Sainte-Cécile strikes the eye all the more because its spire bell tower is much higher than the nave and the choir
shortDescription: Isolated in the middle of the plain, the church of Sainte-Cécile strikes the eye all the more because its spire bell tower is much higher than the nave and the choir

label: Richerenches - Commanderie Templière
comment: In the heart of Provence, this ancient and small medieval village of Richerenches, with the Commandery of the Knight Templars and being also the capital of the truffle will surprise you with the richness of the soil, the quality of life, the warm welcome, and the Côtes du Rhône wine ready to charm your visit.
shortDescription: In the heart of Provence, this ancient and small medieval village of Richerenches, with the Commandery of the Knight Templars and being also the capital of the truffle will surprise you with the richness of the soil, the quality of life, the warm welcome, and the Côtes du Rhône wine ready to charm your visit.

label: Observatoire Ornithologique de la Durance
comment: Equipped with binoculars and thanks to the didactic panel, hidden in a hut, you will discover the fauna and flora in its natural environment, in its wild state.
shortDescription: Equipped with binoculars and thanks to the didactic panel, hidden in a hut, you will discover the fauna and flora in its natural environment, in its wild state.

label: Musée Géologique
comment: The museum presents geology, paleontology and archeology of Mormoiron. Gypsum, clay, siliceous sand and ochre as well as their exploitation are exhibited with illustrated documents.
shortDescription: The museum presents geology, paleontology and archeology of Mormoiron. Gypsum, clay, siliceous sand and ochre as well as their exploitation are exhibited with illustrated documents.
streetAddress: ['73 Rue de la Mairie', 'Centre culturel de Mormoiron']

label: Plage de l'Anglade
comment: L’Anglade, the first of the 12 beaches, puts you in a holiday mood straightaway. Sand, sea and sunshine, what else would you need?
shortDescription: L’Anglade, the first of the 12 beaches, puts you in a holiday mood straightaway. Sand, sea and sunshine, what else would you need?

label: Eglise Notre-Dame de Bethléem
comment: The Communal Church of Notre-Dame of Bethlehem has been classified as a historical monument since 16/11/1891 in Bayons.
shortDescription: The Communal Church of Notre-Dame of Bethlehem has been classified as a historical monument since 16/11/1891 in Bayons.

label: Ancien Couvent des Dominicains
comment: From the 13th century convent of the Dominicains, part of the church remain, as well as a roman bell tower, and several parts of the cloister.
shortDescription: From the 13th century convent of the Dominicains, part of the church remain, as well as a roman bell tower, and several parts of the cloister.

label: Ancien Moulin Communal de Callas
comment: This hydraulic mill for olive oil production dates back to the XVIIIth century. It remained in use until the great freeze in 1956. Take the opportunity of visiting the museum and learn more about olive picking techniques, methods for preparing olive paste  and olive oil extraction.
shortDescription: This hydraulic mill for olive oil production dates back to the XVIIIth century. It remained in use until the great freeze in 1956. Take the opportunity of visiting the museum and learn more about olive picking techniques, methods for preparing olive paste  and olive oil extraction.

label: Citadelle de Sisteron
comment:
On the border of the "Dauphiné" and Provence, with its bastions, its outer walls, its keep, the Citadel dominate the town of Sisteron.
Henri IV used to say "It is the most powerful fortress of my kingdom".
shortDescription:
On the border of the "Dauphiné" and Provence, with its bastions, its outer walls, its keep, the Citadel dominate the town of Sisteron.
Henri IV used to say "It is the most powerful fortress of my kingdom".

label: Plage de Boulouris
comment: The beach of Boulouris is wide with sand and gravel. On both sides there are small coves in the middle of rocks. On the left, continuing for 50 meters, there is a relatively large natural pool.
shortDescription: The beach of Boulouris is wide with sand and gravel. On both sides there are small coves in the middle of rocks. On the left, continuing for 50 meters, there is a relatively large natural pool.

label: Bastidon Paul Arène (Bastidon de la Cigalière)
comment: In this place Paul Arène wrote in July and August 1868 "Jean des Figues", and later some of his most beautiful stories.
shortDescription: In this place Paul Arène wrote in July and August 1868 "Jean des Figues", and later some of his most beautiful stories.

label: Monuments aux Morts du Col de Brouis
comment: Wishing to pay homage to the men of the 1st DFL who died to liberate the region (cf. Fort du Col de Brouis), the municipality of Breil sur Roya erected a monument on the Col de Brouis.
shortDescription: Wishing to pay homage to the men of the 1st DFL who died to liberate the region (cf. Fort du Col de Brouis), the municipality of Breil sur Roya erected a monument on the Col de Brouis.

label: Collégiale Notre-Dame-des-Anges
comment: Magistral! She is an exceptional monument by the richness of its interior: it is a major example of the Baroque in the South of France.
shortDescription: Magistral! She is an exceptional monument by the richness of its interior: it is a major example of the Baroque in the South of France.

label: Villa Santo Sospir
comment:
Listed as a Monument Historique (national heritage site) since 2007
The tattooed villa of Santo Sospir
shortDescription:
Listed as a Monument Historique (national heritage site) since 2007
The tattooed villa of Santo Sospir

label: La Perle de Provence - Escape game
comment: Available all year round, subject to availabilities. Get in touch with Tourism and Historical heritage department. "La Perle de Provence" takes you back to the 13th century - 1294 .
shortDescription: Available all year round, subject to availabilities. Get in touch with Tourism and Historical heritage department. "La Perle de Provence" takes you back to the 13th century - 1294 .

label: Bambouseraie à Vaison-la-Romaine
comment: A pedestrian path for rest and relaxation, the bamboo grove presents more than 4000 plants of about twenty different species. Within it, you will be able to experiment the sundial of the archeospace.
shortDescription: A pedestrian path for rest and relaxation, the bamboo grove presents more than 4000 plants of about twenty different species. Within it, you will be able to experiment the sundial of the archeospace.

label: Monument aux morts
comment: On the top of a wall, this memorial, made of marble limestone, is surrounded by a green wrought-iron balustrade marking the sacred space.
shortDescription: On the top of a wall, this memorial, made of marble limestone, is surrounded by a green wrought-iron balustrade marking the sacred space.

label: Arrivée de l'ancienne Route Napoléon au Pont de la Baume
comment: On his return from the island of Elba, Napoleon was very worried during the first 5 days of this epic. These worries were amply justified, but where everything really risked to fail was in front of the Citadel of Sisteron ...
shortDescription: On his return from the island of Elba, Napoleon was very worried during the first 5 days of this epic. These worries were amply justified, but where everything really risked to fail was in front of the Citadel of Sisteron ...

label: Plaque commémorative "Rhin et Danube"
comment: Commemorative plaque "Rhine and Danube"
shortDescription: Commemorative plaque "Rhine and Danube"

label: Plan d'eau des Salettes
comment: At 2km of the city of Mormoiron, lake with fine sand beaches.
shortDescription: At 2km of the city of Mormoiron, lake with fine sand beaches.

label: Plage de la Moune
comment: In the shade of the canisses, in the bends of the Treizain, it is the only and real landscaped beach located in the town of Gassin. Partly private and dedicated to the sailing school, the atmosphere is relaxed and sporty.
shortDescription: In the shade of the canisses, in the bends of the Treizain, it is the only and real landscaped beach located in the town of Gassin. Partly private and dedicated to the sailing school, the atmosphere is relaxed and sporty.

label: Fort du Chaberton
comment:
Also known as the Fort of Clouds.
Culminating at an altitude of 3131 metres, it is one of the highest in Europe.
shortDescription:
Also known as the Fort of Clouds.
Culminating at an altitude of 3131 metres, it is one of the highest in Europe.

label: Point Informatique
comment: The computer point is also accessible during the opening hours of the library.
shortDescription: The computer point is also accessible during the opening hours of the library.

label: Bibliothèque municipale jeunesse «Charles Vildrac»
comment: Find a collection of 8000 books, periodicals, comics, mangas, CDs, DVDs for young people and animations.

shortDescription: The biggest dolmen of the Var in La Londe les Maures

label: Le Castrum

shortDescription: The first houses of the village gathered around the 11th century, in the part between the feudal castle and the parish church on a limited space.

label: Le hameau de Berghe inférieur
comment:
The adorable hamlet of Berghe inférieur, nestled in its age-old chestnut groves, welcomes you at the end of the vertiginous road cut into the purple rock.
Facing due east, it tumbles down the steep slopes, perched on its cultivated terraces.
shortDescription:
The adorable hamlet of Berghe inférieur, nestled in its age-old chestnut groves, welcomes you at the end of the vertiginous road cut into the purple rock.
Facing due east, it tumbles down the steep slopes, perched on its cultivated terraces.

label: Cimetière du Monastère de Cimiez
comment: Located in Nice at the heart of the hill of Cimiez, the cemetery of the famous monastery of the same name is a place of contemplation which many personalities chose as their final resting place
shortDescription: Located in Nice at the heart of the hill of Cimiez, the cemetery of the famous monastery of the same name is a place of contemplation which many personalities chose as their final resting place

label: L'Aqueduc
comment: At the entrance to the valley of Fontaine-de-Vaucluse, there is a majestic aqueduct, built between 1854 and 1857. This structure allows the passage of the Canal de Carpentras which is used for watering.
shortDescription: At the entrance to the valley of Fontaine-de-Vaucluse, there is a majestic aqueduct, built between 1854 and 1857. This structure allows the passage of the Canal de Carpentras which is used for watering.

label: Plaque commémorative du 150ème anniversaire de la fondation du Félibrige
comment: Passionate about the Provençal language, Frédéric Mistral is one of the seven founders of the Félibrige. In 1904 he was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature.
shortDescription: Passionate about the Provençal language, Frédéric Mistral is one of the seven founders of the Félibrige. In 1904 he was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature.

comment: Oratory of Saint Eloy
shortDescription: Oratory of Saint Eloy

comment: SANARY, TO ITS WINNING SONS
shortDescription: SANARY, TO ITS WINNING SONS

label: Hôtel Pellissier
comment: The Hotel Pellissier bears witness to the political, cultural and artistic influence of the Papal States in the 18th century in what was then the Comtat Venaissin, which later became the French department of Vaucluse.
shortDescription: The Hotel Pellissier bears witness to the political, cultural and artistic influence of the Papal States in the 18th century in what was then the Comtat Venaissin, which later became the French department of Vaucluse.

shortDescription: Beautiful organs classified "Monument Historique" built in 1668 by Charles Royer.

label: Circuit piéton "à la découverte de Richerenches"
comment: Discover the village and its history by following the 6 panels along the circuit. Departure in front of the belfry.
shortDescription: Discover the village and its history by following the 6 panels along the circuit. Departure in front of the belfry.

shortDescription: Workshops where training sessions are organised for all ages. Visit of the workshop and Pizay art gallery

comment: Micro-folie is a digital museum, with its 500 treasures from the largest national institutions. It is made up of 3 entities: the digital museum, the digital creation space and the fablab.
shortDescription: Micro-folie is a digital museum, with its 500 treasures from the largest national institutions. It is made up of 3 entities: the digital museum, the digital creation space and the fablab.

shortDescription: The Monastry of the Verne is a religious historic monument in the middle of the Maures.

label: Hôpital Saint Joseph dit de la Miséricorde
comment: Looking at this café, it is impossible to guess that this building was originally a hospital.
shortDescription: Looking at this café, it is impossible to guess that this building was originally a hospital.

label: Bibliothèque de l'Epine
comment:
Your reading space at l'Epine!
Lending of books, small exhibitions, animations.
In partnership with the departmental lending library of Gap.
The bookmobile passes by twice a year.
shortDescription:
Your reading space at l'Epine!
Lending of books, small exhibitions, animations.
In partnership with the departmental lending library of Gap.

label: Plage des Cigales
comment: Facing St Tropez, this sandy beach is appreciated for its little lighthouse and picturesque bridge.
shortDescription: Facing St Tropez, this sandy beach is appreciated for its little lighthouse and picturesque bridge.

comment: Comtadin Costume Museum
shortDescription: Comtadin Costume Museum

label: Collégiale Saint Pancrace
comment: This collegiate church has a museum of precious religious art where you can admire the oldest processional cross in Provence dating from the 14th century and hand-embroidered ornaments from the 17th century.
shortDescription: This collegiate church has a museum of precious religious art where you can admire the oldest processional cross in Provence dating from the 14th century and hand-embroidered ornaments from the 17th century.

label: Ancien Palace : Hôtel Winter Palace
comment: Classified in the category of luxury hotels, it now has a hundred apartments a pretty landscaped park.  Added to the inventory of Historical Monuments in 1975 and labeled "Heritage of the twentieth century" in 2001.
shortDescription: Classified in the category of luxury hotels, it now has a hundred apartments a pretty landscaped park.  Added to the inventory of Historical Monuments in 1975 and labeled "Heritage of the twentieth century" in 2001.

label: Musée Balaguier
comment:
Built in 1634, and reinforced by Vauban, this gun tower was used to protect the Toulon harbour when it crossed swords with the Royale Tower

In July 2022, the museum changes and turns to the underwater world.
shortDescription:
Built in 1634, and reinforced by Vauban, this gun tower was used to protect the Toulon harbour when it crossed swords with the Royale Tower

In July 2022, the museum changes and turns to the underwater world.

label: Monastère de l'Annonciade
comment: A historical monument, the monastery is a symbol for the town of Menton. Up there perched on its hill above the sea. But if the place is discreet, it is much more generous in terms of the panorama it gives to see.
shortDescription: A historical monument, the monastery is a symbol for the town of Menton. Up there perched on its hill above the sea. But if the place is discreet, it is much more generous in terms of the panorama it gives to see.

label: Chapelle de La Visitation
comment: Dated to the seventeenth century, the chapel retains interesting furnishings of penitents.
shortDescription: Dated to the seventeenth century, the chapel retains interesting furnishings of penitents.

label: Jardin Médiéval
comment: Created and managed by the “Association des Peintres du Soleil”, the medieval garden flourishes serenely behind the restored ramparts of the castle. The awakening of the senses that it arouses changes the visitor into a stroller and a dreamer.
shortDescription: Created and managed by the “Association des Peintres du Soleil”, the medieval garden flourishes serenely behind the restored ramparts of the castle. The awakening of the senses that it arouses changes the visitor into a stroller and a dreamer.

label: Plage de la Baumette
comment:
Under the point of the Beaumette, beach of 200 m of sand.
The beach of La Baumette is a beautiful beach located in Agay, it is the ideal place for a quiet swim.
shortDescription:
Under the point of the Beaumette, beach of 200 m of sand.
The beach of La Baumette is a beautiful beach located in Agay, it is the ideal place for a quiet swim.

label: Bibliothèque Multimédia
comment:
Want to escape with a good book by the fire or by the pool?
All year round we have a large choice for young and old and for all tastes!
shortDescription:
Want to escape with a good book by the fire or by the pool?

label: Barrage hydroélectrique
comment:
The construction of this dam changed the appearance of the town, creating a water body that supplies the Arbousset hydroelectric plant.
Today, this body of water is also conducive to recreational activities such as fishing or kayaking.
shortDescription:
The construction of this dam changed the appearance of the town, creating a water body that supplies the Arbousset hydroelectric plant.
Today, this body of water is also conducive to recreational activities such as fishing or kayaking.

shortDescription: Landing in Provence Monument in Canada

label: Passerelle himalayenne des Cascades de Trans
comment: 70 meter long, overhanging Nartuby  Gorges, a stunning work that overhangs Naturby river. 30 meter high, the himalayan footbridge brings strong sensations and offers a breathtaking view over the village
shortDescription: 70 meter long, overhanging Nartuby  Gorges, a stunning work that overhangs Naturby river. 30 meter high, the himalayan footbridge brings strong sensations and offers a breathtaking view over the village

comment:
Fortification part of the Maginot line.
It is a small artillery work that aimed to prohibit the Brouis pass connecting the Roya valley to the north and the Bévéra valley to the south.
shortDescription:
Fortification part of the Maginot line.

shortDescription: A site with a strong emphasis on organic agriculture and permaculture, including farm animals and a vegetable garden.

comment: Located at the heart of the village the library offers more than 4000 publications, CDs, access WiFi with computers. You can find there  reading rooms for children and for adults.
shortDescription: Located at the heart of the village the library offers more than 4000 publications, CDs, access WiFi with computers. You can find there  reading rooms for children and for adults.

label: Tour de l'horloge
comment: The clock tower and its campanile dominate the village from all its height. You have a 360° panoramic view on the whole valley and on the roofs of the village. Orientation table ...
shortDescription: The clock tower and its campanile dominate the village from all its height. You have a 360° panoramic view on the whole valley and on the roofs of the village. Orientation table ...

label: Musée de la Vieille Ecole
comment: 8km from the city center, in the hamlet of Valayans, discover the museum of the old school. Its inkwells, its pens, its notebooks and the good points; nothing is missing! A real moment of nostalgia to be discovered by the youngest.
shortDescription: 8km from the city center, in the hamlet of Valayans, discover the museum of the old school. Its inkwells, its pens, its notebooks and the good points; nothing is missing! A real moment of nostalgia to be discovered by the youngest.

label: Chapelle  des pénitents blancs / chapelle de l'Immaculée Conception
comment: Chapel dedicated to the Virgin Mary and also called Chapel of the White Penitents.A fine example of the art of the Catholic Reformation, was the seat of the Brotherhood of White Penitents.
shortDescription: Chapel dedicated to the Virgin Mary and also called Chapel of the White Penitents.A fine example of the art of the Catholic Reformation, was the seat of the Brotherhood of White Penitents.

label: Hameau de Saint-Symphorien

shortDescription: Situated on the left bank of the River Vançon, Saint Symphorien is ochre in colour, reflecting the sandstone in the surrounding area.

label: Eglise Saint-Michel
comment: A building of character, imposing and magnificent, the church of Saint Michael was classified as a historical monument in 1982. It was at the end of the 13th century that its construction began, the origin of which is attributed to Pope Clement V.
shortDescription: A building of character, imposing and magnificent, the church of Saint Michael was classified as a historical monument in 1982. It was at the end of the 13th century that its construction began, the origin of which is attributed to Pope Clement V.

label: Village du Castellard Melan

shortDescription: Le Castellard-Mélan is located in the department of Alpes-de-Haute-Provence about 30 km northwest of Digne-les-Bains and 6 km north of Thoard, capital of the small valley of the Duyes.

label: La carrière du Justicier

label: Monument aux Morts

shortDescription: Since the antiquity, the Mazan area is particularly rich with archeological discoveries. These sarcophagus are amongst the most important relics of the Comtat Venaissin. They are probably the remains of Christian necropolis.

label: Cathédrale Notre-Dame et Saint-Thyrse

label: Préhistosite des gorges du Verdon

Located between the museum and its car park, discover this new space for an immersion in prehistory.
Five habitats and a dolmen restored to life-size according to archaeological data and using traditional construction techniques. In a setting evocative of prehistoric landscapes, a unique opportunity to discover, at your own pace, construction techniques that have endured through time...
shortDescription:
Located between the museum and its car park, discover this new space for an immersion in prehistory.

Built between 1633 and 1637, this fort was built to counter Spanish threat which was pervasive on provencal coasts at that time. 

Nowadays, the fort houses an exhibition which is open to the public in summer.

label: Jardin Auguste Renoir
comment: Domaine des Collettes, the garden of the artist Pierre Auguste Renoir’s villa, is home to magnificent centuries-old olive trees and many other plants.
shortDescription: Domaine des Collettes, the garden of the artist Pierre Auguste Renoir’s villa, is home to magnificent centuries-old olive trees and many other plants.

label: Village de Breil Sur Roya
comment: Archaeological discoveries prove that the site of Breil sur Roya is inhabited since the Neolithic era.
shortDescription: Archaeological discoveries prove that the site of Breil sur Roya is inhabited since the Neolithic era.

label: Jardin Sainte Claire et jardin Pétramale
comment: Opens at 8am, no charge.
shortDescription: Opens at 8am, no charge.

label: Village de Châteauredon
comment: On the side of the Route Napoléon (RN85), on the hillside, Châteauredon owes its name to the old round castle, which has now disappeared.
shortDescription: On the side of the Route Napoléon (RN85), on the hillside, Châteauredon owes its name to the old round castle, which has now disappeared.

label: Cathédrale Notre-Dame du Bourg
comment: Raised for the fisrt time in 1180, Notre Dame du Bourg cathedral is one of the most beautiful roman churches in Provence, thanks to its unique nave and its four large bays.
shortDescription: Raised for the fisrt time in 1180, Notre Dame du Bourg cathedral is one of the most beautiful roman churches in Provence, thanks to its unique nave and its four large bays.

label: Barret-sur-Méouge
comment: Nestling in the base of a green valley, Barret-sur-Méouge was created by the merger of two districts in 1944.
shortDescription: Nestling in the base of a green valley, Barret-sur-Méouge was created by the merger of two districts in 1944.

label: Jardin des Arènes de Cimiez
comment:
Nestling on the hill, the garden of the Arenas of Cimiez is a traditional living space where the people
of Nice love to meet, for a day of farniente in the shade of the age-old olive trees.
shortDescription:
Nestling on the hill, the garden of the Arenas of Cimiez is a traditional living space where the people
of Nice love to meet, for a day of farniente in the shade of the age-old olive trees.

label: Circuit des moulins
comment: Discovery circuit of the oil and flour mills.
shortDescription: Discovery circuit of the oil and flour mills.

label: Musée d'histoire locale et des traditions
comment: An old bourgeois residence shelters the treasures of the past: old trades, events, gestures of yesteryear, reconstructions of life scenes bear witness to a time when everyone can rediscover a bit of their history
shortDescription: An old bourgeois residence shelters the treasures of the past: old trades, events, gestures of yesteryear, reconstructions of life scenes bear witness to a time when everyone can rediscover a bit of their history
streetAddress: ['153, rue Jean Jaurès', "Musée d'histoire locale et des traditions"]

label: Le Moulin
comment: The place "Les Moulins" aptly named because it is not less than three mills that inspired the site.
shortDescription: The place "Les Moulins" aptly named because it is not less than three mills that inspired the site.

label: La maison dite de la Reine Jeanne
comment: Mythical name for a small Mannerist "palace" of the end of the 16th century.
shortDescription: Mythical name for a small Mannerist "palace" of the end of the 16th century.

label: Place des Marchands
comment: It's a very pretty and pretty square where the statue of the Venus of Millot is enthroned.
shortDescription: It's a very pretty and pretty square where the statue of the Venus of Millot is enthroned.

label: Maison de la Truffe d'Aups et du Verdon
comment: The House of the Truffle is located in the heart of Aups, in the Old Hospice of Saint-Jacques from the 17th century.
shortDescription: The House of the Truffle is located in the heart of Aups, in the Old Hospice of Saint-Jacques from the 17th century.

label: Portail du réduit
comment: The gate of the reduction, closed by a portcullis, is made of La Turbie limestone. Very picturesque, it was the only entrance into the fortress enclosure when the Trophy was transformed. Until the clearing of the surroundings of the monument at the beginning of the 50s.
shortDescription: The gate of the reduction, closed by a portcullis, is made of La Turbie limestone. Very picturesque, it was the only entrance into the fortress enclosure when the Trophy was transformed. Until the clearing of the surroundings of the monument at the beginning of the 50s.

label: Temple Saint-Martial
comment: The Protestant Church of France - liturgical services every Sunday at 10 am. Free entrance.
shortDescription: The Protestant Church of France - liturgical services every Sunday at 10 am. Free entrance.

label: Château de la Verdière
comment: Château de la Verdière is the largest castle in Provence. 5000m² on six levels, surrounded by a 16 ha park, this castle also radiates through its thousand years of history. The visit is made by a guide lecturer of the Historical Monuments.
shortDescription: Château de la Verdière is the largest castle in Provence. 5000m² on six levels, surrounded by a 16 ha park, this castle also radiates through its thousand years of history. The visit is made by a guide lecturer of the Historical Monuments.

label: Eglise Saint Etienne
comment: Built in the Middle-Ages, it was enlarged with two laterally chapels and a bell tower in the 19th century.
shortDescription: Built in the Middle-Ages, it was enlarged with two laterally chapels and a bell tower in the 19th century.

label: Abbaye de La Celle
comment: Romanesque abbey founded in the 11th century, classified as a historical monument since 1886. Monastery of Benedictine nuns, reformed in the 17th century by Cardinal Mazarin. The abbey reopened its doors after major restoration work.
shortDescription: Romanesque abbey founded in the 11th century, classified as a historical monument since 1886. Monastery of Benedictine nuns, reformed in the 17th century by Cardinal Mazarin. The abbey reopened its doors after major restoration work.

label: Bibliothèque Municipale - Mairie de Ramatuelle
comment: A library for all
shortDescription: A library for all

label: Eglise paroissiale Saint-Martin
comment: This fortified building is not a fortified house but a church. Do not hesitate to venture into the heart of this listed monument of undeniable charm.
shortDescription: This fortified building is not a fortified house but a church. Do not hesitate to venture into the heart of this listed monument of undeniable charm.

label: Porte Saint Jean
comment: The door has the symbolic name of the first parish. This door was during the Middle Ages the main acess to the village.
shortDescription: The door has the symbolic name of the first parish. This door was during the Middle Ages the main acess to the village.

label: Belles Rives ski nautique Club
comment: In 1932, Leo Roman and Emil Petersen ( associated with Major Howard ) contribute to the development of the water-ski by creating the first Water-Ski Club and making incredible demonstrations in the Golfe Juan bay. At the beginning, they used very heavy snow skis. It was immediately a success and they did the same in Cannes and Nice.
shortDescription: In 1932, Leo Roman and Emil Petersen ( associated with Major Howard ) contribute to the development of the water-ski by creating the first Water-Ski Club and making incredible demonstrations in the Golfe Juan bay. At the beginning, they used very heavy snow skis. It was immediately a success and they did the same in Cannes and Nice.

label: Plage des Brouis
comment: This idyllic beach is accessible via the coastal path, a 45-minute walk from Gigaro. Cut off from the world, you will need to bring a hat, your picnic and some water.
shortDescription: This idyllic beach is accessible via the coastal path, a 45-minute walk from Gigaro. Cut off from the world, you will need to bring a hat, your picnic and some water.

label: Hôtel Gassaud
comment:
It is one of the most beautiful mansions of the city (end of the Provencal Renaissance).
The building has been listed as a historical monument since April 14, 1951 for the façade and roof overlooking the street.
shortDescription:
It is one of the most beautiful mansions of the city (end of the Provencal Renaissance).
The building has been listed as a historical monument since April 14, 1951 for the façade and roof overlooking the street.

label: Voie Romaine
comment: Secondary Roman road that was used to connect, especially with animals, the village of Tourtour on the heights.
shortDescription: Secondary Roman road that was used to connect, especially with animals, the village of Tourtour on the heights.

label: Ecomusée de l'artisanat des Hautes-Alpes
comment: Eco Museum traversing the economic and human agricultural history of the Hautes-Alpes from 1790 to 1950. 6 themes to discover. Peasant workshops, clog, blacksmith, wheelwright, mechanical energy. Choose two themes for your guided tour.
shortDescription: Eco Museum traversing the economic and human agricultural history of the Hautes-Alpes from 1790 to 1950. 6 themes to discover. Peasant workshops, clog, blacksmith, wheelwright, mechanical energy. Choose two themes for your guided tour.
streetAddress: ["31 bis, Route de l'Audet", 'Quartier de Charance']

label: Musée Regain
comment: Installed in what used to be the cellar of the Maison Rabiers du Villars, the Regain Museum lifts the veil each year on a new exhibition linked to the traditions of the Annot region. In 2022, you will follow "Living Water in the Land of Annot"
shortDescription: Installed in what used to be the cellar of the Maison Rabiers du Villars, the Regain Museum lifts the veil each year on a new exhibition linked to the traditions of the Annot region. In 2022, you will follow "Living Water in the Land of Annot"

label: Plaque de l'ancienne maison des mineurs
comment: This plaque commemorates the place (the Grande Maison) where the miners of the Gaude mine lived until 1966. It was on December 14, 2002 that the Comité Patrimoine Manosquin and the municipality inaugurated this plaque.
shortDescription: This plaque commemorates the place (the Grande Maison) where the miners of the Gaude mine lived until 1966. It was on December 14, 2002 that the Comité Patrimoine Manosquin and the municipality inaugurated this plaque.

label: Bibliothèque éphémère Jean-Louis Barrault
comment:
Opened on July 1, 2021, the ephemeral library is located in the park of the Clos de la Murette
It consists of an adult area and a youth area
It is also equipped with a multimedia space and various collections.
shortDescription:
Opened on July 1, 2021, the ephemeral library is located in the park of the Clos de la Murette
It consists of an adult area and a youth area
It is also equipped with a multimedia space and various collections.
streetAddress: ['Parc du Clos de la Murette - 8 rue René Goscinny']

label: Musée de la lavande
comment: Discover the history of lavender cultivation around Digne, since 1900.
shortDescription: Discover the history of lavender cultivation around Digne, since 1900.

label: Bijou Plage
comment:
An invitation to laze around in a chic and relaxed spirit
Treat yourself to a moment out of time at Bijou Plage, an emblematic place located on the Croisette in Cannes, on the French Riviera.
shortDescription:
An invitation to laze around in a chic and relaxed spirit
Treat yourself to a moment out of time at Bijou Plage, an emblematic place located on the Croisette in Cannes, on the French Riviera.

label: Monuments aux Morts
comment: The Monument to the Dead is located in the rue de l'église
shortDescription: The Monument to the Dead is located in the rue de l'église

label: Le Château
comment: 17th century stately home. built on 2 floors, housing a monumental staircase and offering a terrace with an exceptional view of the village and the Gulf of Saint-Tropez.
shortDescription: 17th century stately home. built on 2 floors, housing a monumental staircase and offering a terrace with an exceptional view of the village and the Gulf of Saint-Tropez.

label: Parfumerie Molinard
comment: Come experience this magnificent family mansion and discover the different steps to perfume production, with life-sized automated displays and interactive games.
shortDescription: Come experience this magnificent family mansion and discover the different steps to perfume production, with life-sized automated displays and interactive games.

label: Église Notre Dame de l'Assomption
comment: This 17th century building is located in the center of the village, on the banks of the river Gapeau. It is listed by the French Historic Monument Society thanks to its Renaissance dome and furnishing. Each summer, the church hosts the international festival ‘Chorale en Provence’.
shortDescription: This 17th century building is located in the center of the village, on the banks of the river Gapeau. It is listed by the French Historic Monument Society thanks to its Renaissance dome and furnishing. Each summer, the church hosts the international festival ‘Chorale en Provence’.

label: Cimetière de la Guicharde
comment: The Guicharde cemetery is one of the two municipal cemeteries of the town of Sanary-sur-Mer and the most recent since it opened in the middle of the 20th century.
shortDescription: The Guicharde cemetery is one of the two municipal cemeteries of the town of Sanary-sur-Mer and the most recent since it opened in the middle of the 20th century.

label: Pont de Soleils
comment: The bridge has a single low arch with abutments supported by the banks of the Verdon. It has walls very carefully fitted with assorted limestone blocks.
shortDescription: The bridge has a single low arch with abutments supported by the banks of the Verdon. It has walls very carefully fitted with assorted limestone blocks.

label: Village perché de Thèze
comment: Discover the village and the church of Saint-Blaise (19th century), with its beautiful paintings with Saint Sebastian and the Rosary. Very famous for its orchards, market gardening has developed here.
shortDescription: Discover the village and the church of Saint-Blaise (19th century), with its beautiful paintings with Saint Sebastian and the Rosary. Very famous for its orchards, market gardening has developed here.

label: Eglise Sainte-Marie-Madeleine
comment: What a strange church that of Freissinières! While the churches of the region have a bell-tower, a monumental portal and a lot of decorations, the one of Freissinières is very sober : 4 smooth and white walls, a roof and a small bell-tower-wall.
shortDescription: What a strange church that of Freissinières! While the churches of the region have a bell-tower, a monumental portal and a lot of decorations, the one of Freissinières is very sober : 4 smooth and white walls, a roof and a small bell-tower-wall.

label: Le village de Venasque
comment: Known from earliest times as virtually an impregable fortress, sitting on top of its sheer-sided rock and dominating an ancient Roman road, Venasque is considered one of the most authentic villages of the Comtat Venaissin -to wich it gave its name.
shortDescription: Known from earliest times as virtually an impregable fortress, sitting on top of its sheer-sided rock and dominating an ancient Roman road, Venasque is considered one of the most authentic villages of the Comtat Venaissin -to wich it gave its name.

label: Plage Baieta
comment: Bar, beach, restaurant on the Promenade des Anglais.
shortDescription: Bar, beach, restaurant on the Promenade des Anglais.

label: Médiathèque du Lauzet-Ubaye
comment:
The media library invites discovery, entertainment, intellectual awakening and intergenerational encounters.

Free subscription.
shortDescription:
The media library invites discovery, entertainment, intellectual awakening and intergenerational encounters.

Free subscription.

label: Tombeau pyramidal du vice amiral de Latouche Tréville
comment: At the entrance to the Franco-Italian cemetery, on a mound, rises a pyramid of 7.25 m high which contains the mortal remains of Admiral Latouche-Treville, considered at the time as the terror of the English.
shortDescription: At the entrance to the Franco-Italian cemetery, on a mound, rises a pyramid of 7.25 m high which contains the mortal remains of Admiral Latouche-Treville, considered at the time as the terror of the English.

label: Plage du Veillat
comment: The beach of Veillat, all sand, accessible from the Promenade des Bains, by 4 stairs and a ramp. It is a supervised beach with a first aid post. Showers and toilets are available on this beach.
shortDescription: The beach of Veillat, all sand, accessible from the Promenade des Bains, by 4 stairs and a ramp. It is a supervised beach with a first aid post. Showers and toilets are available on this beach.

label: L'hôtel de ville
comment: Pertuis has had a town hall since the end of the 14th century. But it is in 1793 that the private mansion of the de Croze family became the town hall.
shortDescription: Pertuis has had a town hall since the end of the 14th century. But it is in 1793 that the private mansion of the de Croze family became the town hall.

label: Square Agricol Perdiguier
comment: This square was once the garden and cloister of a Benedictine Abbey during the Middle Ages. The Church of Saint Martial was then built here, and abandoned after the French Revolution. In the early 19th century, this space became a botanical garden under the leadership of Esprit Requien, a botanist, bibliophile and town Councillor.
shortDescription: This square was once the garden and cloister of a Benedictine Abbey during the Middle Ages. The Church of Saint Martial was then built here, and abandoned after the French Revolution. In the early 19th century, this space became a botanical garden under the leadership of Esprit Requien, a botanist, bibliophile and town Councillor.

label: Eglise du Martyre de Saint Jean-Baptiste
comment: Fréjus Toulon bishop laid the first stone in September 1845.  The solemn opening took place in September 1851.
shortDescription: Fréjus Toulon bishop laid the first stone in September 1845.  The solemn opening took place in September 1851.

label: Eglise Saint Christophe
comment: Built on the site of the original chapel, in 1701, one can admire inside a beautiful gilded wooden altarpiece dating from 1704, listed by the French Historic Monument society in 1984.
shortDescription: Built on the site of the original chapel, in 1701, one can admire inside a beautiful gilded wooden altarpiece dating from 1704, listed by the French Historic Monument society in 1984.

label: Paroisse Sainte Anne
comment: Masses from Monday to Thursday at 8.40 am, Friday at 6.30 pm, Saturday at 9 am and 6 pm, Sunday at 10 am.
shortDescription: Masses from Monday to Thursday at 8.40 am, Friday at 6.30 pm, Saturday at 9 am and 6 pm, Sunday at 10 am.

label: Plaque Commémorative du Passage du Général Bonaparte
comment: This plaque commissioned by the municipality of Breil sur Roya reminds passers-by that in 1794, during the campaign of Italy, General Bonaparte and Abbot Ricord, conventional to the Armies, are the guests of the Cachiardy family after the capture of Saorge.
shortDescription: This plaque commissioned by the municipality of Breil sur Roya reminds passers-by that in 1794, during the campaign of Italy, General Bonaparte and Abbot Ricord, conventional to the Armies, are the guests of the Cachiardy family after the capture of Saorge.

label: Monêtier Allemont
comment: Located between Sisteron and Gap, on the banks of the Durance, at the foot of the Pic de Crigne, the village of Monêtier-Allemont enjoys a privileged position between the Alps and Provence, on the border between the Hautes-Alpes and the Alpes de Haute-Provence.
shortDescription: Located between Sisteron and Gap, on the banks of the Durance, at the foot of the Pic de Crigne, the village of Monêtier-Allemont enjoys a privileged position between the Alps and Provence, on the border between the Hautes-Alpes and the Alpes de Haute-Provence.

label: Eglise Saint Martin ou  Notre Dame de l’Assomption
comment: The Church of Saint Martin or Notre Dame de l'Assomption, officially dated to the 12th century, raises many questions.
shortDescription: The Church of Saint Martin or Notre Dame de l'Assomption, officially dated to the 12th century, raises many questions.

label: Kiosque à musique
comment: Inaugurated in 1904, the bandstand was manufactured by ironworkers.
shortDescription: Inaugurated in 1904, the bandstand was manufactured by ironworkers.

label: Cité lacustre de Port Grimaud
comment: Port-Grimaud is one of the key ports on the French Riviera.
shortDescription: Port-Grimaud is one of the key ports on the French Riviera.

label: Le village perché de l'Epine
comment: The charming perched village of L'Epine owes its name to the scarcity of water and not to the rocky spur on which it leans.
shortDescription: The charming perched village of L'Epine owes its name to the scarcity of water and not to the rocky spur on which it leans.

label: Porte des Aires
comment: Emblematic door of the village, it is from this place that one can best see the continuity of the remains of the ramparts of the 12th and 16th centuries.
shortDescription: Emblematic door of the village, it is from this place that one can best see the continuity of the remains of the ramparts of the 12th and 16th centuries.

label: Fondation Blachère
comment: Since 2004, the corporate foundation Jean-Paul Blachere wants to participate in the development of Africa by helping the contemporary creation and promotion of the artists. In its art centre, located in the heart of Blachere Illumination company, in an industrial zone, it presents exhibitions and welcomes artists in residency. It also organizes creating workshops in Africa and in Europe, and participates to great African biennials, including the Dakar biennial. It also handles the preservation of the works of Collection Blachere.
shortDescription: Since 2004, the corporate foundation Jean-Paul Blachere wants to participate in the development of Africa by helping the contemporary creation and promotion of the artists. In its art centre, located in the heart of Blachere Illumination company, in an industrial zone, it presents exhibitions and welcomes artists in residency. It also organizes creating workshops in Africa and in Europe, and participates to great African biennials, including the Dakar biennial. It also handles the preservation of the works of Collection Blachere.

label: La Maison du Bourreau
comment: This house built in 1846 used to be the dwelling of  the executioner and his family.  You can find there a collection of torture devices such as a guillotine, handcuffs... and learn more about the history of justice in Draguignan and the Var region.
shortDescription: This house built in 1846 used to be the dwelling of  the executioner and his family.  You can find there a collection of torture devices such as a guillotine, handcuffs... and learn more about the history of justice in Draguignan and the Var region.
streetAddress: ['Lieu dit La Maison du Bourreau', "Montée de l'Horloge"]

label: Le Village Provençal du Santonnier
comment: In the heart of the garden of scents, you find the so called Provence village of Santonnier. You can discover here life of a small Provence Village with its typical Provence clay figurines. A soft background music enhances the visit.
shortDescription: In the heart of the garden of scents, you find the so called Provence village of Santonnier. You can discover here life of a small Provence Village with its typical Provence clay figurines. A soft background music enhances the visit.

label: Eglise Saint Nicolas
comment: This romanesque church which dates back to the XIIth century is located on top of the village.
shortDescription: This romanesque church which dates back to the XIIth century is located on top of the village.

label: Fort Sainte Agathe
comment:
The  Sainte-Agathe fort, dating from the sixteenth century, was built under François I to protect the coasts of relentless attacks. It is an old canon tower redeveloped over the centuries. The fort houses an exhibition tracing the history of Porquerolles and actions of the National Park of Port-Cros.
Entrance fee in season, from june to october. Then closed to the public.
shortDescription:
The  Sainte-Agathe fort, dating from the sixteenth century, was built under François I to protect the coasts of relentless attacks. It is an old canon tower redeveloped over the centuries. The fort houses an exhibition tracing the history of Porquerolles and actions of the National Park of Port-Cros.
Entrance fee in season, from june to october. Then closed to the public.

label: Plage du Borrigo
comment: After the Casino de Menton going towards Roquebrune-Cap-Martin, we find the beach of Borrigo. The first area is wide and pebble. Moving away towards Cap Martin it becomes very narrow. A small parking lot is located after the mouth of the Borrigo.
shortDescription: After the Casino de Menton going towards Roquebrune-Cap-Martin, we find the beach of Borrigo. The first area is wide and pebble. Moving away towards Cap Martin it becomes very narrow. A small parking lot is located after the mouth of the Borrigo.

label: Ancien hôpital Sainte Barbe
comment: This old hospital was founded in September 1724. The work to construct this building and its chapel was completed seven years later in 1731. The wings were built later thanks to generous donors.
shortDescription: This old hospital was founded in September 1724. The work to construct this building and its chapel was completed seven years later in 1731. The wings were built later thanks to generous donors.

label: Oratoire Sainte Marie-Madeleine
comment: Statue on the side facade of the homonymous inn.
shortDescription: Statue on the side facade of the homonymous inn.

label: Eglise Notre Dame du Thor
comment: The church of Notre Dame du Thor was certainly built before 1662 and then restored at various times.
shortDescription: The church of Notre Dame du Thor was certainly built before 1662 and then restored at various times.

label: Centre d'Astronomie
comment: The Astronomy Centre, which is attached to the Haute-Provence Observatory, is responsible for disseminating scientific culture and welcomes schoolchildren and adults throughout the year.
shortDescription: The Astronomy Centre, which is attached to the Haute-Provence Observatory, is responsible for disseminating scientific culture and welcomes schoolchildren and adults throughout the year.

label: Visites - Château Mentone
comment:
Visit of the domain and tasting of organic wines.
Tuesdays & Thursdays at 4pm and 11am.
On reservation.
shortDescription:
Visit of the domain and tasting of organic wines.
Tuesdays & Thursdays at 4pm and 11am.
On reservation.

label: Cimetière militaire belge
comment: Located at the foot of the chapel, it owes its name to the Belgian victims of the First World War who lost their lives at the Villa Les Cèdres.
shortDescription: Located at the foot of the chapel, it owes its name to the Belgian victims of the First World War who lost their lives at the Villa Les Cèdres.

label: Les Ruelles de Sanary
comment: Typical of Provencal architecture and untouched by time, the narrow streets of Sanary are full of this southern atmosphere, conducive to relaxation, discovery and wonder.
shortDescription: Typical of Provencal architecture and untouched by time, the narrow streets of Sanary are full of this southern atmosphere, conducive to relaxation, discovery and wonder.

label: Maison Noble
comment: The so called "Maison noble", or the Château, was built in the XVIIth century.
shortDescription: The so called "Maison noble", or the Château, was built in the XVIIth century.

label: Cathédrale Notre-Dame et Saint-Véran
comment: Bishopric since the Early Middle Ages, Cavaillon still has its beautiful cathedral with its chapter, 14th and 15th century Romanesque cloister, and the ruins of a church in what is now a school courtyard.
shortDescription: Bishopric since the Early Middle Ages, Cavaillon still has its beautiful cathedral with its chapter, 14th and 15th century Romanesque cloister, and the ruins of a church in what is now a school courtyard.

label: Hôpital général Saint Jacques dit Hôpital vieux
comment:
The history of this hotel-restaurant dates back to the year Mil. 
Located outside the fortified village, this building was a leprosarium.
shortDescription:
The history of this hotel-restaurant dates back to the year Mil. 
Located outside the fortified village, this building was a leprosarium.

label: Bibliothèque municipale de Puy-Saint-André
comment: The library of Puy-Saint-André offers 650 books to discover.
shortDescription: The library of Puy-Saint-André offers 650 books to discover.

label: Pont du Coq
comment: Technical prowess or devil's bridge? This bent bridge is very curious…
shortDescription: Technical prowess or devil's bridge? This bent bridge is very curious…

label: Village de Saint-Léger-du-Ventoux
comment: Come to the smallest village in the Vaucluse, on the northern flank of Mont Ventoux.
shortDescription: Come to the smallest village in the Vaucluse, on the northern flank of Mont Ventoux.

label: Plage du grand Boucharel
comment: After a very green passage along the coastal path, you will have to go along the road and then go up a staircase to take the path a little further before arriving at the Grand Boucharel beach.
shortDescription: After a very green passage along the coastal path, you will have to go along the road and then go up a staircase to take the path a little further before arriving at the Grand Boucharel beach.

label: Bibliothèque Municipale
comment: Public library
shortDescription: Public library

label: Village de Pelvoux
comment: This is the first leg of the GR54 trail after the Eychauda pass, Pelvoux and is made up of a succession of traditional hamlets: Le Poët, Le Sarret, Le Fangeas, Saint Antoine, (administrative centre), Les Claux, not forgetting Chambran and Ailefroide.
shortDescription: This is the first leg of the GR54 trail after the Eychauda pass, Pelvoux and is made up of a succession of traditional hamlets: Le Poët, Le Sarret, Le Fangeas, Saint Antoine, (administrative centre), Les Claux, not forgetting Chambran and Ailefroide.

label: Oratoires
comment: Le Beausset is one of the municipalities in France with the largest number of oratories.
shortDescription: Le Beausset is one of the municipalities in France with the largest number of oratories.

label: Calanque du Petit Caneiret
comment: A stone staircase of more than 100 steps leads to a pebble beach of 50 m in a setting dominated by a very beautiful supporting structure of the railway line and the Corniche d'Or. Parking along the road.
shortDescription: A stone staircase of more than 100 steps leads to a pebble beach of 50 m in a setting dominated by a very beautiful supporting structure of the railway line and the Corniche d'Or. Parking along the road.
streetAddress: ['Calanque du petit Caneiret', 'Route de la Corniche']

label: Moulin à Farine Saint Cassien des Bois
comment:
The wheat and oil mill of Saint Cassien is still hidden under the vegetation. Stroll along the Siagne river and this mill...
It is restored every summer by youth associations.
shortDescription:
The wheat and oil mill of Saint Cassien is still hidden under the vegetation. Stroll along the Siagne river and this mill...
It is restored every summer by youth associations.

label: Bibliothèque Pôle Francine Foussa
comment: The Municipal Library of Mazan offers you readings and films as well as events such as: exhibitions, creative workshops, tales, dedications and conferences.
shortDescription: The Municipal Library of Mazan offers you readings and films as well as events such as: exhibitions, creative workshops, tales, dedications and conferences.

label: Musée de la Vigne et du Vin
comment:
Located in the heart of the old town, the building is the former property of a family of wine growers who donated it to the Commune. It highlights the heritage that has made Pierrevert the wine capital of the Alpes-de-Haute-Provence.
Open in summer.
shortDescription:
Located in the heart of the old town, the building is the former property of a family of wine growers who donated it to the Commune. It highlights the heritage that has made Pierrevert the wine capital of the Alpes-de-Haute-Provence.
Open in summer.

label: Musée municipal
comment:
The museum of Forcalquier was created by the mayor Martial Sicard in 1912.
As a place of memory, it sheds light on the history of the city and preserves the traces of the culture of Haute Provence.
shortDescription:
The museum of Forcalquier was created by the mayor Martial Sicard in 1912.

Singular experience as that of Andy Goldsworthy, artist
internationally recognized, which imagines a project combining contemporary art

label: Pont de la Reine Jeanne
comment:
In this small valley, this humpback beam bridge over the River Vançon reflects the life of yesteryear.
A mediaeval construction from the 14th century, the bridge gave access to the village of Saint-Symphorien. Queen Joan, Countess of Provence and Queen of Naples in the 14th century, is thought to have given it to the residents of the village as thanks for offering her refuge when she was accused of the murder of her husband, Andrew of Hungary (King of Naples).
shortDescription:
In this small valley, this humpback beam bridge over the River Vançon reflects the life of yesteryear.
A mediaeval construction from the 14th century, the bridge gave access to the village of Saint-Symphorien. Queen Joan, Countess of Provence and Queen of Naples in the 14th century, is thought to have given it to the residents of the village as thanks for offering her refuge when she was accused of the murder of her husband, Andrew of Hungary (King of Naples).

Go back in the footsteps of the Necropolis of Abadia.
Thanks to its explanatory panels as well as the funerary material found during the excavations, you will plunge back into the history of "Saint Etienne les Orgues du Vème siècle".

The Templars possessed indeed a vast operation in the Sauvebonne Valley. Restored, the tower is now an exhibition space. enhancement lighting. Open all year.
