label: Parc de la Villa Masséna
comment: Anglais, the Villa Masséna, nowadays a museum of art and history, is distinguished by the garden in which it is set.
shortDescription: Anglais, the Villa Masséna, nowadays a museum of art and history, is distinguished by the garden in which it is set.

label: Hôtel Particulier d'Albi
comment: The interiors contain some beautiful ceilings, exposed beams, staircase balusters and plasterwork decorations.
shortDescription: The interiors contain some beautiful ceilings, exposed beams, staircase balusters and plasterwork decorations.

label: Pagode Hong Hien
comment: Built in 1917 by the Indo-Chinese Riflemen present at Fréjus at Camp Galliéni before their deployment, the Pagoda is a sacred place of worship, unique in the Var.
shortDescription: Built in 1917 by the Indo-Chinese Riflemen present at Fréjus at Camp Galliéni before their deployment, the Pagoda is a sacred place of worship, unique in the Var.

label: Le phare
comment: At the end of the Wilson quay, you will find the lighthouse with a magnificent view over the bay of Sanary.
shortDescription: At the end of the Wilson quay, you will find the lighthouse with a magnificent view over the bay of Sanary.

label: Moulin à Huile du Barroux
comment: Oil mill of the Chapel Mill type erected in 1792, it operated until 1853. It still contains an apparent millstone and presses in Chapel. This monument is currently being restored.
shortDescription: Oil mill of the Chapel Mill type erected in 1792, it operated until 1853. It still contains an apparent millstone and presses in Chapel. This monument is currently being restored.

label: Passage de la rue de la République
comment: This passage allows to circulate from rue du Mont d'Or to rue Lemoyne.
shortDescription: This passage allows to circulate from rue du Mont d'Or to rue Lemoyne.
streetAddress: ["Entre la rue de la République, la rue du Mont d'Or et la rue Lemoyne", 'Rue de la République']

label: Plage des Sablettes
comment: The only beach in the area not to be pebble! Since its redevelopment, the environment is quieter and more pleasant. Ideal with young children because it is one of the shallowest beaches of the French Riviera.
shortDescription: The only beach in the area not to be pebble! Since its redevelopment, the environment is quieter and more pleasant. Ideal with young children because it is one of the shallowest beaches of the French Riviera.

label: 6 - La Place des Mûriers
comment: H - At n ° 36, house where was born on February 7, 1858, François Joseph Amédée Lamy, known under the name of Commandant Lamy.
shortDescription: H - At n ° 36, house where was born on February 7, 1858, François Joseph Amédée Lamy, known under the name of Commandant Lamy.

label: Musée de Vence et espace permanent Matisse
comment: Following the former exhibition, the permanent space is dedicated to show Vence’s personal Henri Matisse collection mainly composed of graphic works such as charcoals, lithographs, and etchings.
shortDescription: Following the former exhibition, the permanent space is dedicated to show Vence’s personal Henri Matisse collection mainly composed of graphic works such as charcoals, lithographs, and etchings.

label: Castel Plage
comment: Le Castel is a beautiful private beach in Nice, but it is also a restaurant offering breakfast and dinner facing the sea.
shortDescription: Le Castel is a beautiful private beach in Nice, but it is also a restaurant offering breakfast and dinner facing the sea.
streetAddress: ["(au pied de l'hôtel la Pérouse)", '8 quai des Etats-Unis']

label: Calanque de Maubois
comment:
The calanque of Maubois offers a pleasant break in a setting surrounded by the rocks of the Esterel. Wild landscape mixing vegetation and red gravel, it is one of the biggest creeks of this massif (150 meters).
Parking
Access by a steep staircase.
shortDescription:
The calanque of Maubois offers a pleasant break in a setting surrounded by the rocks of the Esterel. Wild landscape mixing vegetation and red gravel, it is one of the biggest creeks of this massif (150 meters).
Parking
Access by a steep staircase.

label: Vieil Eyguians
comment:
It was around 739 that the first village in Eyguians developed under the name of Laquaticum, which was then built further south.
Saracen invasions forced the inhabitants to flee to higher, safer ground. In 1264, the Mévouillon family, lords of Arzeliers, had a rampart built here. In 1888, a water shortage prompted the residents to leave the village.
shortDescription:
It was around 739 that the first village in Eyguians developed under the name of Laquaticum, which was then built further south.
Saracen invasions forced the inhabitants to flee to higher, safer ground. In 1264, the Mévouillon family, lords of Arzeliers, had a rampart built here. In 1888, a water shortage prompted the residents to leave the village.

label: Chapelle Notre-Dame du Mont
comment: Located on a beautiful site of the Breilloise olive grove, the chapel incorporates Romanesque apses, Gothic portals and a Baroque bell tower around its three Romanesque naves with baroque decorations.
shortDescription: Located on a beautiful site of the Breilloise olive grove, the chapel incorporates Romanesque apses, Gothic portals and a Baroque bell tower around its three Romanesque naves with baroque decorations.

label: MAT - Musée d'Art de Toulon
comment: Built in 1887 (by Gaudensi Allar), the Art Museum offers several spaces with specific vocations : A cabinet of curiosities, a reading room devoted to regionalist art, a place dedicated to cultural mediation as weel as office and conservation spaces.
shortDescription: Built in 1887 (by Gaudensi Allar), the Art Museum offers several spaces with specific vocations : A cabinet of curiosities, a reading room devoted to regionalist art, a place dedicated to cultural mediation as weel as office and conservation spaces.

label: Maison des Papillons - Musée Dany Lartigue
comment: You will discover a real gem in the heart of a private house located in the garden-filled old quarter.
shortDescription: You will discover a real gem in the heart of a private house located in the garden-filled old quarter.
streetAddress: ['17 rue Etienne Berny', 'Maison des Papillons - musée Dany Lartigue']

label: Castel Sainte Claire
comment: The maritime officer and archaeologist Olivier Voutier – best known for having excavated the Milo Venus – builds this peculiar neo-Romanesque villa. His gravesite can be seen at the top of the gardens close to the medieval tower. A few years later, the American writer Edith Wharton moves into the house and turns it into her own literary and botanical shelter. The building is now home to the offices of the Port-Cros National Park.
shortDescription: The maritime officer and archaeologist Olivier Voutier – best known for having excavated the Milo Venus – builds this peculiar neo-Romanesque villa. His gravesite can be seen at the top of the gardens close to the medieval tower. A few years later, the American writer Edith Wharton moves into the house and turns it into her own literary and botanical shelter. The building is now home to the offices of the Port-Cros National Park.

label: Plage de la Pescade
comment: This small sandy and pebbled cove benefits from the shade of the adjacent pine forest. The Temple of Love (white gazebo) is located on the right side of the beach and overlooks a natural pool. Not supervised, parking along the road.
shortDescription: This small sandy and pebbled cove benefits from the shade of the adjacent pine forest. The Temple of Love (white gazebo) is located on the right side of the beach and overlooks a natural pool. Not supervised, parking along the road.

label: Bibliothèque
comment: Municipal library
shortDescription: Municipal library

label: Village perché de Montmorin
comment: Guided by the paved pathways, discover the attractions of this "perched" village between Provence and Dauphiné.
shortDescription: Guided by the paved pathways, discover the attractions of this "perched" village between Provence and Dauphiné.

label: L’église Anglicane Saint John
comment: Built in 1867 in the neo-Gothic style. Completely renovated, the walls of the apse decorated with marble and Italian mosaics in the Pre-Raphaelite style. The base of the altar is made of wood and represents the disciples of Emmaus and the sacrament.
shortDescription: Built in 1867 in the neo-Gothic style. Completely renovated, the walls of the apse decorated with marble and Italian mosaics in the Pre-Raphaelite style. The base of the altar is made of wood and represents the disciples of Emmaus and the sacrament.

label: Eglise paroissiale Sancta-Maria In Albis
comment: Parish church, classified Historical Monument , it was completed around 1700 on the site of an old medieval church very damaged in the seventeenth century. Imbued with the regional baroque context of the time, its design is extremely original.
shortDescription: Parish church, classified Historical Monument , it was completed around 1700 on the site of an old medieval church very damaged in the seventeenth century. Imbued with the regional baroque context of the time, its design is extremely original.

label: Cimetière de Saint-Pancrace
comment: The extension of the Saint-Pancrace cemetery by architect Marc Barani. has become a classic in the recent history of cemeteries. It is only one-third of the original project. This is this architect's first construction site.
shortDescription: The extension of the Saint-Pancrace cemetery by architect Marc Barani. has become a classic in the recent history of cemeteries. It is only one-third of the original project. This is this architect's first construction site.

label: Plage Fon Marina - Plage publique
comment: Fon Marina Beach is a public beach. Located on the roadside, near the Napoule district.
shortDescription: Fon Marina Beach is a public beach. Located on the roadside, near the Napoule district.

label: Eco Beach - Saint Cassien
comment: Multi activities leisure center, 100% FUN on the banks of the St Cassien Lake. This is an area dedicated to families and outdoors leisure activities. It offers numerous fun and unexpected activities.
shortDescription: Multi activities leisure center, 100% FUN on the banks of the St Cassien Lake. This is an area dedicated to families and outdoors leisure activities. It offers numerous fun and unexpected activities.
streetAddress: ['CD 37', 'Lac de St Cassien', 'pont du pré Claou']

label: Plage Aréna
comment: Located at the foot of the Rock of Roquebrune-sur-Argens, at the Lac Perrin lakeside
shortDescription: Located at the foot of the Rock of Roquebrune-sur-Argens, at the Lac Perrin lakeside

label: Grotte du Lazaret
comment: Located at the foot of Mont Boron, the Grotte du Lazaret traces 70,000 years of human evolution in Nice. A site to visit to immerse yourself in the prehistoric era
shortDescription: Located at the foot of Mont Boron, the Grotte du Lazaret traces 70,000 years of human evolution in Nice. A site to visit to immerse yourself in the prehistoric era

label: Plan d'eau de Pigerolles
comment:
The Rosans lake welcomes you all summer long
It is located at the exit of the village in a pleasant, semi-wooded area with sanitary facilities and shower, lifeguard in a delimited area, brasserie - snack bar, picnic area and bowling green.
shortDescription:
The Rosans lake welcomes you all summer long
It is located at the exit of the village in a pleasant, semi-wooded area with sanitary facilities and shower, lifeguard in a delimited area, brasserie - snack bar, picnic area and bowling green.

label: Domaine Les Toulons - vestiges gallo-romains
comment: Remains of one of the largest wine-producing villa of the Gallo-Roman period. Free access, please stay on the perimeter of the site in order not to damage it. Pottery and other elements found on the site can be seen in the cellar of the domain, 500 m further on.
shortDescription: Remains of one of the largest wine-producing villa of the Gallo-Roman period. Free access, please stay on the perimeter of the site in order not to damage it. Pottery and other elements found on the site can be seen in the cellar of the domain, 500 m further on.

label: Plage de Sulagran
comment: An idyllic landscape !
shortDescription: An idyllic landscape !

label: Village de Saint-Roman-de-Malegarde
comment: Saint-Roman-de-Malegarde on the Drôme border is, a few kilometres from Vaison-la-Romaine. The upper part of the village has steep and narrow streets.
shortDescription: Saint-Roman-de-Malegarde on the Drôme border is, a few kilometres from Vaison-la-Romaine. The upper part of the village has steep and narrow streets.

label: Plan d'Eau du Camping Val de Durance
comment: Nice lake at the heart of the Luberon.
shortDescription: Nice lake at the heart of the Luberon.

label: Jardin Emmanuel Lopez
comment: Emmanuel Lopez garden brings together plants adapted to the Mediterranean climate, and a wide variety of palm trees.
shortDescription: Emmanuel Lopez garden brings together plants adapted to the Mediterranean climate, and a wide variety of palm trees.

label: Chapelle des pénitents noirs - Chapelle de la Miséricorde
comment: Chapel of Mercy was originally a convent of Capuchins. The severity and sobriety of its facade meet the requirements of St Francis of Assisi who does not allow wealth even in the churches of the order. Its steeple rises to 35 meters.
shortDescription: Chapel of Mercy was originally a convent of Capuchins. The severity and sobriety of its facade meet the requirements of St Francis of Assisi who does not allow wealth even in the churches of the order. Its steeple rises to 35 meters.

label: Tour Royale
comment: Locally nicknamed "the big tower", the Royal Tower was the first defense post erected in the bay of Toulon. This site can be visited but only in summer.
shortDescription: Locally nicknamed "the big tower", the Royal Tower was the first defense post erected in the bay of Toulon. This site can be visited but only in summer.

label: 1 - Place Roger Vergé
comment:
A - Sculpture "Pablo" by Gabriël Sterk inaugurated on April 8, 2018 for the 45th anniversary of Picasso's death.

B - Lava plan of the Village produced by Gérard Buisson Grimbert.
shortDescription:
A - Sculpture "Pablo" by Gabriël Sterk inaugurated on April 8, 2018 for the 45th anniversary of Picasso's death.

B - Lava plan of the Village produced by Gérard Buisson Grimbert.

label: La collégiale Notre-Dame-de-Nazareth
comment: Beautiful 11th century building in Romanesque Provencal style.
shortDescription: Beautiful 11th century building in Romanesque Provencal style.

label: Hameau de Morignole
comment: It is the only one of the Brigasque hamlets that became French with La Brigue in 1947. In the heart of the hamlet is the 19th century Church of St. James the Major, its cobbled streets and stone houses make it a charming site to visit.
shortDescription: It is the only one of the Brigasque hamlets that became French with La Brigue in 1947. In the heart of the hamlet is the 19th century Church of St. James the Major, its cobbled streets and stone houses make it a charming site to visit.

label: Plage du restaurant Chez Pierre
comment: Come and relax and enjoy activities on the waters of the lake of Saint Cassien Chez Pierre
shortDescription: Come and relax and enjoy activities on the waters of the lake of Saint Cassien Chez Pierre

label: Plage du Rayol
comment: The attractive cove of Rayol with soft and dazzling white sand is made up of 2 beaches. Crystal-clear waters, greenery, red roc and the Hyères islands as the backdrop. A forever portfolio of images etched on your memory.
shortDescription: The attractive cove of Rayol with soft and dazzling white sand is made up of 2 beaches. Crystal-clear waters, greenery, red roc and the Hyères islands as the backdrop. A forever portfolio of images etched on your memory.

label: Plage de la Briande
comment: Here you are! Paradise awaits you! Access to this beach is via the coastal path and/or forest tracks so bring trainers, a hat, a picnic and some water.
shortDescription: Here you are! Paradise awaits you! Access to this beach is via the coastal path and/or forest tracks so bring trainers, a hat, a picnic and some water.

label: Hôtel Particulier de Gaste
comment: This old town house belonged to an old noble family. Its houses today the rectory.
shortDescription: This old town house belonged to an old noble family. Its houses today the rectory.

label: Plage de Bonporteau
comment: After a gently sloping walk or bike ride you will find wild Eucalyptus, Tamarisk and Washingtonia palms overlooking a wide cove lined with rocks and fine sand.
shortDescription: After a gently sloping walk or bike ride you will find wild Eucalyptus, Tamarisk and Washingtonia palms overlooking a wide cove lined with rocks and fine sand.

label: Médiathèque municipale du Beausset
comment:
The municipal media library of Le Beausset opened its doors in 2020
In a new, spacious and comfortable setting, come and (re)discover the books, magazines, CDs and DVDs of your choice.
shortDescription:
The municipal media library of Le Beausset opened its doors in 2020
In a new, spacious and comfortable setting, come and (re)discover the books, magazines, CDs and DVDs of your choice.

label: Plage Trou Madame
comment: Small rocky creek. According to the legend, the Lord's wife took her bath in a sort of pond dug by the sea. This used to be the perfect place for fishes due to its low level, it now is the best spot for surfing.
shortDescription: Small rocky creek. According to the legend, the Lord's wife took her bath in a sort of pond dug by the sea. This used to be the perfect place for fishes due to its low level, it now is the best spot for surfing.

label: Pont-Vieux
comment:
The bridge over the Bévéra river has been attested on the road between Nice and the Piemont as early as the 13th century.
Temporary exhibitions take place inside the Pont-Vieux. For any information, contact the tourist information office of Sospel
shortDescription:
The bridge over the Bévéra river has been attested on the road between Nice and the Piemont as early as the 13th century.
Temporary exhibitions take place inside the Pont-Vieux. For any information, contact the tourist information office of Sospel

label: Médiathèque de Tanneron
comment: Tanneron's team of volunteers welcomes you warmly and advises you!
shortDescription: Tanneron's team of volunteers welcomes you warmly and advises you!

label: Village du Brusquet
comment: Le Brusquet is a largely residential commune located at the gates of Digne-les-Bains, in the Bléone valley, at an altitude of 780 metres.
shortDescription: Le Brusquet is a largely residential commune located at the gates of Digne-les-Bains, in the Bléone valley, at an altitude of 780 metres.

label: Bibliothèque pour tous
streetAddress: ['131 Avenue de Lattre de Tassigny', 'Immeuble Les Gémeaux']

label: Musée Archéologique de l'Hôtel Dieu
comment: Located near the Porte d'Avignon, a vestige of the old city walls, the chapel of the former Hôtel-Dieu has housed the collections of the archaeological museum since 1912.
shortDescription: Located near the Porte d'Avignon, a vestige of the old city walls, the chapel of the former Hôtel-Dieu has housed the collections of the archaeological museum since 1912.

label: Monument des martyrs de la Résistance
comment: This monument, built in 1964, is dedicated to Resistance martyrs.
shortDescription: This monument, built in 1964, is dedicated to Resistance martyrs.

label: Basilique Saint-Pierre
comment: Church with architectural features from the 14th century, late 15th century, and early 16th century.
shortDescription: Church with architectural features from the 14th century, late 15th century, and early 16th century.

label: Médiathèque de Mison
comment: The Mison Media Library is run by the Lire à Mison association. It is located behind the post office, a stone's throw from the town hall with a small garden where you can linger and leaf through a book or magazine.
shortDescription: The Mison Media Library is run by the Lire à Mison association. It is located behind the post office, a stone's throw from the town hall with a small garden where you can linger and leaf through a book or magazine.

label: Plage du Loup
comment:
Beach of natural elements (+ sand in summer) - Beach restaurants and shops nearby - First aid post in summer - Anti-smoking beach - Showers and WC. Handi-beach and PMR access.
Parking and bicycle park.
shortDescription:
Beach of natural elements (+ sand in summer) - Beach restaurants and shops nearby - First aid post in summer - Anti-smoking beach - Showers and WC. Handi-beach and PMR access.
Parking and bicycle park.
streetAddress: ['Accès Allée de la Plage', 'Bd des Italiens']

label: Musée numérique Micro-folie
comment: Digital museum and virtual reality. Discover a rich collection of more than 6,000 works from 114 national and international museums and institutions.
shortDescription: Digital museum and virtual reality. Discover a rich collection of more than 6,000 works from 114 national and international museums and institutions.

label: Baptistère de Venasque
comment: The baptistery was built in the 6th century, (possibly on the ruins of a Roman temple) and underwent work in the 11th, 12th and 13th centuries. It was restored in the 19th century by 'Monuments Historiques'.
shortDescription: The baptistery was built in the 6th century, (possibly on the ruins of a Roman temple) and underwent work in the 11th, 12th and 13th centuries. It was restored in the 19th century by 'Monuments Historiques'.

label: Porte d'Orée
comment: The eastern gate of Orée is the only visible vestige of the thermal baths of the Roman port.
shortDescription: The eastern gate of Orée is the only visible vestige of the thermal baths of the Roman port.

label: Fort-Queyras
comment: Stone star on its glacial lock, dominating the gorges of the Guil, Fort-Queyras is impressive with its characteristic silhouette of the works of Vauban! Impossible to miss this emblem cherished by the Queyrassins, you pass at its feet to go up the valley!
shortDescription: Stone star on its glacial lock, dominating the gorges of the Guil, Fort-Queyras is impressive with its characteristic silhouette of the works of Vauban! Impossible to miss this emblem cherished by the Queyrassins, you pass at its feet to go up the valley!

label: Musée d'Histoire & d'Art
comment:
Exhibition and original collection tracing the history of the French army.
Documents, uniforms, badges and decorations, arms, paintings, models illustrating souvenirs from World War One until the Gulf War passing by the Resistance.
shortDescription:
Exhibition and original collection tracing the history of the French army.
Documents, uniforms, badges and decorations, arms, paintings, models illustrating souvenirs from World War One until the Gulf War passing by the Resistance.

label: Église Saint Trophyme
comment:
Built in the 18th century, its architecture is of Romanesque inspiration
Preceded by the very flowery Georges Pompidou square, its facade features a pretty sundial.
shortDescription:
Built in the 18th century, its architecture is of Romanesque inspiration
Preceded by the very flowery Georges Pompidou square, its facade features a pretty sundial.

label: Le refuge des animaux
comment: As soon as you enter this old renovated farmhouse, you are greeted by the songs of birds that invite you to take a walk among the mountain animals. A total immersion ideal for children where interactive games and animations await them.
shortDescription: As soon as you enter this old renovated farmhouse, you are greeted by the songs of birds that invite you to take a walk among the mountain animals. A total immersion ideal for children where interactive games and animations await them.

label: Bibliothèque
comment:
New books for everyone and for all tastes!
Novels, comics for adults and children, science fiction.
shortDescription:
New books for everyone and for all tastes!
Novels, comics for adults and children, science fiction.

label: Carillon de la rue de l'Oratoire
comment:
The carillon on Rue de l’Oratoire was installed in late summer 2012.
It is comprised of twelve bells that chime every hour (10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.), playing the celebrated Provençal anthem “Se Canto.”
shortDescription:
The carillon on Rue de l’Oratoire was installed in late summer 2012.
It is comprised of twelve bells that chime every hour (10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.), playing the celebrated Provençal anthem “Se Canto.”

label: Plage de La Vieille
comment: Sandy beach, located at the entrance of the port, one can admire the boats in the "small harbor" of Toulon.
shortDescription: Sandy beach, located at the entrance of the port, one can admire the boats in the "small harbor" of Toulon.

label: Maëma Plage
comment: In Cannes, the seaside inevitably makes you want to take advantage of every moment to relax. With this in mind, we have created Maema Plage du Midi: a sunny space that invites you to relax.
shortDescription: In Cannes, the seaside inevitably makes you want to take advantage of every moment to relax. With this in mind, we have created Maema Plage du Midi: a sunny space that invites you to relax.

label: Plage de la Péguière
comment: 100 m of sand, only for swimmers. Located on the roadside, near the thalassotherapy centre. Public toilets. This beach is supervised. Forbidden to animals and windsurfing boards for safety reasons.
shortDescription: 100 m of sand, only for swimmers. Located on the roadside, near the thalassotherapy centre. Public toilets. This beach is supervised. Forbidden to animals and windsurfing boards for safety reasons.

label: Abbaye Notre Dame de Bon Secours
comment: Haven of peace and calm at the heart of Provence in the village of Blauvac, discover this abbay where the nuns - set up since 1991- will open the doors of their church, their gardens and their monastic shop.
shortDescription: Haven of peace and calm at the heart of Provence in the village of Blauvac, discover this abbay where the nuns - set up since 1991- will open the doors of their church, their gardens and their monastic shop.

label: Maison Nature & Patrimoines
comment: A point of departure, welcome and discovery, it opens its doors to the natural and cultural riches of the Verdon territory thanks to exhibitions, 1000 tips from the Parc du Verdon, a shop and activities throughout the year.
shortDescription: A point of departure, welcome and discovery, it opens its doors to the natural and cultural riches of the Verdon territory thanks to exhibitions, 1000 tips from the Parc du Verdon, a shop and activities throughout the year.

label: Collégiale Saint Paul
comment: Provençal Romanesque building from the twelfth century, with a Gothic nave of the fourteenth century. The collegiate contains one of the largest ex-votos of France collections (432 tables), magnificent stained glass windows and altarpieces
shortDescription: Provençal Romanesque building from the twelfth century, with a Gothic nave of the fourteenth century. The collegiate contains one of the largest ex-votos of France collections (432 tables), magnificent stained glass windows and altarpieces

label: Locomotive 4B9
comment: Carnoules was for many years a railway depot. In memory of this past, a steam locomotive stands at the entrance of the village.
shortDescription: Carnoules was for many years a railway depot. In memory of this past, a steam locomotive stands at the entrance of the village.

label: Saint-André-de-Rosans
comment: Saint-André-de-Rosans has conserved numerous traces of its prestigious past. The ruins of a Benedictine priory founded by the Order of Cluny in the 10th century can be seen here.
shortDescription: Saint-André-de-Rosans has conserved numerous traces of its prestigious past. The ruins of a Benedictine priory founded by the Order of Cluny in the 10th century can be seen here.

label: Lac de Valréas
comment: Less than a kilometre from the town centre, the lake of Valréas welcomes you for a fishing trip, a game of pétanque under the plane trees, a drink or a meal at the water's edge.
shortDescription: Less than a kilometre from the town centre, the lake of Valréas welcomes you for a fishing trip, a game of pétanque under the plane trees, a drink or a meal at the water's edge.

label: Porte du Soubeyran
comment: Situated to the north of the medieval enclosure, the Soubeyran gate was built in the 13th century. It is thus anterior to the Saunerie Gate. It commanded the entrance of the city in the Middle Ages.
shortDescription: Situated to the north of the medieval enclosure, the Soubeyran gate was built in the 13th century. It is thus anterior to the Saunerie Gate. It commanded the entrance of the city in the Middle Ages.

label: Jardin de la Fondation Maeght
comment:
The Fondation Marguerite et Aimé Maeght is a mythical place on the Côte d'Azur
d'Azur, unique in Europe. Inaugurated in 1964, the building erected on the hill of
Gardettes, not far from Saint-Paul de Vence, is the work of Josep Lluís Sert.
shortDescription:
The Fondation Marguerite et Aimé Maeght is a mythical place on the Côte d'Azur
d'Azur, unique in Europe. Inaugurated in 1964, the building erected on the hill of
Gardettes, not far from Saint-Paul de Vence, is the work of Josep Lluís Sert.

label: Bibliothèque Municipale
comment: Magali and her team of volunteers look forward to seeing you.
shortDescription: Magali and her team of volunteers look forward to seeing you.

label: Oratoire Saint-Pierre
comment: Built in the middle of the 19th century, in polychrome stone and wrought iron.
shortDescription: Built in the middle of the 19th century, in polychrome stone and wrought iron.

label: Monument Aux Morts
comment: Built thanks to a public subscription, this monument contains the names of the Saorgians who died during the First World War.
shortDescription: Built thanks to a public subscription, this monument contains the names of the Saorgians who died during the First World War.

label: Village de Majastres
comment: At an altitude of 1,143 metres, the village of Majastres is situated near pine, oak and larch forests.
shortDescription: At an altitude of 1,143 metres, the village of Majastres is situated near pine, oak and larch forests.

label: Musée départemental des Merveilles à Tende
comment: In 1987 the Alpes-Maritimes region and the town of Tende decided to open a museum dedicated to the petroglyphs of Mont Bégo. The musée des Merveilles in Tende <as inaugurated in 1996. It is a good idea to visit the museum beforeMont Bégo as it helps to understand the petroglyphs in situ. The hike to Mont Bégo takes one day there and back, and visitors to Mont Bégo need to be in good phtysical condition, otherwise they shoucl consider visiting the museu^m only
shortDescription: In 1987 the Alpes-Maritimes region and the town of Tende decided to open a museum dedicated to the petroglyphs of Mont Bégo. The musée des Merveilles in Tende <as inaugurated in 1996. It is a good idea to visit the museum beforeMont Bégo as it helps to understand the petroglyphs in situ. The hike to Mont Bégo takes one day there and back, and visitors to Mont Bégo need to be in good phtysical condition, otherwise they shoucl consider visiting the museu^m only

label: Village de Savoillans
comment: Savoillans is an isolated village, between mountains and meadows, a place of absolute calm. It is located in the Toulourenc valley at the northern base of the legendary Mont Ventoux. The village focusses on lavender and spelt cultivation.
shortDescription: Savoillans is an isolated village, between mountains and meadows, a place of absolute calm. It is located in the Toulourenc valley at the northern base of the legendary Mont Ventoux. The village focusses on lavender and spelt cultivation.

label: Oratoire Saint Roch
comment: According to custom, this oratory is built on the site of the former chapel of Saint Roch, mentioned in the documents until the twelfth century.
shortDescription: According to custom, this oratory is built on the site of the former chapel of Saint Roch, mentioned in the documents until the twelfth century.

label: Le jardin Singulier - Esprit des lieux
comment: Art and nature. An interactive Land Art trail in constant evolution. Botanical routes, photos and hikes. In the old forest house, a bookshop and a publishing house. And also a place to eat and relax.
shortDescription: Art and nature. An interactive Land Art trail in constant evolution. Botanical routes, photos and hikes. In the old forest house, a bookshop and a publishing house. And also a place to eat and relax.

Ca d'Arbine
Atypical building housing beehives; beekeeping.
Visible from the outside.

Ca d'Arbine

shortDescription: The oratory of Tourtour, named "Sainte Anne" in homage to the chapel of Sainte-Anne.

label: Forteresse de Tournoux - Batterie des Caurres
comment: Work on the Fort de Tournoux began in 1843 with the aim of defending the region against invasions from Italy. These massive, spectacular fortifications constituted the core of the valley's strategic defence.
shortDescription: Work on the Fort de Tournoux began in 1843 with the aim of defending the region against invasions from Italy. These massive, spectacular fortifications constituted the core of the valley's strategic defence.

Public library open to everyone 
Free loan books, novels, detective, cartoons, documentaries, background mountains ...

Audio recordings (rhymes, stories and novels)

comment: This small urban garden reflects Andalusian art: seashell fountain, columns decorated with mosaics, pergolas, benches, a small corner of paradise with a change of scenery.
shortDescription: This small urban garden reflects Andalusian art: seashell fountain, columns decorated with mosaics, pergolas, benches, a small corner of paradise with a change of scenery.

label: Beaumont English Language Library

shortDescription: The BELL library opened its doors in 1985 from a private collection. Today, as a result of donations and purchases, over 12,000 books in English are at your disposal!

label: Cathédrale Saint-Michel
comment: In the course of a winding  street, you will discover the impressive cathedral Saint-Michel with a Baroque facade. Flanked by a XIII th century bell tower, it dominates a grandiose architectural ensemble from the Baroque era which forms a magnificient setting.
shortDescription: In the course of a winding  street, you will discover the impressive cathedral Saint-Michel with a Baroque facade. Flanked by a XIII th century bell tower, it dominates a grandiose architectural ensemble from the Baroque era which forms a magnificient setting.

label: Parc de loisirs
comment: A wonderfull area around an articial lake of 15000m² where  activities and relaxation are offered to everybody ; young and adults will enjy this space accessible to all and adapted to the rhythm of each.

comment: Library, web access
shortDescription: Library, web access

label: Bibliothèque de La Bâtie-Vieille
comment: The library in the Old Town Building was inaugurated in May 2018. It is now located on the ground floor of the communal building. It is open on Monday and Wednesday afternoons from 2 to 4 pm.
shortDescription: The library in the Old Town Building was inaugurated in May 2018. It is now located on the ground floor of the communal building. It is open on Monday and Wednesday afternoons from 2 to 4 pm.

label: Médiathèque intercommunale de Villeneuve

shortDescription: Located close to the school and the crèche, the Villeneuve library has recently been moved to a modern building. Due to its recent computerization, you can access all the books offered among the 4000 referenced titles.

label: Bibliothèque Villa Saint-Hilaire
comment:
La Villa Saint-Hilaire, is now a Home, Garden, and Landscape Resource Center which was officially unveiled on May 29, 2015.
The content, book, media, and educational selection focuses on the individual relationship between man and nature, dovetailing heritage and public reading opportunities.
shortDescription:
La Villa Saint-Hilaire, is now a Home, Garden, and Landscape Resource Center which was officially unveiled on May 29, 2015.
The content, book, media, and educational selection focuses on the individual relationship between man and nature, dovetailing heritage and public reading opportunities.

label: Eglise Sainte Madeleine
comment: The nave of this south-west/north-east facing building, laid out on a cross plan, is intersected by two chapels that make up the transept. It is illuminated by the rose window on the façade and by twin windows.
shortDescription: The nave of this south-west/north-east facing building, laid out on a cross plan, is intersected by two chapels that make up the transept. It is illuminated by the rose window on the façade and by twin windows.

label: Monument aux Morts
comment: The decision to erect a monument to recall the names of the dead Fontanais for France was taken by the Municipal Council on July 6, 1919.
shortDescription: The decision to erect a monument to recall the names of the dead Fontanais for France was taken by the Municipal Council on July 6, 1919.

label: Gorbio village médiéval
comment: Gorbio, a perched village in the Mentonnais region, with its porticoed houses and vaulted passages, has retained all the charm of a medieval town. The Lascaris Castle-Museum, the Flamenco festival and the traditional festivals attract visitors and walkers.
shortDescription: Gorbio, a perched village in the Mentonnais region, with its porticoed houses and vaulted passages, has retained all the charm of a medieval town. The Lascaris Castle-Museum, the Flamenco festival and the traditional festivals attract visitors and walkers.

label: Médiathèque de Sarrians
comment: The Sarrians media library is a place for all lovers of reading in all its forms: books, novels, comic books, manga, magazines, etc... Music is not forgotten with a beautiful collection of CDs. Audiobooks are also available.
shortDescription: The Sarrians media library is a place for all lovers of reading in all its forms: books, novels, comic books, manga, magazines, etc... Music is not forgotten with a beautiful collection of CDs. Audiobooks are also available.

label: Eglise Saint-Michel
comment: Surprising church with a baroque appearance.
shortDescription: Surprising church with a baroque appearance.

label: Base de loisirs de la Germanette
comment: The Germanette lake offers a nice refreshing stop. Composed of three natural pools (for swimming, water and fishing activities) it is an ideal relaxing place.  Swimming is supervised from July 1 to August 31. A beach bar is open during the season and a restaurant all year round.
shortDescription: The Germanette lake offers a nice refreshing stop. Composed of three natural pools (for swimming, water and fishing activities) it is an ideal relaxing place.  Swimming is supervised from July 1 to August 31. A beach bar is open during the season and a restaurant all year round.

label: Eglise Saint-Géraud
comment: Parish church mentioned in 1516. It is in Romanesque style. Its location close to the houses, without a forecourt, makes its originality. Its facade is made up of many reuses (arcade, stone with an engraved inscription).
shortDescription: Parish church mentioned in 1516. It is in Romanesque style. Its location close to the houses, without a forecourt, makes its originality. Its facade is made up of many reuses (arcade, stone with an engraved inscription).

comment: Saint-Léonce Cathedral in Fréjus.
shortDescription: Saint-Léonce Cathedral in Fréjus.

label: Parfumerie Fragonard - Usine Historique
comment: This very beautiful factory established in a 19th century building sits in the heart of the old town where our perfumes and soaps are crafted everyday. It is one of the oldest factories in Grasse.
shortDescription: This very beautiful factory established in a 19th century building sits in the heart of the old town where our perfumes and soaps are crafted everyday. It is one of the oldest factories in Grasse.

label: Bibliothèque-Musée Inguimbertine à l'hôtel Dieu
comment: The Inguimbertine at the Hôtel-Dieu is a modern library, completely connected to the future but also to the past. This is what makes this place atypical! It comes alive with digital workshops, readings, conferences and cultural events.
shortDescription: The Inguimbertine at the Hôtel-Dieu is a modern library, completely connected to the future but also to the past. This is what makes this place atypical! It comes alive with digital workshops, readings, conferences and cultural events.

label: Chapelle Saint-Antoine l'Ermite
comment:
Chapel at the end of the village at the foot of olive groves. 
Opened occasionally during specific celebrations.
Possibility to see it from the outside all year round.
shortDescription:
Chapel at the end of the village at the foot of olive groves.

label: Eglise Saint-Pierre
comment: Built in 1880 to replace the old chapel, the church of St Pierre Giens worth a visit. Go through the door and see the starry sky and shimmering colors.
shortDescription: Built in 1880 to replace the old chapel, the church of St Pierre Giens worth a visit. Go through the door and see the starry sky and shimmering colors.

label: Jardin de Pétrarque

shortDescription: In the heart of the village of Fontaine-de-Vaucluse, stroll along the Sorgue River, in the Jardin de Pétrarque.

label: Jardin botanique Le Maurier
comment: Founded in 1994, this small garden at an altitude of 1000 m is now part of the UNESCO Geopark of Haute Provence.  A range of wild, medicinal and edible alpine plants as well as old roses are presented.
shortDescription: Founded in 1994, this small garden at an altitude of 1000 m is now part of the UNESCO Geopark of Haute Provence.  A range of wild, medicinal and edible alpine plants as well as old roses are presented.

label: Obélisque Napoléon
comment:
The Obelisk was raised to the glory of Napoleon and inaugurated on April 12, 1804.
It is located at the exit of the village of Montgenèvre and its history is linked to the construction of the pass road.
shortDescription:
The Obelisk was raised to the glory of Napoleon and inaugurated on April 12, 1804.
It is located at the exit of the village of Montgenèvre and its history is linked to the construction of the pass road.

label: Chemin des Roys & oratoires
comment: From Nans Les Pins, kings, queens, popes and simple pilgrims used to take the itinerary now called The Way of the Kings to get to the Holy Balsam, after having gone to bow at the tomb of Mary Magdalene at Saint Maximin.
shortDescription: From Nans Les Pins, kings, queens, popes and simple pilgrims used to take the itinerary now called The Way of the Kings to get to the Holy Balsam, after having gone to bow at the tomb of Mary Magdalene at Saint Maximin.

shortDescription: Nestled in the village's narrow streets, the library is filled with documents for young and old. The children of the nursery school can enjoy story time every month.

label: Eglise Saint Victor
comment: Saint Victor chapel was erected on the former site of a romanic priory. Remarkable for its belltower, it shelters a golden wooden altarpiece dedicated to Saint Quinis - Vaison la Romaine bishop in the VIth century.
shortDescription: Saint Victor chapel was erected on the former site of a romanic priory. Remarkable for its belltower, it shelters a golden wooden altarpiece dedicated to Saint Quinis - Vaison la Romaine bishop in the VIth century.

shortDescription: 3000 objects and 1300 square meters of rooms.

label: Jardin Serre de la Madone

Take some books, read them, lend them, bring them back or suggest others! 
One library - Plage de La Madrague, Plage des Lecques on the Pink Walk (next to the central aid station) and Plage des Lecques at the Square Ferrié.

label: Cimetière du Vieux-Château

Built on the site of the old castle and culminating at 63 meters it has a view going from Italy to Cape Martin. It consists of superimposed terraces.
Foreign burials and those of Mentonnais rub shoulders.
shortDescription:
Built on the site of the old castle and culminating at 63 meters it has a view going from Italy to Cape Martin. It consists of superimposed terraces.

shortDescription: Overhanging the village by more than 170 metres, the Citadel is only accessible on foot via a paved path built by Vauban and offers an exceptional view of Entrevaux and the Var valley.

shortDescription: Open during exhibitions. Oil mill, pressing cylinder casings are preserved, embedded in the masonry of the ground floor.

shortDescription: This chapel of the White Penitents testifies to the baroque architecture with a facade framed by fluted pilasters with Corinthian capitals. Desecrated and restored, it is used for cultural activities that punctuate the life of the village.

shortDescription: CAIRN (Comtemporary art exhibitions inspired by nature) has the mission to connect and shape its surrounding region thanks to several artists like Mark Dion, Delphine Gigoux-Martin, herman de vries or Andy Goldsworthy.

Ethno-geologic museum, on the theme of mines and coal grounds.

label: Eglise Marie Agathe
comment: Probably an old chapel at the beginning of the Middle Ages, it is only in the XVIIth century when the castle falls into ruins (a chapel existed there during 8 centuries), that a new chapel will be built.

comment: One of the characteristics of this Romanesque style church is its bell tower, with a square base, on which a staircase leads to the 16th century Campanile.
shortDescription: One of the characteristics of this Romanesque style church is its bell tower, with a square base, on which a staircase leads to the 16th century Campanile.

label: Observatoire astronomique SIRENE
comment: In the heart of the lavender fields, the sky belongs to everyone. On the former missile launch zone of the Albion plateau, the SIRENE observatory, Site Réhabilité pour Nuits Étoilées is a perfect setting for astronomical observation.
shortDescription: In the heart of the lavender fields, the sky belongs to everyone. On the former missile launch zone of the Albion plateau, the SIRENE observatory, Site Réhabilité pour Nuits Étoilées is a perfect setting for astronomical observation.

label: Bastide Isnard

shortDescription: La Bastide Isnard offers a unique environment from which to explore Grasse’s extraordinary heritage. The garden is home to flowers, an olive grove, and natural springs, as well as a breathtaking view of the Mediterranean.

label: Villa Théo
comment: The Villa Theo, house of neo-impressionnist painter Théo Van Rysselberghe, which truly forms part of cultural and historical heritage of Le Lavandou dates back to 1910.
shortDescription: The Villa Theo, house of neo-impressionnist painter Théo Van Rysselberghe, which truly forms part of cultural and historical heritage of Le Lavandou dates back to 1910.

label: Plage des Eaux Douce
comment: A natural beach to discover dedicated to water sports and microlight flights. This beach is mainly used by kitesurfers and windsurfers!
shortDescription: A natural beach to discover dedicated to water sports and microlight flights. This beach is mainly used by kitesurfers and windsurfers!

label: Plage Le Cabanon
comment: The Mediterranean at your disposal, comfortably installed on rented deckchairs with towels, you will enjoy a professional and friendly service in this privileged setting.
shortDescription: The Mediterranean at your disposal, comfortably installed on rented deckchairs with towels, you will enjoy a professional and friendly service in this privileged setting.

label: Plage du Martinez
comment: Under the sun of the Côte d'Azur, lulled by a light breeze that gently caresses the palm trees... From early morning to sunset, enjoy unique experiences at La Plage du Martinez.
shortDescription: Under the sun of the Côte d'Azur, lulled by a light breeze that gently caresses the palm trees... From early morning to sunset, enjoy unique experiences at La Plage du Martinez.

label: Maison du Connétable Lesdiguières
comment: It is a fine example of Renaissance architecture, very well restored under the aegis of the architect of the Bâtiments de France. The facade is made of polychrome gypsum. The sculpted head would be that of Marie Vignon second wife of Lesdiguières.
shortDescription: It is a fine example of Renaissance architecture, very well restored under the aegis of the architect of the Bâtiments de France. The facade is made of polychrome gypsum. The sculpted head would be that of Marie Vignon second wife of Lesdiguières.

label: Le Pont du Beynon emprunté par Napoléon
comment: To block the royalist troops after his return from Elba, Napoleon tried to make it disappear: the bridge did not move a millimeter. Seeing its solidity, the Emperor addressed the bridge directly: "I would have thought you were made of solid gold".
shortDescription: To block the royalist troops after his return from Elba, Napoleon tried to make it disappear: the bridge did not move a millimeter. Seeing its solidity, the Emperor addressed the bridge directly: "I would have thought you were made of solid gold".

label: Musée de la Vannerie
comment: A rich collection of tools and original creations!
shortDescription: A rich collection of tools and original creations!

label: Le Colorado de Rustrel
comment: Explore the Colorado of Rustrel, its grandiose site with stunning contrasts, the many hues from luminous yellow to deep red, that were extracted by six generations of mineworkers.
shortDescription: Explore the Colorado of Rustrel, its grandiose site with stunning contrasts, the many hues from luminous yellow to deep red, that were extracted by six generations of mineworkers.

- "Handiplage" level 3. - Tobacco Free Beach.
Since 2019 the beach of Portissol is classified as "good quality".
shortDescription:
- "Handiplage" level 3. - Tobacco Free Beach.

label: La Porte des Sarrazins

shortDescription: The Porte des Sarrazins was the main entrance to the walls of the medieval fort of Garcin. It was opened in the walls of the ramparts, leï Barri, around the 14th century.

label: Musée de la Résistance

shortDescription: The Museum presents a permanent exhibition on the local Resistance. It recalls the historical facts of the Second World War, in Pernes and its surroundings. Access to the Museum is free.

label: Jardin d'agrumes du Palais de Carnolès - Jardin public
comment: The wonderful garden of the Palais Carnolès, classified among the remarkable gardens of France, surrounds the former summer residence of the Princes of Monaco and houses the most important collection of citrus fruits in Europe with 137 varieties of citrus in a single site.
shortDescription: The wonderful garden of the Palais Carnolès, classified among the remarkable gardens of France, surrounds the former summer residence of the Princes of Monaco and houses the most important collection of citrus fruits in Europe with 137 varieties of citrus in a single site.

label: Amphithéâtre Romain
comment: Built at the end of the 1st century A.D., this building, made of a small device of local green sandstone, could hold about 10,000 spectators.
shortDescription: Built at the end of the 1st century A.D., this building, made of a small device of local green sandstone, could hold about 10,000 spectators.

label: Plage du Cros

shortDescription: Only 600 metres from the small port at Brusc, the beach extends all along the cliff at Cros so it is easy to get to from the road. This sandy beach offers you a magnificent view of Les Embiez island.

A museum entirely devoted to antique toys and dolls.
The museum is open as follows: From Monday till Friday from 10.30am to 6.30pm. On Saturdays and Sundays from 11am to 5pm.
shortDescription:
A museum entirely devoted to antique toys and dolls.

A stone's throw from the city center, with the Citadel as a backdrop, a 5,000 m2 bathing area in a green and wooded area, open in summer.
A bathing access structure for people with motor disabilities, with a launching chair.
shortDescription:

shortDescription: Belgentier is a little village in the heart of the Valley of the Gapeau. It is surrounded by a typical vegetation of the region. The farming in terraces is still very present (olives, cherries …).

label: Palais Lascaris
comment:
Palace of the counts Lascaris-Ventimiglia built between the XV and the XVI century.
Acquired and renovated in a baroque style by the Town Hall in the 2000s, it hosts an exhibition dedicated to the Neolithic site of the Shelter of Pendimoun
shortDescription:
Palace of the counts Lascaris-Ventimiglia built between the XV and the XVI century.
Acquired and renovated in a baroque style by the Town Hall in the 2000s, it hosts an exhibition dedicated to the Neolithic site of the Shelter of Pendimoun

label: Place des Arcades
comment: Place des Arcades is located in the center of the first castrum of Biot. This square was the headquarters of the Knight Templars. Then the new population coming from Liguria surely gave it part of its current look.
shortDescription: Place des Arcades is located in the center of the first castrum of Biot. This square was the headquarters of the Knight Templars. Then the new population coming from Liguria surely gave it part of its current look.

label: Domaine de Manon
comment: The Domaine de Manon is an agricultural estate on the outskirts of Grasse, the perfume capital of the world. Since the 1930s, our family has been growing perfume plants on this land, preserving and passing down centuries-old savoir-faire in a region where such plants thrive, developing matchless quality.
shortDescription: The Domaine de Manon is an agricultural estate on the outskirts of Grasse, the perfume capital of the world. Since the 1930s, our family has been growing perfume plants on this land, preserving and passing down centuries-old savoir-faire in a region where such plants thrive, developing matchless quality.

label: Parc Sainte-Claire
comment: Located on the heights of the medieval town, this garden communicates via a picturesque trail with the modernist Villa Noailles and the St Bernard garden. The castle St Claire belonged at a time to the American writer Edith Wharton who created an impressive ensemble of terrace gardens in which she planted rare subtropical species. Most of them are from South America, Africa and Australia and bloom all through the year like the cycads, birds of paradise, musa trees, coral trees, aloes, yuccas, lantana and a rich collection of salvia.
shortDescription: Located on the heights of the medieval town, this garden communicates via a picturesque trail with the modernist Villa Noailles and the St Bernard garden. The castle St Claire belonged at a time to the American writer Edith Wharton who created an impressive ensemble of terrace gardens in which she planted rare subtropical species. Most of them are from South America, Africa and Australia and bloom all through the year like the cycads, birds of paradise, musa trees, coral trees, aloes, yuccas, lantana and a rich collection of salvia.

label: Ancien Palace : Grand Hôtel Balmoral
comment: The Grand Hotel Victoria is dated 1859 above the entrance, avenue Félix-Faure. Between 1889 and 1897 the hotel took the name of hotel du Littoral then that of hotel Balmoral.

PERFUME GARDEN

comment:
Sainte-Agnès is a charming village with medieval streets.  
Culminating at an altitude of nearly 800 metres, this coastal village is the highest in Europe and offers a magnificent panorama of the Bay of Menton and the coastline.

Sainte-Agnès is a charming village with medieval streets.

label: Aqueduc de Lagrand
comment: Remarkable 65m long structure on the torrent of Céans. Dating from the 11th century, it was used to pass a watering canal intended to irrigate the plain of Saléon.

label: La Chapelle Saint-Simon
comment: A small chapel located in the wood of Saint Simon on the edge of the GRP "Tour de la Dent du Ratier", which is the subject of a pilgrimage every year on August 6th. But why the 6th of August when the Saint Simon's day is the 28th of October ?
shortDescription: A small chapel located in the wood of Saint Simon on the edge of the GRP "Tour de la Dent du Ratier", which is the subject of a pilgrimage every year on August 6th. But why the 6th of August when the Saint Simon's day is the 28th of October ?

label: Musée du Vin - Maison Brotte
comment: Created in 1972 by Jeanne Brotte, the Wine Museum is something unique in its kind in Lassay-les-Châteaux. Originally a museum on a small scale with traditional winemaking tools, it was expanded in 2002 and developed in 2014 with the theme of the Winemaking Professions.
shortDescription: Created in 1972 by Jeanne Brotte, the Wine Museum is something unique in its kind in Lassay-les-Châteaux. Originally a museum on a small scale with traditional winemaking tools, it was expanded in 2002 and developed in 2014 with the theme of the Winemaking Professions.

comment: The church of Serres is dedicated to St Arey, bishop of Gap around 600. The whole belongs to the Provençal Romanesque style. A manuscript in the departmental archives dates back to the 7th or 9th century.

label: Château fort de Saint-Firmin
comment: At the entrance to the Valgaudemar, dominating the Drac plain and the RN 85 which passes at the foot of its rocky peak, stand the thick walls of a medieval fortified castle. Built in 1377, it protected the inhabitants from the bloody troubles of the Hundred Years War.

A masterly 15th century church, ideally situated in the centre of the village.
Wall paintings from the 15th century have been found in the building.

label: La Borne Territoriale
comment: This territorial marker, discovered in 1980 in the place known locally as Montbuisson, used to mark the border between Châteauneuf du Pape and the Principality of Orange. In its original position, the North-West facing side, marked with a bugle horn, faced Orange.
shortDescription: This territorial marker, discovered in 1980 in the place known locally as Montbuisson, used to mark the border between Châteauneuf du Pape and the Principality of Orange. In its original position, the North-West facing side, marked with a bugle horn, faced Orange.

shortDescription: In the heart of the old city centre, this museum displays a rich collection of paintings. You will find there outstanding masterpieces from artists such as Renoir, Rubens, Champaigne and many others.

shortDescription: The Thor was a fortified city with four gates in its walls. They were built in the 12th century.

label: Abbaye Notre Dame de Ganagobie
comment: In a remote time, monks chose the site of Ganagobie to live and pray there. Their patient work has transformed this site into a place where it seems as if man and creation have signed a pact of love and beauty.
shortDescription: In a remote time, monks chose the site of Ganagobie to live and pray there. Their patient work has transformed this site into a place where it seems as if man and creation have signed a pact of love and beauty.

This tour allows you to discover the history and heritage of the villages of La Faurie and Montbrand as well as their hamlets.

To discover the village a document in French and English is available at the tourist office sources du Buëch !
shortDescription:

label: Le Cours Stassart
comment: This course was created in the 1830s to fill in the ditches in the ramparts. Today lined with plane trees, it owes its name to Baron Stassart who donated abalones and acacias, the first trees that adorned this course.
shortDescription: This course was created in the 1830s to fill in the ditches in the ramparts. Today lined with plane trees, it owes its name to Baron Stassart who donated abalones and acacias, the first trees that adorned this course.

The Carthusian monastery of Notre-Dame de Durbon is an ancient Carthusian monastery, one of the first four of the order of Carthusian monks
Located in the hamlet of Durbon, 6 km north-east of Saint-Julien-en-Beauchêne, in the valley of the Bouriane torrent in the Hautes-Alpes.

Located in the hamlet of Durbon, 6 km north-east of Saint-Julien-en-Beauchêne, in the valley of the Bouriane torrent in the Hautes-Alpes.

label: Santons Marinacci
comment: Artisan santon maker since 1969 - Manufacture of the santon of Provence (painted santons 7 and 12 cm - and dressed santons 20 and 26 cm) - In the pure artisanal manufacture - out of ground of Aubagne - Moulded painted and dressed santons in GREOUX LES BAINS -
shortDescription: Artisan santon maker since 1969 - Manufacture of the santon of Provence (painted santons 7 and 12 cm - and dressed santons 20 and 26 cm) - In the pure artisanal manufacture - out of ground of Aubagne - Moulded painted and dressed santons in GREOUX LES BAINS -

label: Musée du moulin
comment: An invitation to travel back in time. In a 400 m2 space, 5 themed rooms to discover the Champsaur, daily life, traditional trades of the time when the washing machine and the electric milking machine were pure science fiction!
shortDescription: An invitation to travel back in time. In a 400 m2 space, 5 themed rooms to discover the Champsaur, daily life, traditional trades of the time when the washing machine and the electric milking machine were pure science fiction!

label: Centre Historique de Grimaud
comment:
Listed as one of the ‘Plus beaux détours de France’ (places most worth the detour), the history and the beauty of Grimaud make this village an absolute must-see.
Don’t hesitate to get yourself lost in the authenticity of this medieval maze.
shortDescription:
Listed as one of the ‘Plus beaux détours de France’ (places most worth the detour), the history and the beauty of Grimaud make this village an absolute must-see.
Don’t hesitate to get yourself lost in the authenticity of this medieval maze.

label: Scierie hydraulique
comment: Jewel of mastery and the know-how of our elders, this old sawmill, refurbished in 2006, will make you relive the gestures of the 50's during a demonstration of board cutting.
shortDescription: Jewel of mastery and the know-how of our elders, this old sawmill, refurbished in 2006, will make you relive the gestures of the 50's during a demonstration of board cutting.

label: Musée du cuivre
comment: The years 1860 to 1875 represent the golden age of mining research in the Alpes-Maritimes department.
shortDescription: The years 1860 to 1875 represent the golden age of mining research in the Alpes-Maritimes department.

label: Plage des salins
comment: A family beach with transparent, clear waters, sometimes partly covered with dry posidonia carried by currents in the sea.
shortDescription: A family beach with transparent, clear waters, sometimes partly covered with dry posidonia carried by currents in the sea.

label: Oratoire Saint-Jean
comment: Oratory of Saint John
shortDescription: Oratory of Saint John

label: Abbaye Saint Hilaire
comment: The former Carmelite convent of Ménerbes, built on a steep slope facing the Luberon, is fortunate to have kept its medieval architectural unity (13th century) and its 17th century extension.
shortDescription: The former Carmelite convent of Ménerbes, built on a steep slope facing the Luberon, is fortunate to have kept its medieval architectural unity (13th century) and its 17th century extension.

label: Jardin Frédéric Mistral

shortDescription: The Jardin Frédéric Mistral is an urban garden with playgrounds, located near the Observentins Convent in the Rue Nationale in the centre of Ollioules.

label: Oratoire Sainte-Madeleine
comment: The oratory does not appear on the Napoleonic land register of 1831.
shortDescription: The oratory does not appear on the Napoleonic land register of 1831.

label: Eglise Saint-Véran
comment: The church is dedicated to Saint-Véran in honour of the patron saint of Cavaillon who scared off a dragon from the Vaucluse. It is said that he fell from fatigue after his injuries on the territory of the village.
shortDescription: The church is dedicated to Saint-Véran in honour of the patron saint of Cavaillon who scared off a dragon from the Vaucluse. It is said that he fell from fatigue after his injuries on the territory of the village.

shortDescription: Natural History Museum of geology and fauna in Vaucluse founded in the XVIIth century by Esprit Requien.

label: Plage Rado Beach Helen
comment: Located in the heart of La Croisette, between the Carlton and Martinez hotels, opposite the Miramar, Rado Beach Helen is the oldest beach in Cannes, run by the same family since 1958.
shortDescription: Located in the heart of La Croisette, between the Carlton and Martinez hotels, opposite the Miramar, Rado Beach Helen is the oldest beach in Cannes, run by the same family since 1958.

label: Fontaine de la Cabraïa
comment: Fountain with 2 levels whose lower part was used as a watering and the upper part for household needs. Built in 1788 and registered MH in 1939
shortDescription: Fountain with 2 levels whose lower part was used as a watering and the upper part for household needs. Built in 1788 and registered MH in 1939

label: Plage de La Coudoulière
comment: Oriented to the south, about 800 meters from the heart of the village, the beach of the Coudoulière which owes its name to its "coudoulets", stones rounded by the movement of the waves, overlooks the broad wide which confers to him a crystalline bathing water .
shortDescription: Oriented to the south, about 800 meters from the heart of the village, the beach of the Coudoulière which owes its name to its "coudoulets", stones rounded by the movement of the waves, overlooks the broad wide which confers to him a crystalline bathing water .

label: Village perché d'Etoile Saint-Cyrice
comment: The district was formed by the merger of two villages in 1969 : Etoile, which is home to 35 people, and Saint Cyrice, whose only remnant is a Romanesque chapel.
shortDescription: The district was formed by the merger of two villages in 1969 : Etoile, which is home to 35 people, and Saint Cyrice, whose only remnant is a Romanesque chapel.

label: La Voie Romaine
comment: The Via Julia Augusta linked Rome to Gaul by the coast. Created by the emperor Augustus in 15 BC, it is famous in many ways and is now one of the great tourist routes of the region.
shortDescription: The Via Julia Augusta linked Rome to Gaul by the coast. Created by the emperor Augustus in 15 BC, it is famous in many ways and is now one of the great tourist routes of the region.

label: Plage Miramar Beach
comment: In the centre of the mythical Croisette of Cannes, the Miramar beach invites you to travel in a natural, calm and relaxing setting facing the sea. Enjoy an excellent moment of relaxation at the water's edge.
shortDescription: In the centre of the mythical Croisette of Cannes, the Miramar beach invites you to travel in a natural, calm and relaxing setting facing the sea. Enjoy an excellent moment of relaxation at the water's edge.

label: Hôtel particulier Ripert d'Alauzier

shortDescription: "d'Alauzier" Family is established in this town house since 1613.

label: Centrale hydroélectrique André Blondel CNR
comment: Come and discover the CNR site's energy mix (hydroelectric plant, wind turbines and photovoltaic farms) and understand how water, wind and sun are transformed into 100% renewable energy.
shortDescription: Come and discover the CNR site's energy mix (hydroelectric plant, wind turbines and photovoltaic farms) and understand how water, wind and sun are transformed into 100% renewable energy.

label: Observatoire de la Côte d'Azur - Site du plateau de Calern
comment: C.E.R.G.A. (Centre d'Études et de Recherches Géodynamiques et Astronomiques). In a marvellous hill-country setting up above Grasse, its observation instruments include an interferometer unique throughout the world.Guided tour every Sunday at 3.30 p.m.
shortDescription: C.E.R.G.A. (Centre d'Études et de Recherches Géodynamiques et Astronomiques). In a marvellous hill-country setting up above Grasse, its observation instruments include an interferometer unique throughout the world.Guided tour every Sunday at 3.30 p.m.

label: Observatoire astronomique de Bauduen
comment: The Bauduen astronomical observatory is located far from the lights of the cities, 5 minutes from the village. Evenings of discovery of the constellations and observation of the sky are offered all year round, and themed evenings (notably astro-musical) in summer.
shortDescription: The Bauduen astronomical observatory is located far from the lights of the cities, 5 minutes from the village. Evenings of discovery of the constellations and observation of the sky are offered all year round, and themed evenings (notably astro-musical) in summer.

comment: It was created around 1935 on the past square where old’s houses was.
shortDescription: It was created around 1935 on the past square where old’s houses was.

label: Ferme Au Doux Mélèze - Visite de la ferme
comment: Discovery tour of the farm with fun wool workshop, pony rides in hand with treasure hunt, sale of farm products.

comment: Open to all. Consultation of documents and use of equipment on site free of charge.
shortDescription: Open to all. Consultation of documents and use of equipment on site free of charge.

label: Plage des Pommiers - Baie Saint Michel
comment:
Apple Beach. A small setting nestling in front of the Saint-Michel chapel, a survivor of the waters on its islet, with the famous Pic du Morgon as a backdrop
A real pleasure to bask in a heavenly setting!
shortDescription:
Apple Beach. A small setting nestling in front of the Saint-Michel chapel, a survivor of the waters on its islet, with the famous Pic du Morgon as a backdrop
A real pleasure to bask in a heavenly setting!

shortDescription: This passage made it possible to circulate from the Place du Contrôle to Grande Street while remaining sheltered.

comment: San Sebastian Church
shortDescription: San Sebastian Church

label: Eglise Saint-Michel (église du Vieux Cannet)

shortDescription: The church of Vieux Cannet dedicated to Saint-Michel is classified as a Historical Monument. It was built in the 11th century.

label: Cour des Carmes
comment: It is the courtyard of the former Carmelite Convent, a wealthy religious establishment built in the 14th century.
shortDescription: It is the courtyard of the former Carmelite Convent, a wealthy religious establishment built in the 14th century.

label: Archives Municipales - Musée du Mont de Piété et de la Condition des Soies
comment: The oldest pawnshop in France (17th century), the archives of the City of Avignon, and the objects from the period the building served as a silk works.
shortDescription: The oldest pawnshop in France (17th century), the archives of the City of Avignon, and the objects from the period the building served as a silk works.

label: Jardin du Monastère de Cimiez
comment: Extending from the Monastery of Cimiez, this huge 9,550 m² garden offers a bucolic walk and a panoramic view of the sea and the whole city of Nice.
shortDescription: Extending from the Monastery of Cimiez, this huge 9,550 m² garden offers a bucolic walk and a panoramic view of the sea and the whole city of Nice.

label: Maison de la photographie Vivian Maier
comment: In an old traditional farmhouse, a space dedicated to photography and field emigration. An immersion in the 50s through the lens of Vivian Maier, an American photographer from Champsaur.
shortDescription: In an old traditional farmhouse, a space dedicated to photography and field emigration. An immersion in the 50s through the lens of Vivian Maier, an American photographer from Champsaur.

comment: The Mediatheque offers discoveries and activities around reading, music and other media for adults and children.
shortDescription: The Mediatheque offers discoveries and activities around reading, music and other media for adults and children.

label: Hôtel Adhémar de Lantagnac - Maison du patrimoine

label: Eglise Saint Romain

shortDescription: Situated halfway between the villages of La Rua and El Serre, with an independent bell tower, the church of San Román is an eye-catcher.

label: Plaque Commémorative du Passage de Louis XII
comment: Placed above the door of the former Cottalorda house, this plaque recalls that the king of France Louis XII was the host of this illustrious Breilloise family in July 1507.
shortDescription: Placed above the door of the former Cottalorda house, this plaque recalls that the king of France Louis XII was the host of this illustrious Breilloise family in July 1507.

label: Représentation de la mine de Gaude
comment: Since 2002, thanks to the Manosquin Heritage Committee, a wagon, a draisine and an entrance symbolize the entrance of the Gaude mine closed in 1965. This place Damase Arbaud (1814-1876) called the roundabout of the station is named as such since January 1972.
shortDescription: Since 2002, thanks to the Manosquin Heritage Committee, a wagon, a draisine and an entrance symbolize the entrance of the Gaude mine closed in 1965. This place Damase Arbaud (1814-1876) called the roundabout of the station is named as such since January 1972.

comment:
The library offers readers about 2300 books (novels, documentaries, comics...) as well as subscriptions to periodicals and videos and offers animations.
The library is part of the network of the Departmental Lending Library.

The library offers readers about 2300 books (novels, documentaries, comics...) as well as subscriptions to periodicals and videos and offers animations.

label: Église Notre-Dame-de-l'Assomption
comment:
Erected in 1558, the Notre-Dam-de-l'Assomption Church was several times modified. The bell tower is probably prior to the rest. 
The crenellations you could see in the past was demolished during the Revolution.

Erected in 1558, the Notre-Dam-de-l'Assomption Church was several times modified. The bell tower is probably prior to the rest.

label: Village perché de Lagrand, petite Cité de Caractère®
comment: Between the Alps and Provence, discover in the heart of Baronnies a hilltop village grouped around its priory from the 11th century. Between the rivers Buëch, Céans and Blaisance, Lagrand offers an historical panorama of the region.
shortDescription: Between the Alps and Provence, discover in the heart of Baronnies a hilltop village grouped around its priory from the 11th century. Between the rivers Buëch, Céans and Blaisance, Lagrand offers an historical panorama of the region.

label: Plage du Pradon
comment: It is the largest natural beach in Carqueiranne.
shortDescription: It is the largest natural beach in Carqueiranne.

label: Borne milliaire romaine
comment: Several milestones along the Aurelia Way were found in the municipality. Often engraved, these milestones symbolized the power of the emperor.
shortDescription: Several milestones along the Aurelia Way were found in the municipality. Often engraved, these milestones symbolized the power of the emperor.

label: Plage de San Peïre
comment:
San Peïre beach is the main beach of the seaside resort of Les Issambres.
Some 300 metres long, it is divided into various public and private areas.
Handi-Plage facilities for the disabled are available on prior request at the town hall annex in Les Issambres.
shortDescription:
San Peïre beach is the main beach of the seaside resort of Les Issambres.
Some 300 metres long, it is divided into various public and private areas.
Handi-Plage facilities for the disabled are available on prior request at the town hall annex in Les Issambres.

label: Parc Peiresc
comment: Recognised as a highly sensitive area, the 2,5 hectares of land are perfect for relaxation and leisure among the trees and the Gapeau river.
shortDescription: Recognised as a highly sensitive area, the 2,5 hectares of land are perfect for relaxation and leisure among the trees and the Gapeau river.

label: Monastère orthodoxe Saint Michel du Var
comment: Saint Michel du Var is an Orthodox monastery where a fraternity of orthodox friars leaves. Peace and the beauty of architecture invite you to meditation and spiritual retreats are organised on a regular basis, throughout the year. You can attend  religious services and visit the church of a byzantine style homing roman frescoes.

label: Médiathèque Municipale Jehanne Arnaud
comment:
- SUMMER 2022 - DISCOVER THE HOLIDAYS LIBRARY AND ITS LIBRARY O'DRIVE IN SUMMER MODE!
 
From 4 July until 31 August, the Médiathèque Jehanne Arnaud is obliged to close its doors to the public due to work inside the building.

However, to continue to ensure their missions... librarians are setting up a LIBRARY'HOLIDAYS!

The operation is simple:

- Choose from: www.mediatheque.sainte-maxime.fr
- Book, by email, by phone, or directly on our website
- As soon as your order is ready, we call you to arrange an appointment!

If you do not have access to a computer, the librarians propose to prepare a small selection of documents that you will only have to take on site.

The number of documents borrowed will be increased during the closing period of the Media Library.

THE LIBRARY’S HOLIDAYS ARE ALSO… SURPRISE BAGS!
 
THEMATIC BAGS TO SURPRISE YOU!
Take advantage of this beautiful summer to discover new authors, new films… This is an opportunity to think outside the box and dare.

The entire Media Library team wishes you great discoveries!

 Guide to Using Surprise Bags:
You can borrow 1 adult bag and 1 youth bag per family;
Thank you for taking care of the fabric bag;
2 ways to return your bag:
- to librarians
- in the return box (bag + documents)

The bag must be made complete (a list of what is inside). The bag can be borrowed until August 31.

We hope that these surprise bags will give you as much pleasure as we had to build them.

 See you soon!

Appointment starting July 5
Espace Bibli'Holidays (Carré Léon Gaumont)
shortDescription:
- SUMMER 2022 - DISCOVER THE HOLIDAYS LIBRARY AND ITS LIBRARY O'DRIVE IN SUMMER MODE!
 
From 4 July until 31 August, the Médiathèque Jehanne Arnaud is obliged to close its doors to the public due to work inside the building.

label: Parc du Clos de la Murette
comment:
This 4-hectare park, located outside the city behind the Rocade, is a green lung in the middle of a highly urbanized area.
Sport, relaxation and animal walks are all available.
A playground is dedicated to the little ones.
shortDescription:
This 4-hectare park, located outside the city behind the Rocade, is a green lung in the middle of a highly urbanized area.
Sport, relaxation and animal walks are all available.

label: La Mine d'Argent du Fournel
comment:
The Silver Mine, a unique historical heritage jewel in the Hautes Alpes
Discover the work of the miners through the galleries in this universe in the heart of the mountain. Accompanied by a guide you will make an amazing journey through time!
shortDescription:
The Silver Mine, a unique historical heritage jewel in the Hautes Alpes
Discover the work of the miners through the galleries in this universe in the heart of the mountain. Accompanied by a guide you will make an amazing journey through time!

label: Vestiges du Château des Lascaris
comment: Vestiges of the castral site of “Lascaris Da Briga” seigneurial fortified residence from the second half of the 14th century, access control to the Col de Tende. Listed in the inventory of Historic Monuments in 1949.
shortDescription: Vestiges of the castral site of “Lascaris Da Briga” seigneurial fortified residence from the second half of the 14th century, access control to the Col de Tende. Listed in the inventory of Historic Monuments in 1949.
