comment:
Access to the gardens at the Place des Carmes.
Gardens open at 8am. No charge
shortDescription:
Access to the gardens at the Place des Carmes.
Gardens open at 8am. No charge

label: Chartreuse de Bonpas
comment:
The Carthusian monastery of Bonpas is a fortified monastery built by the Hospitallers of Saint John of Jerusalem in the 12th century.  Its name Bonpas comes from the Latin "bonus passus" or the good passage
Playful and interactive visit.
shortDescription:
The Carthusian monastery of Bonpas is a fortified monastery built by the Hospitallers of Saint John of Jerusalem in the 12th century.  Its name Bonpas comes from the Latin "bonus passus" or the good passage
Playful and interactive visit.

label: Place Clémenceau et l'hôtel Trenca de Monléon
comment: In the Clemenceau square in the heart of the historical, tourist and commercial centre of the city, you can admire the beautiful facade of the Trenca de Monléon family mansion.
shortDescription: In the Clemenceau square in the heart of the historical, tourist and commercial centre of the city, you can admire the beautiful facade of the Trenca de Monléon family mansion.

label: Village de Buisson
comment: A few kilometres from Vaison-la-Romaine, explore the charm of Buisson, nestled on a hill overlooking the Aygues valley.
shortDescription: A few kilometres from Vaison-la-Romaine, explore the charm of Buisson, nestled on a hill overlooking the Aygues valley.

label: L'Escalier Monumental et le Drapeau
comment:
A succession of stairs from the highest point The Flag to the Sea.
From this point of view to the sea, you will take the Higher Degrees, the Centre Degrees, the Patec Degrees, the Jean Aicard Square and the majestic Degrees of the Sea.
shortDescription:
A succession of stairs from the highest point, Le Drapeau, to the sea.
From this point of view to the sea, you will take the Degrés Supérieurs, the Degrés du Centre, the Degrés du Patec, the square Jean Aicard and the majestic Degrés de la Mer.

label: Couvent des Ursulines
comment: A Cistercian convent of the 10th and 11th centuries, it was restored successively by the Augustinians, the Ursulines and the Trinitarians.
shortDescription: A Cistercian convent of the 10th and 11th centuries, it was restored successively by the Augustinians, the Ursulines and the Trinitarians.

label: Musée de la Poterie
comment: This private museum, created by an enthusiast, allows visitors to discover, thanks to the machines and production tools, the different phases of pottery production.
shortDescription: This private museum, created by an enthusiast, allows visitors to discover, thanks to the machines and production tools, the different phases of pottery production.

label: Eglise Notre Dame de l'Assomption

shortDescription: Built in the 16th century, this church contains exceptional furnishings, including beautiful organs classified as "Monument Historique" built in 1668 by Charles Royer.

label: Eglise Saint Sauveur
comment: A church to discover. Why a church outside the fortified town ? Attested as early as 1105, the church of Saint-Sauveur was built on the primitive site of Veynes, founded before the fortified village, at a place called La Rua.
shortDescription: A church to discover. Why a church outside the fortified town ? Attested as early as 1105, the church of Saint-Sauveur was built on the primitive site of Veynes, founded before the fortified village, at a place called La Rua.

label: Château de la Verrerie
comment: Imposing old building in the heart of the countryside, comprising 11 communal gîtes with outbuildings, common land of 10 ha, communal terrace and garden furniture. Cannot be visited.
shortDescription: Imposing old building in the heart of the countryside, comprising 11 communal gîtes with outbuildings, common land of 10 ha, communal terrace and garden furniture. Cannot be visited.

label: Eglise Saint Laurent
comment:
Saint-Laurent Church
It was built in three stages. The oldest part is the one on the left.
The one on the right is more recent

Saint-Laurent Church
It was built in three stages. The oldest part is the one on the left.

label: Les sites archéologiques de Puymin et La Villasse
comment: Discover 2000 years of history and an exceptional heritage. Walk in the footsteps of the Gallo-Romans in the largest archaeological site in France open to the public: an immersion in the opulent ancient city of Vasio.
shortDescription: Discover 2000 years of history and an exceptional heritage. Walk in the footsteps of the Gallo-Romans in the largest archaeological site in France open to the public: an immersion in the opulent ancient city of Vasio.

label: Les Bormettes, quartier historique
comment: Historic district that brings together remarkable sites and buildings from all periods of history. One of the oldest districts probably invested since the Iron Age with the establishment of an oppidum.
shortDescription: Historic district that brings together remarkable sites and buildings from all periods of history. One of the oldest districts probably invested since the Iron Age with the establishment of an oppidum.

label: Musée Masséna
comment: Listed in the Historic Monuments inventory, the Villa Masséna is an architectural jewel in a tree-lined setting on the Promenade des Anglais that presents the history of Nice in the 19th Century.
shortDescription: Listed in the Historic Monuments inventory, the Villa Masséna is an architectural jewel in a tree-lined setting on the Promenade des Anglais that presents the history of Nice in the 19th Century.

label: Crypte Archéologique Notre Dame du Bourg
comment: Resulting from three campaigns of excavations, the archaeological Crypt of Notre-Dame du Bourg reveals traces of construction in the exact location of the origins of the town of Digne, on 870 m².
shortDescription: Resulting from three campaigns of excavations, the archaeological Crypt of Notre-Dame du Bourg reveals traces of construction in the exact location of the origins of the town of Digne, on 870 m².

label: Belle Plage
comment: Located on the beaches of the Midi and home of sea bathing since 1928, Belle Plage will make you rediscover the pleasures of a relaxing day at the water's edge, where every moment will be a holiday.
shortDescription: Located on the beaches of the Midi and home of sea bathing since 1928, Belle Plage will make you rediscover the pleasures of a relaxing day at the water's edge, where every moment will be a holiday.

label: Maison du Patrimoine et des Traditions Brigasques
comment: The Brigasque Heritage House offers a heartbreaking testimony about the daily life of yesteryear with a full range of traditional local activities.
shortDescription: The Brigasque Heritage House offers a heartbreaking testimony about the daily life of yesteryear with a full range of traditional local activities.

label: Le Tombeau de Lumone
comment: A Roman remnant, this funerary monument marks the passage of the Roman road "Julia Augusta". It features 3 arches with vaults and visible traces of frescoes.
shortDescription: A Roman remnant, this funerary monument marks the passage of the Roman road "Julia Augusta". It features 3 arches with vaults and visible traces of frescoes.

label: Chapelle Sainte Croix
comment: At the very top of the village, old seigneurial chapel with XVIII century ex-votos, torches and carved wood. Orientation table
shortDescription: At the very top of the village, old seigneurial chapel with XVIII century ex-votos, torches and carved wood. Orientation table

label: Musée des technologies ferroviaires
comment: Free guided visits on appointment. Equipment relative to the steam and electrical traction and signalling.
shortDescription: Free guided visits on appointment. Equipment relative to the steam and electrical traction and signalling.

label: La Petite Ferme des Regains - Ferme pédagogique & Traditions alpines
comment: La Petite Ferme des Regains - Educational farm & Alpin traditions opens for you the doors of time...coming from the past, the farmer lady will accompany you in an original experience to discover farm animals and mountain know-how.
shortDescription: La Petite Ferme des Regains - Educational farm & Alpin traditions opens for you the doors of time...coming from the past, the farmer lady will accompany you in an original experience to discover farm animals and mountain know-how.

label: Fort Napoléon
comment: Open during exhibitions and special events, information in our tourist board. Built between 1812 and 1821 upon the order of Emperor Napoleon. It never saw combat, except in 1944 during the liberation.
shortDescription: Open during exhibitions and special events, information in our tourist board. Built between 1812 and 1821 upon the order of Emperor Napoleon. It never saw combat, except in 1944 during the liberation.

label: Musée de l'énergie hydroélectrique
comment: The Museum of Hydroelectric Energy in Pelvoux, located above an electricity production plant that has been in operation since 1932, presents the great adventure of hydroelectricity in the Pays des Écrins.
shortDescription: The Museum of Hydroelectric Energy in Pelvoux, located above an electricity production plant that has been in operation since 1932, presents the great adventure of hydroelectricity in the Pays des Écrins.

label: Médiathèque François Mitterrand de Digne les Bains
comment: Lending and consultation of books, magazines, CDs, DVDs.
shortDescription: Lending and consultation of books, magazines, CDs, DVDs.

label: Plage le Bénitier
comment:
From the Esterel to the Lerins Islands, this panorama will relax you.
On the pontoon or on the sand, the moment will be pleasant.
shortDescription:
From the Esterel to the Lerins Islands, this panorama will relax you.
On the pontoon or on the sand, the moment will be pleasant.

label: Eglise Saint Denis
comment:
11th century church.
Mass at 6pm on Sundays in summer time.
Closed on Weddings, Baptisms and Funerals
as well as during the Christmas Pastoral period.
shortDescription:
11th century church.
Mass at 6pm on Sundays in summer time.
Closed on Weddings, Baptisms and Funerals
as well as during the Christmas Pastoral period.

label: Eglise paroissiale Saint-Pierre
comment: The church was built around 1487, shortly after the creation of the new village. . Every year the church hosts the Mandolin International Festival. Mass on the 1st Sunday of the month.
shortDescription: The church was built around 1487, shortly after the creation of the new village. . Every year the church hosts the Mandolin International Festival. Mass on the 1st Sunday of the month.

label: La Porte des Chantiers
comment: Characteristic of the style Louis XIII revisited at the Belle Epoque. At the time of the shipyards, workers would pass under this arch of white stones and pink bricks to return to their workshops.
shortDescription: Characteristic of the style Louis XIII revisited at the Belle Epoque. At the time of the shipyards, workers would pass under this arch of white stones and pink bricks to return to their workshops.

label: Eglise Sainte-Marguerite
comment: Built at the end of the 15th century at the top of the village, its façade was restyled in the 17th and 18th centuries with the addition of an onion-shaped bell-tower. The church's interior is a real museum containing a treasure of religious objects in silver and gold.
shortDescription: Built at the end of the 15th century at the top of the village, its façade was restyled in the 17th and 18th centuries with the addition of an onion-shaped bell-tower. The church's interior is a real museum containing a treasure of religious objects in silver and gold.

label: Plaque commémorative Napoléon
comment: "The Emperor, having just received the right of way through the narrow passages of rocks, running at the confluence of the rivers Durance and Buëch, felt like a rest and in the village of Le Poët he was brought some fruit and a glass of wine."
shortDescription: "The Emperor, having just received the right of way through the narrow passages of rocks, running at the confluence of the rivers Durance and Buëch, felt like a rest and in the village of Le Poët he was brought some fruit and a glass of wine."

label: Maison de l'Eau et des Énergies EDF du Barrage de Serre-Ponçon
comment: Discover the world of energy at one of the biggest dams in Europe!
shortDescription: Discover the world of energy at one of the biggest dams in Europe!

label: Plage Sainte Asile
comment: In the Pin-Rolland district, fine sandy beach bordered by a pine forest of century-old trees and planted with Mediterranean plants: pine nuts, Aleppo pines, thyme, rosemary and other sea spray resistant plants.
shortDescription: In the Pin-Rolland district, fine sandy beach bordered by a pine forest of century-old trees and planted with Mediterranean plants: pine nuts, Aleppo pines, thyme, rosemary and other sea spray resistant plants.

label: Bibliothèque et ludothèque municipale de Cervières
comment: Come to the Cervières library and toy library to borrow and discover new readings. You can also have a good time around a board game.
shortDescription: Come to the Cervières library and toy library to borrow and discover new readings. You can also have a good time around a board game.

label: Le Tipi
comment:
The Tipi is a great place: lively, ecological and fertile. 
At the Tipi you'll find an urban farm, a nursery, edible plants, room to relax, beehives, a chicken coop, a pottery workshop, a herboristery, a cantine, a bar and a stage for concerts!
shortDescription:
The Tipi is a great place: lively, ecological and fertile. 
At the Tipi you'll find an urban farm, a nursery, edible plants, room to relax, beehives, a chicken coop, a pottery workshop, a herboristery, a cantine, a bar and a stage for concerts!

label: Eglise Saint-Roch
comment: The parish church, rebuilt and enlarged from 1692 onwards, is under the name of Saint-Roch. Of pleasant proportions, it dominates a square with a monumental cross and a fountain with fresh water. Mass at 6:30 p.m. on Saturdays.
shortDescription: The parish church, rebuilt and enlarged from 1692 onwards, is under the name of Saint-Roch. Of pleasant proportions, it dominates a square with a monumental cross and a fountain with fresh water. Mass at 6:30 p.m. on Saturdays.

label: Médiathèque municipale
comment: 5000 books, press, CDs, internet access...
shortDescription: 5000 books, press, CDs, internet access...

label: Cathédrale Notre-Dame-de-Nazareth
comment:
This cathedral is the most eloquent monument of the medieval city
and Christian. In the 11th century, it was built on the site of Paleo-Christian buildings and then transformed in the following century.
shortDescription:
This cathedral is the most eloquent monument of the medieval city
and Christian. In the 11th century, it was built on the site of Paleo-Christian buildings and then transformed in the following century.

label: Domaine de la Mouissone
comment: The Mouissone estate is built around a collection of integrated thematic gardens within a multi-century olive grove of 3 hectares.
shortDescription: The Mouissone estate is built around a collection of integrated thematic gardens within a multi-century olive grove of 3 hectares.

label: Plage de la Petite Afrique
comment: A gravel beach very appreciated for its pine forest and its various facilities: children's playground, beach volleyball court and in season, private beaches.
shortDescription: A gravel beach very appreciated for its pine forest and its various facilities: children's playground, beach volleyball court and in season, private beaches.

label: Fort du Mont Agaisen
comment: Artillery structure of the Maginot Alpine Line, registered MH on 25/08/2016.
shortDescription: Artillery structure of the Maginot Alpine Line, registered MH on 25/08/2016.

label: Stèle de la Déportation de Turin
comment: This stele recalls that on October 28, 1944, the head of the Kommandatur de Breil sur Roya gathered the population in the parish church and ordered him to prepare to leave the village the next morning.
shortDescription: This stele recalls that on October 28, 1944, the head of the Kommandatur de Breil sur Roya gathered the population in the parish church and ordered him to prepare to leave the village the next morning.

label: Arboretum Marcel Kroenlein
comment: An arboretum unique in Europe for its altitude, the Marcel Kroenlein site nestles in Roure, a village in the Tinée valley at the heart of the Mercantour National Park, just ninety minutes from Nice.
shortDescription: An arboretum unique in Europe for its altitude, the Marcel Kroenlein site nestles in Roure, a village in the Tinée valley at the heart of the Mercantour National Park, just ninety minutes from Nice.

label: Eglise Saint-Marcellin
comment: This parochial church of the XIVth century is dedicated to Saint Marcellin, first bishop of Embrun. Burnt down in 1962 by the troops of the Duke of Savory, its bulb bell tower, covered with slate, is unique in the region
shortDescription: This parochial church of the XIVth century is dedicated to Saint Marcellin, first bishop of Embrun. Burnt down in 1962 by the troops of the Duke of Savory, its bulb bell tower, covered with slate, is unique in the region

label: Remparts romains
comment: The layout of the Roman enclosure follows the relief of the rocky mound on which Fréjus was built.
shortDescription: The layout of the Roman enclosure follows the relief of the rocky mound on which Fréjus was built.

label: Médiathèque de Ste Musse
comment: To the east of the city, in a sector that is undergoing major renovations, the Sainte-Musse media library was inaugurated in 2009. It is located on the first floor of the Public Services House, which also houses the adjoining town hall, 2 crèches and a social and cultural centre.
shortDescription: To the east of the city, in a sector that is undergoing major renovations, the Sainte-Musse media library was inaugurated in 2009. It is located on the first floor of the Public Services House, which also houses the adjoining town hall, 2 crèches and a social and cultural centre.

label: Médiathèque de Quinson
comment: Equipped with a reader's card, subscribers will be able to make their first computerized loans and broaden its offer in books, CDs and DVDs .
shortDescription: Equipped with a reader's card, subscribers will be able to make their first computerized loans and broaden its offer in books, CDs and DVDs .

label: Eglise Saint-Blaise
comment: Romanesque style, rebuilt in the 19th century. It houses two paintings classified as Historic Monuments, the "Assumption of the Virgin" and the "Virgin and Child", from the former Carthusian monastery of Durbon, and a stone Carthusian Cross in the forecourt.
shortDescription: Romanesque style, rebuilt in the 19th century. It houses two paintings classified as Historic Monuments, the "Assumption of the Virgin" and the "Virgin and Child", from the former Carthusian monastery of Durbon, and a stone Carthusian Cross in the forecourt.

label: La Bâtie-Montsaléon
comment: 25 to 30 hectares of vestiges have been discovered in this former Gallo-Roman town, with traces of proto- and prehistoric settlements.
shortDescription: 25 to 30 hectares of vestiges have been discovered in this former Gallo-Roman town, with traces of proto- and prehistoric settlements.

label: L'Arche des cimes
comment:
Interpretation Centre and knowledge of nature
Near the natural reserve of the High Guil, the Ark of the Peaks located in the heart of the village of Ristolas, offers an exceptional show.
shortDescription:
Interpretation Centre and knowledge of nature
Near the natural reserve of the High Guil, the Ark of the Peaks located in the heart of the village of Ristolas, offers an exceptional show.

label: Écomusée "la vigne autrefois"
comment: In an old cellar of the Grand'Rue, the museum dedicated to the vine is offered as a showcase on the cuture of the vine in the past. In a soundtrack, the inhabitants "les Orpierrois" tell and testify to this tradition.
shortDescription: In an old cellar of the Grand'Rue, the museum dedicated to the vine is offered as a showcase on the cuture of the vine in the past. In a soundtrack, the inhabitants "les Orpierrois" tell and testify to this tradition.

label: Meulières Romaines
comment: The Romans used the rock from the Esterel foothills to make millstones. Still visible in the communal forest of Pugettoise, they can be seen during a walk, testimony of the richness of our history.
shortDescription: The Romans used the rock from the Esterel foothills to make millstones. Still visible in the communal forest of Pugettoise, they can be seen during a walk, testimony of the richness of our history.

label: Jardins du Musée International de la Parfumerie
comment: In the unique setting of the International Perfume Museum Gardens, visitors can discover and smell the species that have provided precious raw materials for perfumery for centuries.
shortDescription: In the unique setting of the International Perfume Museum Gardens, visitors can discover and smell the species that have provided precious raw materials for perfumery for centuries.

label: Hôtel de Ville
comment: It is a former private mansion, the Hôtel de Pochet, in the Renaissance style known as "à la génoise" which was acquired in 1770 by the commune.
shortDescription: It is a former private mansion, the Hôtel de Pochet, in the Renaissance style known as "à la génoise" which was acquired in 1770 by the commune.

label: Fort de la Bayarde
comment: An exceptional place welcoming every summer the festival "Théâtre In Situ - La Bayarde". Closed to the public, it can be visited during guided tours all year round.
shortDescription: An exceptional place welcoming every summer the festival "Théâtre In Situ - La Bayarde". Closed to the public, it can be visited during guided tours all year round.

label: Jardin Parfumé - Parfumerie Fragonard
comment: Fragonard Perfumery has gathered in this garden the most beautiful perfume plants that represent the olfactory heritage of the Grasse region, as well as other perfumed species that are cultivated and produced in various countries around the world.
shortDescription: Fragonard Perfumery has gathered in this garden the most beautiful perfume plants that represent the olfactory heritage of the Grasse region, as well as other perfumed species that are cultivated and produced in various countries around the world.

label: Plage de la Rague et des Mineurs - Plage publique
comment: Ragus Beach and Minor Beach is a public beach. Located on the roadside, at the exit of the Napoule district.
shortDescription: Ragus Beach and Minor Beach is a public beach. Located on the roadside, at the exit of the Napoule district.

label: Plage de l'Anglaise
comment:
Natural rocky creek offering a beautiful view to " Ile Rousse ".
Snorkelling area.
shortDescription:
Natural rocky creek offering a beautiful view to " Ile Rousse ".
Snorkelling area.

label: Plage de la Base Nature
comment: The beach of the Base Nature François Léotard is an exceptional area on the French Riviera: 2 km of fine sand, with a programme of relaxation and activities for all. Beach labelled "Tourism & Handicap 3 families" and "Handiplage 3 buoys".
shortDescription: The beach of the Base Nature François Léotard is an exceptional area on the French Riviera: 2 km of fine sand, with a programme of relaxation and activities for all. Beach labelled "Tourism & Handicap 3 families" and "Handiplage 3 buoys".

label: Plage d'Abel Ballif
comment: Sumptuous crossing point of the Corniche d'Or where a retaining structure holds back the railway and the road. It overlooks a 50 m cove of gravel and sand that nestles at the bottom of the cliff, accessible by a large staircase.
shortDescription: Sumptuous crossing point of the Corniche d'Or where a retaining structure holds back the railway and the road. It overlooks a 50 m cove of gravel and sand that nestles at the bottom of the cliff, accessible by a large staircase.

label: Sainte Colombe
comment: At the foot of Chabre Mountain, the village Sainte Colombe displays, on one of the walls of the church, a sundial bearing a dictum in Occitan : "L'ora e la pes, Santa Couroumba te baila".
shortDescription: At the foot of Chabre Mountain, the village Sainte Colombe displays, on one of the walls of the church, a sundial bearing a dictum in Occitan : "L'ora e la pes, Santa Couroumba te baila".

label: Village de Mirabeau
comment: Mirabeau-Lez-Digne has the authentic charm of the traditional villages of Provence.
shortDescription: Mirabeau-Lez-Digne has the authentic charm of the traditional villages of Provence.

label: Trophée d'Auguste
comment: Unique in size and historical importance, recognised as being of national interest and managed by the Centre des Monuments Nationaux, the Trophée d'Auguste is one of the wonders of the architectural heritage of the Alpes-Maritimes not to be missed under any circumstances!
shortDescription: Unique in size and historical importance, recognised as being of national interest and managed by the Centre des Monuments Nationaux, the Trophée d'Auguste is one of the wonders of the architectural heritage of the Alpes-Maritimes not to be missed under any circumstances!

label: Musée du Phonographe et de la Musique Mécanique
comment:
Be charmed by the offbeat instruments of the Gramophone and Mechanical Music Museum!

This astonishing museum presents a unique collection in Europe of more than 300 music instruments. Discover the fascinating history of music boxes, gramophones, musical machines or barrel organs...
shortDescription:
Be charmed by the offbeat instruments of the Gramophone and Mechanical Music Museum!

This astonishing museum presents a unique collection in Europe of more than 300 music instruments. Discover the fascinating history of music boxes, gramophones, musical machines or barrel organs...

label: Ecomusée de la Maison des Gorges du Verdon
comment: The mission of the ecomuseum is to inform and sensitize the visitors on the particularities of the nature of the Gorges du Verdon territory, in order to better know and preserve it.
shortDescription: The mission of the ecomuseum is to inform and sensitize the visitors on the particularities of the nature of the Gorges du Verdon territory, in order to better know and preserve it.

label: Musée d'entomologie du Dr Willy Hansen
comment: The collection of the Bollène-Vésubie entomology museum shows the great diversity of the world of insects, the multiplicity of forms and the huge variety of species.
shortDescription: The collection of the Bollène-Vésubie entomology museum shows the great diversity of the world of insects, the multiplicity of forms and the huge variety of species.

label: Château féodal - Ancien Hospice
comment: The feudal castle belonged to the Princes of Orange, and was probably used as a second home. Then, in 1678, the Hospices were created there. After the French Revolution, the place was converted into a school for young girls and abandoned in 1904.
shortDescription: The feudal castle belonged to the Princes of Orange, and was probably used as a second home. Then, in 1678, the Hospices were created there. After the French Revolution, the place was converted into a school for young girls and abandoned in 1904.

label: Musée du jouet ancien et de la Figurine historique
comment: The Museum offers visitors a rich and varied collection of old toys of yesteryear, personal creations of Mr. and Mrs. AUTISSIER.
shortDescription: The Museum offers visitors a rich and varied collection of old toys of yesteryear, personal creations of Mr. and Mrs. AUTISSIER.

label: Médiathèque Constant Mellano
comment:
Located in brand new premises, the media library in Puget-sur-Argens offers a pleasant and quiet setting for your research and reading
A large choice of books, magazines, CDs and DVDs are available for consultation and borrowing.
shortDescription:
Located in brand new premises, the media library in Puget-sur-Argens offers a pleasant and quiet setting for your research and reading
A large choice of books, magazines, CDs and DVDs are available for consultation and borrowing.

label: Eglise Saint Barthélemy
comment: It was built in 1683. We find in this church, works of painters of the basilica Saint Michel de Menton, built shortly before. The facade was painted with trompe-l'oeil decoration by François Zanatta in 2010.
shortDescription: It was built in 1683. We find in this church, works of painters of the basilica Saint Michel de Menton, built shortly before. The facade was painted with trompe-l'oeil decoration by François Zanatta in 2010.

label: Plage de la Gaillarde
comment: La Gaillarde beach in Les Issambres is at the easternmost end of the resort, just before you reach Saint-Aygulf. This sandy beach below the Corniche road stretches for 150 metres.
shortDescription: La Gaillarde beach in Les Issambres is at the easternmost end of the resort, just before you reach Saint-Aygulf. This sandy beach below the Corniche road stretches for 150 metres.

comment: Pebble & rocky creek.
shortDescription: Pebble & rocky creek.

comment: The History Museum evokes the daily life of the French from 1939 to 1945.
shortDescription: The History Museum evokes the daily life of the French from 1939 to 1945.

label: Plage du Treizain
comment:
The Treizain beach is one of the three beaches of Gassin.
Located on the road to Saint-Tropez, it offers a friendly relaxation area.
This nature beach offers a view of Saint-Tropez in the east, Sainte-Maxime in the north and the whole gulf.
shortDescription:
The Treizain beach is one of the three beaches of Gassin.
Located on the road to Saint-Tropez, it offers a friendly relaxation area.

shortDescription: Renaissance-style mansion that now houses the intermunicipal media library.

label: Jardin du Monde
comment:
Apt public garden.
Built in 1903, the public garden evokes the city parks of the 19th century, encouraging travel. The trees and shrubs of France have been rigorously selected: walnut trees, plane trees, acacias, conifers.
shortDescription:
Apt public garden.
Built in 1903, the public garden evokes the city parks of the 19th century, encouraging travel. The trees and shrubs of France have been rigorously selected: walnut trees, plane trees, acacias, conifers.

label: Temple protestant de La Motte d'Aigues
comment: This building with a single ship is the witness of a strong Protestant presence in the village following the arrival and adhesion of the Waldensians at the beginning of the 16th century.
shortDescription: This building with a single ship is the witness of a strong Protestant presence in the village following the arrival and adhesion of the Waldensians at the beginning of the 16th century.

comment:
This sandy beach is situated in the centre of Bandol. The surrounding gardens offer refreshing and shaded places.
First aid post, showers, toilets, nautical base, beach mattresses, beach umbrellas,

This sandy beach is situated in the centre of Bandol. The surrounding gardens offer refreshing and shaded places.

label: Ville de Menton
comment: Located on the borders of Italy, the Principality of Monaco and the County of Nice, Menton benefits from a subtropical microclimate that makes it almost ignore winter. City of Art and History, city of garden and city of culture, it is a preserved Eden.
shortDescription: Located on the borders of Italy, the Principality of Monaco and the County of Nice, Menton benefits from a subtropical microclimate that makes it almost ignore winter. City of Art and History, city of garden and city of culture, it is a preserved Eden.

shortDescription: In the middle of the Promenade des Anglais, in front of the mythical Negresco and Palais de la Méditerranée, the Beach-Restaurant "Le Blue Beach" welcomes you for a sunbath or around a good table for a lunch or a dinner.

label: Jardin médiéval
comment: This garden was created during the winter of 2014/2015 by volunteers from the Beaumes-de-Venise Academy and the association, ACARE. It complies in shape and philosophy with the gardens of the Middle Ages, and most of the vegetation existed in medieval Europe.
shortDescription: This garden was created during the winter of 2014/2015 by volunteers from the Beaumes-de-Venise Academy and the association, ACARE. It complies in shape and philosophy with the gardens of the Middle Ages, and most of the vegetation existed in medieval Europe.

comment: Pebble beach shaded in the morning.
shortDescription: Pebble beach shaded in the morning.

comment: Housed in an old village house rehabilitated by the Town Hall, the Museum of Art and Trials of Tourrettes invites you to discover the original works of the coppersmith Paul-Maurice Perrier-Morillon, and the craftsmen of the village.
shortDescription: Housed in an old village house rehabilitated by the Town Hall, the Museum of Art and Trials of Tourrettes invites you to discover the original works of the coppersmith Paul-Maurice Perrier-Morillon, and the craftsmen of the village.

label: Musée de Préhistoire
comment: In the Maison Rempart, which houses the craft museum, this museum is testimony to the rich prehistoric heritage across the commune. Museum of Prehistory retraces, from room to room, the great human adventure which began more then seven million years ago.
shortDescription: In the Maison Rempart, which houses the craft museum, this museum is testimony to the rich prehistoric heritage across the commune. Museum of Prehistory retraces, from room to room, the great human adventure which began more then seven million years ago.

Showroom.

Multimedia room, documents for all (novels, comics, films, magazines, newspapers, etc.) Space entirely dedicated to music, turntables, scores, regular concerts..

This magnificent body of water, perfectly integrated into the landscape of the Buëch plain, is an exceptional place. On the perimeter of the lake, landscaped and planted with trees, fishermen and swimmers live together in a friendly atmosphere.
Free access and free of charge.

This magnificent body of water, perfectly integrated into the landscape of the Buëch plain, is an exceptional place. On the perimeter of the lake, landscaped and planted with trees, fishermen and swimmers live together in a friendly atmosphere.

shortDescription: The library welcomes you to carry out research and consultation on site, for the home loan of books, audio documents or videos against a subscription. It has internet access and printing and photocopying facilities.

UNDER CONSTRUCTION UNTIL NOVEMBER 2023.

shortDescription: Composed of large pebbles, even if in some area you can see sand, it is equipped for people with reduced mobility, monitored in the summer and it is one of the rare beaches allowed to dogs. You can park along the road.

comment: A place of leisure and culture for everyone's curiosity!  Lending of books albums, novels, thrillers, DVD documents and magazines.
shortDescription: A place of leisure and culture for everyone's curiosity!  Loans of books, albums, novels, thrillers, DVDs and magazines.

comment: Under the heat of the sun or the glow of the moon, Ondine beach welcomes you at every moment and fulfils every desire. Come and relax with one of our cocktails in the afternoon or dance to the rhythm of famous DJ's from all over the world all night long.
shortDescription: Under the heat of the sun or the glow of the moon, Ondine beach welcomes you at every moment and fulfils every desire. Come and relax with one of our cocktails in the afternoon or dance to the rhythm of famous DJ's from all over the world all night long.

comment: An idyllic landscape !

comment: Narrow beach near the beach of the Pins Penchés.
shortDescription: Narrow beach near the beach of the Pins Penchés.

shortDescription: The beach of Touron in Saint Julien du Verdon is located 100m from the center of the village

label: Musée national Fernand Léger
comment: The Fernand Léger National Museum is the only museum in the world dedicated to Fernand Léger, a major artist of the 20th century, who lived and worked in Biot.
shortDescription: The Fernand Léger National Museum is the only museum in the world dedicated to Fernand Léger, a major artist of the 20th century, who lived and worked in Biot.

label: Médiathèque du Port Marchand
comment:
Moored near the swimming pool of the nautical stadium, open to the Port Marchand and the Mourillon, the pleasant and luminous media library has an open view on the outside.
8 computer stations and a Wifi access are available to the public.
shortDescription:
Moored near the swimming pool of the nautical stadium, open to the Port Marchand and the Mourillon, the pleasant and luminous media library has an open view on the outside.

label: Le Naturoptère
comment: At Naturoptère, step right up and see everything from close-up! Discover the captivating world of insects and plants and their surroundings. Fun and scientific, alive with different species, gardens and theme areas connecting Human and Nature!
shortDescription: At Naturoptère, step right up and see everything from close-up! Discover the captivating world of insects and plants and their surroundings. Fun and scientific, alive with different species, gardens and theme areas connecting Human and Nature!

label: La Bastidonne
comment: Small rural town in south of the Luberon, the village is remarkable for the simplicity of its architecture and construction.
shortDescription: Small rural town in south of the Luberon, the village is remarkable for the simplicity of its architecture and construction.

label: Cité Historique De Vence
comment: The historic part of Vencereveals itself within an incredible medieval enclosure : this city centre abounds with history while at the same time being full of life.
shortDescription: The historic part of Vencereveals itself within an incredible medieval enclosure : this city centre abounds with history while at the same time being full of life.

label: Le Portalet
comment: Dating from the 11th century, this main entrance to the Castrum was part of the outer wall of the fortified village.
shortDescription: Dating from the 11th century, this main entrance to the Castrum was part of the outer wall of the fortified village.

label: Chemin de Saint-Jacques de Compostelle et de Rome
comment: Camin de Sant Jaume e de Roma
shortDescription: Camin de Sant Jaume e de Roma

label: Fort-Freinet
comment: The Fort-Freinet is a fortified village from the Middle Ages
shortDescription: The Fort-Freinet is a fortified village from the Middle Ages

label: Musée d'Histoire et de Céramiques Biotoises
comment:
The story of Biot is traced through panels, photographs and objects.
The collections, initially from donations from families in the village, continue to be enriched by acquisitions.
shortDescription:
The story of Biot is traced through panels, photographs and objects.
The collections, initially from donations from families in the village, continue to be enriched by acquisitions.

label: La Porte Médiévale dite Porte Sarrasine
comment: It opens in the defensive walls of the village of Ramatuelle formed by the outer perimeter of the houses. It has retained its original appearance.
shortDescription: It opens in the defensive walls of the village of Ramatuelle formed by the outer perimeter of the houses. It has retained its original appearance.

label: Le Patec
comment:
The word Patec, or Pateck, comes from the ancient notion of Patus indicating a group of indivisible goods, destined for common use.
This building, listed as a historical monument, is still a strong symbolic landmark of Rayol.
shortDescription:
The word Patec, or Pateck, comes from the ancient notion of Patus indicating a group of indivisible goods, destined for common use.
This building, listed as a historical monument, is still a strong symbolic landmark of Rayol.

label: Maison du Miel et de L'Abeille
comment: Beekeeping in all its states!
shortDescription: Beekeeping in all its states!

label: Domaine d'Astros
comment:
Domaine d'Astros is a huge farm estate where two outstanding castles were built at two different periods of time: While the "Chateau Vieux" castle was erected during the XVIIth century, the other castle was built during the XIXth century and exhibits an italian renaissance style.
Famous for its apple trees, Domaine d'Astros is also a well known wine estate;
shortDescription:
Domaine d'Astros is a huge farm estate where two outstanding castles were built at two different periods of time: While the "Chateau Vieux" castle was erected during the XVIIth century, the other castle was built during the XIXth century and exhibits an italian renaissance style.
Famous for its apple trees, Domaine d'Astros is also a well known wine estate;

label: Musée du Petit Palais
comment: Outstanding collection of Italian (The Campana collection, Louvre Museum deposit) and Provencal paintings from the late 13 th to the early 16 th centuries, and collection of Romanesque and Gothic Avignon sculptures. The museum of the Petit Palais is one of big European Museums of medieval art. Certified Museum of France, it is also classified in the UNESCO world heritage.
shortDescription: Outstanding collection of Italian (The Campana collection, Louvre Museum deposit) and Provencal paintings from the late 13 th to the early 16 th centuries, and collection of Romanesque and Gothic Avignon sculptures. The museum of the Petit Palais is one of big European Museums of medieval art. Certified Museum of France, it is also classified in the UNESCO world heritage.

label: Eglise de Saint Maurice
comment: Listed in the Inventory of Historic Monuments, it is one of the oldest churches in the Hautes-Alpes. It was built between the 11th and 12th centuries by the monks of Cluny. Near it, "Sully" a venerable 400 years old lime tree...
shortDescription: Listed in the Inventory of Historic Monuments, it is one of the oldest churches in the Hautes-Alpes. It was built between the 11th and 12th centuries by the monks of Cluny. Near it, "Sully" a venerable 400 years old lime tree...

label: Place de la Cabraïa
comment: Herds of goats ( cabraïa  in regional dialect ) were gathered here in the XVI th century before taking them to their place of pasture.
shortDescription: Herds of goats ( cabraïa  in regional dialect ) were gathered here in the XVI th century before taking them to their place of pasture.

label: La Maison de Paul Bourget (Plantier de Costebelle)
comment: House for Palladian architecture, built in 1857 by the Baroness of Prailly. Placed on the ISMH, the property was purchased by Paul Bourget in 1896. Many writers were received there. These places, loaded with literary memory, are surrounded by a 4 ha park with lush vegetation. Visit the Botanical Garden and Paul Bourget Chapel.
shortDescription: House for Palladian architecture, built in 1857 by the Baroness of Prailly. Placed on the ISMH, the property was purchased by Paul Bourget in 1896. Many writers were received there. These places, loaded with literary memory, are surrounded by a 4 ha park with lush vegetation. Visit the Botanical Garden and Paul Bourget Chapel.
streetAddress: ['714 Avenue de la Font des Horts', 'Costebelle']

label: Cathédrale Notre Dame de l'Assomption
comment: The ancient Romanesque cathedral bears witness to the rich past of Senez, erected as a bishopric as early as the 5th century. Excavations undertaken in the building in 2018 have uncovered an early Christian church dating back to antiquity,
shortDescription: The ancient Romanesque cathedral bears witness to the rich past of Senez, erected as a bishopric as early as the 5th century. Excavations undertaken in the building in 2018 have uncovered an early Christian church dating back to antiquity,

label: Plage du Centre Nautique
comment:
Beach in natural elements - Beach restaurants and water sports centres - Surveillance in summer - Non-smoking beach - Showers and WC. Handi-beach and PRM access.
Blue zone parking and bicycle park
shortDescription:
Beach in natural elements - Beach restaurants and water sports centres - Surveillance in summer - Non-smoking beach - Showers and WC. Handi-beach and PRM access.
Blue zone parking and bicycle park

label: Bibliothèque du Noyer
comment: The Noyer library offers a library space for young people and adults (novels, literature, science fiction, detective stories, comics, documentaries...), as well as a games library.
shortDescription: The Noyer library offers a library space for young people and adults (novels, literature, science fiction, detective stories, comics, documentaries...), as well as a games library.

label: Plage de la Calanque d'Anthéor
comment: Located at the level of the Viaduct, the beach of this cove extends over 100 m of sand, it is equipped with a small shower, a rest area of 10 m, a car park of 60 places located behind the Viaduct. Nearby there is a site commemorating the Landing.
shortDescription: Located at the level of the Viaduct, the beach of this cove extends over 100 m of sand, it is equipped with a small shower, a rest area of 10 m, a car park of 60 places located behind the Viaduct. Nearby there is a site commemorating the Landing.

label: Plage de Bertaud-Marines de Gassin
comment:
The old beach of the Bertaud castle is shared between Cogolin and Gassin. It offers 400 meters of sand with a nice depth and a beautiful panorama on the Gulf of Saint-Tropez.
Supervised beach in summer on the Cogolin side with showers, toilets, restaurants.
shortDescription:
The old beach of the Bertaud castle is shared between Cogolin and Gassin. It offers 400 meters of sand with a nice depth and a beautiful panorama on the Gulf of Saint-Tropez.
Supervised beach in summer on the Cogolin side with showers, toilets, restaurants.

label: Rue du Pont-Vieux
comment: Major street of the medieval city that linked the center to the bridge.
shortDescription: Major street of the medieval city that linked the center to the bridge.

label: Musée de la Résistance
comment: This museum is very well documented, both in terms of local resistance and the more general history of French resistance.
shortDescription: This museum is very well documented, both in terms of local resistance and the more general history of French resistance.

label: Plan d'eau de Siguret
comment: The « Plan d'eau » at Jausiers is a man-made bathing lake set alongside the Ubaye river, and surrounded by grassy lawns and shaded picnic areas.
shortDescription: The « Plan d'eau » at Jausiers is a man-made bathing lake set alongside the Ubaye river, and surrounded by grassy lawns and shaded picnic areas.

label: Château de Pontevès
comment: The history of Bargème is closely linked to Pontèves dynasty.
shortDescription: The history of Bargème is closely linked to Pontèves dynasty.

label: Viaduc des Latins
comment: Built in 1883, one will go under the arches of this beautiful work of art to read the curious inscriptions of its dedication, written in all the Romance languages and the various Occitan dialects.
shortDescription: Built in 1883, one will go under the arches of this beautiful work of art to read the curious inscriptions of its dedication, written in all the Romance languages and the various Occitan dialects.

label: Eglise Saint-Clément
comment: The parish church is dedicated to St Clement, patron saint of the commune. Its situation dates probably from the Middle-Ages. It was rebuilt from 1782 to 1787 in response to the growth in population.
shortDescription: The parish church is dedicated to St Clement, patron saint of the commune. Its situation dates probably from the Middle-Ages. It was rebuilt from 1782 to 1787 in response to the growth in population.

label: La Filaventure, boutique et musée sensoriel de la Manufacture Brun de Vian-Tiran
comment: Brun de Vian-Tiran has been in business for 210 years, and today offers you the opportunity to share its passion for noble fibres at La Filaventure. La Filaventure is a sensorial museum, on a constant quest for the most beautiful textiles on five continents. La Filaventure is the fruit of two centuries of innovation and d'excellence.
shortDescription: Brun de Vian-Tiran has been in business for 210 years, and today offers you the opportunity to share its passion for noble fibres at La Filaventure. La Filaventure is a sensorial museum, on a constant quest for the most beautiful textiles on five continents. La Filaventure is the fruit of two centuries of innovation and d'excellence.

label: Eglise Saint-Jacques le Majeur
comment: The present parish church was built outside the village in 1850, in a neo-classic style. The vault collapsed on the day following the mass, which had been pronounced on the occasion of the death of General De Gaulle, in 1970.
shortDescription: The present parish church was built outside the village in 1850, in a neo-classic style. The vault collapsed on the day following the mass, which had been pronounced on the occasion of the death of General De Gaulle, in 1970.

label: Le Paraïs : maison et jardins de Jean Giono
comment: The Centre Jean Giono and the association les Amis de Jean Giono offer you a guided tour to discover the different offices of the writer and living rooms, sanctuary of his memories, his works.
shortDescription: The Centre Jean Giono and the association les Amis de Jean Giono offer you a guided tour to discover the different offices of the writer and living rooms, sanctuary of his memories, his works.

label: Monument aux morts
comment: This monument was erected to commemorate and honour the soldiers, persons killed or missing as a result of acts of war. It is decorated with a funeral urn and an honorary wreath.
shortDescription: This monument was erected to commemorate and honour the soldiers, persons killed or missing as a result of acts of war. It is decorated with a funeral urn and an honorary wreath.

label: Plan d'eau du Lez
comment: Water plan close to the village. For fishing enthusiasts.
shortDescription: Water plan close to the village. For fishing enthusiasts.

label: Cathédrale Notre-Dame-Du-Puy de Grasse
comment: The cathedral dates from the mid-13th century (the bishopric was transferred from Antibes to Grasse in 1244). The architecture is influenced by both Liguria and Lombardy (layout, decorative elements, vaulting).
shortDescription: The cathedral dates from the mid-13th century (the bishopric was transferred from Antibes to Grasse in 1244). The architecture is influenced by both Liguria and Lombardy (layout, decorative elements, vaulting).

label: Place Rose Goudard
comment:
Part of the Arquet canal (17 meters) was covered 
Houses, including a girls' school, were decommissioned in 1961 and the whole was destroyed. Afterwards, a large square was opened, so on 22 March 1963, the name Rose Goudard gave it the name of Rose Goudard.
shortDescription:
Part of the Arquet canal (17 meters) was covered 
Houses, including a girls' school, were decommissioned in 1961 and the whole was destroyed. Afterwards, a large square was opened, so on 22 March 1963, the name Rose Goudard gave it the name of Rose Goudard.

label: Espace Archéologique et Géologique
comment: Archaeological remains from the Greek, Roman, Gallo-Roman and Medieval eras, all found in Beaumes de Venise, now feature in a permanent exhibition at the Chapel of Notre Dame d'Aubune.
shortDescription: Archaeological remains from the Greek, Roman, Gallo-Roman and Medieval eras, all found in Beaumes de Venise, now feature in a permanent exhibition at the Chapel of Notre Dame d'Aubune.

label: Savournon
comment:
An Alpine farming region, Savournon has specialised in sheep breeding and fruit orchards.
The town was, for a long period, renowned for lamb with the creation of the so-called "Préalpes du Sud" breed, which is sold under the name "Sisteron lamb".
With 4,500 hectares of orchards in the Southern Alps, apples and pears are grown sustainably under a wide variety of names (Golden, Boskoop, Canada rennet, Fuji, etc.).
shortDescription:
An Alpine farming region, Savournon has specialised in sheep breeding and fruit orchards.
The town was, for a long period, renowned for lamb with the creation of the so-called "Préalpes du Sud" breed, which is sold under the name "Sisteron lamb".
With 4,500 hectares of orchards in the Southern Alps, apples and pears are grown sustainably under a wide variety of names (Golden, Boskoop, Canada rennet, Fuji, etc.).

label: Vergers et jardins conservatoires (La Thomassine)
comment:
EXCEPTIONAL CLOSURE UNTIL TUESDAY, JULY 19TH INCLUDED
Thank you for your understanding
shortDescription:
EXCEPTIONAL CLOSURE UNTIL TUESDAY, JULY 19TH INCLUDED
Thank you for your understanding
streetAddress: ['2298, chemin de la Thomassine', 'Parc naturel régional du Luberon']

label: Village perché de Valavoire
comment: Discover the "Château de la Molle" in Valavoire, this rocky outcrop in the Jouère mountain range. Valavoire is also a village rich in history. The parish church of Saint-Pancrace dates from the 13th century and is of Romanesque architecture.
shortDescription: Discover the "Château de la Molle" in Valavoire, this rocky outcrop in the Jouère mountain range. Valavoire is also a village rich in history. The parish church of Saint-Pancrace dates from the 13th century and is of Romanesque architecture.

label: Domaine du Mas de l'Olivine
comment:
Two people who love the land and its scents, Audrey and Thierry Bortolini invite you into their 18th-century family estate :  Le Domaine du Mas de l’Olivine in Peymeinade.
As sweets-lovers themselves, they turn the flowers of their own gardens into delectable treats.
shortDescription:
Two people who love the land and its scents, Audrey and Thierry Bortolini invite you into their 18th-century family estate :  Le Domaine du Mas de l’Olivine in Peymeinade.
As sweets-lovers themselves, they turn the flowers of their own gardens into delectable treats.

label: Place des Observantins
comment: This square was created in 2014 in front of the remains of the Convent of the Observantins (religious of St. Francis of the Strict Observance) whose construction dates back to the end of the 14th and 15th centuries.
shortDescription: This square was created in 2014 in front of the remains of the Convent of the Observantins (religious of St. Francis of the Strict Observance) whose construction dates back to the end of the 14th and 15th centuries.

comment: the library offers you the possibility to borrow a wide choice of documents
shortDescription: the library offers you the possibility to borrow a wide choice of documents

label: Cimetière classé de Forcalquier
comment: The cemetery of Forcalquier benefits since 1946 from a departmental classification. The site is famous for the green cloister formed by its avenues of pruned yew trees. Open arcades in the hedges shelter the tombs.
shortDescription: The cemetery of Forcalquier benefits since 1946 from a departmental classification. The site is famous for the green cloister formed by its avenues of pruned yew trees. Open arcades in the hedges shelter the tombs.

label: Plage Vigne d'Aiguines
comment: Family beach, shaded, located in the cove of the lake, at the bottom of the village in front of the island of Costebelle and the harbour.
shortDescription: Family beach, shaded, located in the cove of the lake, at the bottom of the village in front of the island of Costebelle and the harbour.

label: Villa Arson
comment: Remarkable contemporary architecture, theater of exhibitions dedicated to contemporary creation, the Villa Arson offers visitors free access to a unique view of the bay of Nice accessible from its terraces and hanging gardens.
shortDescription: Remarkable contemporary architecture, theater of exhibitions dedicated to contemporary creation, the Villa Arson offers visitors free access to a unique view of the bay of Nice accessible from its terraces and hanging gardens.

label: Chapelle de la Miséricorde des Pénitents noirs
comment: The facade  of the Misericorde  chapel is a very good example of 17th century Baroque architecture strongly marked by breaks in the lines of composition that provide a play of shadows and lights.
shortDescription: The facade  of the Misericorde  chapel is a very good example of 17th century Baroque architecture strongly marked by breaks in the lines of composition that provide a play of shadows and lights.

label: Jardin de lecture
comment: The library has opened a Reading Hut. In the calm of the reading garden, this small hut works on the principle of book boxes: books can be taken and/or put in.
shortDescription: The library has opened a Reading Hut. In the calm of the reading garden, this small hut works on the principle of book boxes: books can be taken and/or put in.

label: Hospice
comment: Inset medallion in the facade was inscribed MH on 02/02/1931
shortDescription: Inset medallion in the facade was inscribed MH on 02/02/1931

label: Mémorial des guerres en Indochine
comment: Located on the site of the former Galliéni military camp, where the Indo-Chinese riflemen had stayed.
shortDescription: Located on the site of the former Galliéni military camp, where the Indo-Chinese riflemen had stayed.

label: Musée d'Art Sacré
comment: The Museum presents an exhibition of cult objects and clothing that belonged to the priests and parishioners of the Val.
shortDescription: The Museum presents an exhibition of cult objects and clothing that belonged to the priests and parishioners of the Val.

label: Médiathèque Chalucet
comment: Books, comic books, magazines, CDs and DVDs are available for all audiences and can be borrowed. But also a Cinérama, 12 computer stations, a news room, a board games room and a room dedicated to video games.
shortDescription: Books, comic books, magazines, CDs and DVDs are available for all audiences and can be borrowed. But also a Cinérama, 12 computer stations, a news room, a board games room and a room dedicated to video games.

label: Mémorial de l'ancien village
comment: Memorial of the old village where a ram and 7 ewes graze peacefully in the middle of lavender, almond and olive trees.
shortDescription: Memorial of the old village where a ram and 7 ewes graze peacefully in the middle of lavender, almond and olive trees.

label: Gare de Fontan-Saorge
comment: Built in 1928 by PLM, halfway between Fontan and Saorge to serve these two communities.
shortDescription: Built in 1928 by PLM, halfway between Fontan and Saorge to serve these two communities.

label: Médiathèque intercommunale Vinon sur Verdon
comment: The intermunicipal media library was built in the former municipal workshops and opened in 2013.
shortDescription: The intermunicipal media library was built in the former municipal workshops and opened in 2013.

label: Médiathèque communautaire
comment: Get free access to culture at Bargemon media centre. You can borrow cartoons, DVDs, CDs. Exhibitions are organised all year round.
shortDescription: Get free access to culture at Bargemon media centre. You can borrow cartoons, DVDs, CDs. Exhibitions are organised all year round.

label: Moulin à huile
comment:
Communal oil mill 
Operates in the traditional way in winter.
Artists' exhibitions in summer.
shortDescription:
Communal oil mill 
Operates in the traditional way in winter.
Artists' exhibitions in summer.

label: Oppidum Montjean
comment: This Ligurian dry stone fortress, built by the indigenous tribes on the heights of Cavalaire-sur-Mer was inhabited from the 6th to the 4th century BC.
shortDescription: This Ligurian dry stone fortress, built by the indigenous tribes on the heights of Cavalaire-sur-Mer was inhabited from the 6th to the 4th century BC.

label: Plage Mademoiselle Gray
comment: Elegant, impertinent, light, bohemian and resolutely Mediterranean with its world cuisine, Mademoiselle Gray claims a natural and warm atmosphere.
shortDescription: Elegant, impertinent, light, bohemian and resolutely Mediterranean with its world cuisine, Mademoiselle Gray claims a natural and warm atmosphere.

label: Abbaye Notre-Dame de Sénanque
comment:
Nestled in the hollow of its valley, the Abbey of Notre Dame de Sénanque remains one of the purest witnesses of primitive Cistercian architecture.
Guided tours (1 hour in French) or unguided with HistoPad.
shortDescription:
Nestled in the hollow of its valley, the Abbey of Notre Dame de Sénanque remains one of the purest witnesses of primitive Cistercian architecture.
Guided tours (1 hour in French) or unguided with HistoPad.

label: Musée des Arts et Traditions Populaires
comment: Located right in the city centre, the museum of Folk and Crafts was founded in the mid 80s. The museum’s collections reflect living and working conditions in Mid Provence  during the 19th and 20th century and explain the know how and  technics used in agriculture and industry. Exhibitions and events link the past with today’s reality. Local products and craftsmanship are available in the shop. Guided tour upon appointment.
shortDescription: Located right in the city centre, the museum of Folk and Crafts was founded in the mid 80s. The museum’s collections reflect living and working conditions in Mid Provence  during the 19th and 20th century and explain the know how and  technics used in agriculture and industry. Exhibitions and events link the past with today’s reality. Local products and craftsmanship are available in the shop. Guided tour upon appointment.

label: L'Alba Plage
comment: Come and enjoy our relaxation area at the water's edge, under the shade of the parasols, for a moment of relaxation on our deckchairs.
shortDescription: Come and enjoy our relaxation area at the water's edge, under the shade of the parasols, for a moment of relaxation on our deckchairs.

label: Musée de la Vallée
comment: The school museum of yesteryear is located on the church square and is dedicated to school and public education in the mountains. The old one-class school in the hamlet of the Church closed in 1966; it is now converted into a museum.
shortDescription: The school museum of yesteryear is located on the church square and is dedicated to school and public education in the mountains. The old one-class school in the hamlet of the Church closed in 1966; it is now converted into a museum.

label: Parc du château des Terrasses
comment: In this park, you’ll be thrilled to discover authentic regional and Mediterranean flora, amongst them many rare species.
shortDescription: In this park, you’ll be thrilled to discover authentic regional and Mediterranean flora, amongst them many rare species.

label: Cathédrale Saint-Jérôme
comment: Neo-gothic co-cathedral of Digne les Bains
shortDescription: Neo-gothic co-cathedral of Digne les Bains

label: Parc Carol de Roumanie
comment: A huge 1.8-hectare leisure and green space, the Parc Carol de Roumanie is a real slice of paradise for families thanks to its playgrounds, its bouncy park and its mini golf course.
shortDescription: A huge 1.8-hectare leisure and green space, the Parc Carol de Roumanie is a real slice of paradise for families thanks to its playgrounds, its bouncy park and its mini golf course.

label: Hôtel particulier de Justamond
comment: The imposing front of this hotel has been listed as a historic monument since 1970, also the main door decorated with a carved cartridge that provides access to a garden as well as various italian vaulted rooms.
shortDescription: The imposing front of this hotel has been listed as a historic monument since 1970, also the main door decorated with a carved cartridge that provides access to a garden as well as various italian vaulted rooms.

label: Fort du Col de Brouis
comment: Constructor: French military engineering, reinforced concrete
shortDescription: Constructor: French military engineering, reinforced concrete

label: Musée auto-moto l’Estanco
comment:
L'Estanco museum presents a private collection of cars, motobikes, old bikes, agricultural equipment, tooling, pieces from the 1st & 2nd world war.
You will travel from 1898 to our days, and discover the locomotion development.
shortDescription:
L'Estanco museum presents a private collection of cars, motobikes, old bikes, agricultural equipment, tooling, pieces from the 1st & 2nd world war.
You will travel from 1898 to our days, and discover the locomotion development.

label: Maison Waldberg Donations Max Ernst - Dorothea Tanning et Stan Appenzeller
comment: Collection of about a hundred lithographs by Max Ernst, one of the most important representatives of the "Dada" and surrealist movements, and his wife Dorothea Tanning, an artist of the same vein. Also worth seeing are the paintings of Stan Appenzeller.
shortDescription: Collection of about a hundred lithographs by Max Ernst, one of the most important representatives of the "Dada" and surrealist movements, and his wife Dorothea Tanning, an artist of the same vein. Also worth seeing are the paintings of Stan Appenzeller.

label: Chapelle Notre Dame de Santé
comment: Votive chapel built from 1876 to 1879 following the cholera epidemic that spared Cuers in 1865. Panoramic viewpoint from the esplanade: the Barres de Cuers, the town and the Massif des Maures.
shortDescription: Votive chapel built from 1876 to 1879 following the cholera epidemic that spared Cuers in 1865. Panoramic viewpoint from the esplanade: the Barres de Cuers, the town and the Massif des Maures.

label: Pont de l'Artuby
comment: The bridge over the Artuby was constructed of reinforced concrete between 1938 and 1940 by the company Thorrand and Co. from Nice.
shortDescription: The bridge over the Artuby was constructed of reinforced concrete between 1938 and 1940 by the company Thorrand and Co. from Nice.

label: Musée de Vence - Fondation Emile Hugues
comment: Exhibitions of contemporary art in the heart of the mediaeval city.
shortDescription: Exhibitions of contemporary art in the heart of the mediaeval city.

label: Four du mitan
comment:
In this old banal oven of the 16th century, entirely restored by the Association of the "Friends of the Four du Mitan" you will discover :
- the reconstruction of a bread oven scene in 1897 (shovels, bread tables, kneading machine, dough knives, flour scales, ...
shortDescription:
In this old banal oven of the 16th century, entirely restored by the Association of the "Friends of the Four du Mitan" you will discover :

Father Bernard, the head priest from 1882 to 1890, commissioned the architect Pierre Aubé to build a new church. Originally from Lyon, Aubé took inspiration from Byzantine and Moorish architecture, and the dome of the church was inspired by Saint-Sophia in Istanbul.

label: Village perché de Valernes

It enjoys a beautiful view over La Sasse Valley and stands opposite Gâche Mountain.
A typically Provencal "perched" village, it has a square shaded by plane trees dominating the valley. From here you can admire the square, fountain, covered washhouse and stepped street leading to the 19th century church. Occupied by Protestants, the fortifications were demolished before being partially restored.
shortDescription:
It enjoys a beautiful view over La Sasse Valley and stands opposite Gâche Mountain.

Occupied by Protestants, the fortifications were demolished before being partially restored.

The Church of St. John the Baptist in Beuil of his Church of Our Lady of the Rosary was built in 1687.
The building became a parish church after a fire destroyed the church of St John the Baptist in 1794.

shortDescription: To the west of Miramar beach in La Londe les Maures, the Bastidon pine forest extends over 19 hectares of maritime pines. An exceptionally fragile preserved area, on the seaside under the protection of the Conservatoire du Littoral.

Water has never been lacking in Plan de la Tour!
The wells were for a long time at the heart of the life of the village and the hamlets until the appearance of pumps. In the past, these wells were places of meeting and exchange, and have been transformed into fountains, a testimony to this past.

Water has never been lacking in Plan de la Tour!

label: Plage de Pramousquier
comment: Snugly ensconed between two rocky headlands, Pramousquier is the last of the beaches of the Lavandou. It has a certain mysterious air about it, perhaps something to do with the blue, green or glint of the sand or almost turquoise colour of the sea.
shortDescription: Snugly ensconed between two rocky headlands, Pramousquier is the last of the beaches of the Lavandou. It has a certain mysterious air about it, perhaps something to do with the blue, green or glint of the sand or almost turquoise colour of the sea.

label: Chapelle Saint Jacques
comment: Built in 1688 as a former oratory for travellers and pilgrims, rebuilt at the beginning of the 19th century in the Baroque style and listed in the Inventory, the chapel now regularly hosts temporary exhibitions dedicated to the arts.
shortDescription: Built in 1688 as a former oratory for travellers and pilgrims, rebuilt at the beginning of the 19th century in the Baroque style and listed in the Inventory, the chapel now regularly hosts temporary exhibitions dedicated to the arts.

label: La Glacière
comment:
Ampus icehouse. Located just before the Ratton bridge, coming from Ampus on the way to Chateaudouble, it had been built in the coldest part of Ampus village.
At a time when electric power or fridges did not exist, people were clever enough to use the climate and build natural ice houses. These holes allowed to keep ice meant to supply Draguignan pubs in summer.  Gaston Martin relates that carts would convey the ice. When new modern technics started to be introduced,  we soon forgot about the icehouse  .
Only a few people knew that an icehouse could be found and be visited in Ampus. The situation changed when an environmental protection association –APPA  together with the municipality and the CAD organization pulled their efforts together so as to restore the icehouse and make it a public monument.
shortDescription:
Ampus icehouse. Located just before the Ratton bridge, coming from Ampus on the way to Chateaudouble, it had been built in the coldest part of Ampus village.
At a time when electric power or fridges did not exist, people were clever enough to use the climate and build natural ice houses. These holes allowed to keep ice meant to supply Draguignan pubs in summer.  Gaston Martin relates that carts would convey the ice. When new modern technics started to be introduced,  we soon forgot about the icehouse  .
Only a few people knew that an icehouse could be found and be visited in Ampus. The situation changed when an environmental protection association –APPA  together with the municipality and the CAD organization pulled their efforts together so as to restore the icehouse and make it a public monument.

1st Century A.D. monument, classified as World Heritage by UNESCO. 
The Arch, dedicated at first to the feats of the Gallic 2nd Legion veterans who founded the Roman colony of Orange early in the first century and then to the Emperor Tiberius, is an outstanding monument in the Roman provincial style. As a ceremonial gateway, it marked the boundary between the world of the dead and the original city
