It was the city church of Aix for many years and contained the relics of Mitre of Aix, a Christian martyr who died in Aix. The site of the Church of Notre-Dame de la Seds is marked by the presence of an ancient theatre, buried underground since the 5th century and only discovered in 2004. 


After the closure of the theatre, it was dismantled, the site filled in, and buildings erected above it. The present Church of Notre-Dame de la Seds dates from 1853. It was built in the Romanesque-Byzantine style.

label: Jardin Public
description:
Pretty little garden, games for children, bench, made up of multiple vegetation.
Toilets accessible for handicapped people.

label: Parcs et jardins - sentier botanique
comment: Botanical path in Noves.
shortDescription: Botanical path in Noves.
description: Thanks to this trail, discover the rich flora of the hill and the many species that make it up. Free access all year round, except during the red zone period.

label: Palais de Justice
comment: This palace was built by the architect Auguste Martin (1862). Its classical façade is preceded by a vast esplanade.
shortDescription: This palace was built by the architect Auguste Martin (1862). Its classical façade is preceded by a vast esplanade.
description: The allegory of Justice on the pediment is the work of the sculptor Eugène Guillaume. He is also responsible for the reliefs representing protective and repressive justice.

label: Grottes du Castelas
description: Troglodyte caves of the Castelas located under the old feudal castle, now converted into a showroom.

label: Porte des Moulins ou de l'Horloge
comment: Porte des Moulins or de l'Horloge.
shortDescription: Porte des Moulins or de l'Horloge.
description:
Originally the village was built around the castle on the rock of the Coste.
In the 12th century, due to the increase of the population, a new wall was built and the mill gate was opened towards the north and the church.

Its name comes from the seigniorial wheat mill that was installed in front of the gate (on the site of the parking lot).
In the 17th century, the gate was raised and a belfry was built to indicate the presence of the consuls' house. From then on, the gate was called the "porte de l'horloge" (clock gate).

label: Hôtel de Panisse Passis
description: An extraordinary composition from the first half of the 18th century with sumptuous décor, notably panelled bay windows, gargoyles, balcony screens and ornamental keystones.

label: Jardin Chanot
comment: An urban green space par excellence, the Chanot garden is a haven of peace away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
shortDescription: An urban green space par excellence, the Chanot garden is a haven of peace away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
description:
In some squares, the playgrounds can still be used but are under the responsibility of the parents who must ensure that the sanitary rules are respected and, in particular, that the children are physically distanced.



An urban green space par excellence, the Chanot garden is a haven of peace away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Located in a very busy area, at the entrance to the Exhibition Centre and a stone's throw from the Velodrome stadium, this space is entirely dedicated to children. The park is organised around a 4-metre glass pyramid which is in fact the skylight of the metro station below. In addition to two children's playgrounds, the garden also features a merry-go-round, an electric car circuit, a bicycle rental point and a puppet theatre. At the edge of the pond, a refreshment bar-restaurant allows for a soothing stopover. Remodelled in 1995, this garden has been equipped with a road training track lined with 9 large umbrella pines and more than 1000 shrubs (oleanders, laurels, spireas, seringas, viburnum, escallonias...).

label: Château de Montauban
comment: This beautiful residence was above all a place of rest and inspiration for Alphonse Daudet. The museum offers a prefiguration of a vast project and presents the permanent exhibition on the medieval archaeological discoveries of the area.
shortDescription: This beautiful residence was above all a place of rest and inspiration for Alphonse Daudet. The museum offers a prefiguration of a vast project and presents the permanent exhibition on the medieval archaeological discoveries of the area.
description:
This house, the setting for many of Alphonse Daudet's novels, was above all a place of calm and rest for the author: "Blessed house, how many times I have come here to reconnect with nature, to cure myself of Paris and its fevers...".
This superb building, with its monumental 19th century façade adjoining an 18th century farmhouse, was the home of the Ambroy family who welcomed the author during his stays in Provence. Daudet regularly visited the house with his wife Julia from 1863, at the invitation of his cousins.
Now a museum centre dedicated to the history of the village, the Château de Montauban is the forerunner of a vast cultural project which already includes a permanent exhibition on the medieval archaeological discoveries of the area.

label: Bibliothèque Municipale de Vernègues
description: Open on Wednesdays from 9.30am to 12pm and from 2.30pm to 6pm and on Saturdays from 10am to 12pm.

label: Grand Portail
description:
The former gate to the town and the only remains of the old ramparts, this imposing 14th century monument is almost intact.
It has a covered passageway made of medium-sized stones, with a semi-circular arch opening. The construction is crowned with a hoarding and has gabled machiolations which are purely decorative. Under the passageway, to the right, there is a fountain which is clearly fairly recent. The gate was closed from the inside by a portcullis, which has since disappeared. A staircase still provides access to the wall walk, but it was renovated fairly recently and the first steps are missing.

label: Médiathèque Albert Camus
comment: Media library of Carnoux en Provence
shortDescription: Media library of Carnoux en Provence
description:
The media library presents a collection of approximately 25,000 documents in a totally open space including :

an adult area
a children's area with a corner reserved for toddlers from birth (Le coin des minots)
a Youth area: for children aged 11 and over
a Multimedia area: scores - CDs - DVDs
a Memory area
In order to facilitate access to the library's collections, the documents are classified according to a classification specific to public reading libraries.

label: Bibliothèque municipale
description: Registration is free. You only need to bring a proof of address when you register at the library. For minors whose parents are not registered at the library, a parental authorisation must be filled in, usually at the school at the beginning of the school year.

label: Hôtel de Ville de Cassis
description: Just a stone's throw from the port, at the end of a courtyard, stands the former private mansion of Les Moustiers. Built at the end of the 16th century and the beginning of the 17th century, this sober-looking building now houses the Cassis Town Hall. In 1789, the owner of the building was François-Xavier De Garnier, secretary to the King at the Parliament of Aix and Mayor of Cassis. He was guillotined in 1794 but the Hotel de Moustiers remained in his family until it was bought by the municipality (1938). From 1985 to 1988, it was restored and fitted out. One enters the courtyard of the hotel through a Louis XIII portal with bosses. It is interesting to visit the interior because at the level of the reception area, a plexiglass floor allows one to observe the remains of the old town, which were uncovered during the restoration work. The VIP room and the chapel are classified as historical monuments. Guided tour for the Heritage Days.

label: Maison natale de Cezanne
description: Paul Cezanne was born on 19 of January 1839, in a charitable institution run by the Misses Michel, near Miss Aube's boarding school of the Nativity.

label: Ville de Pertuis
description:
Pertuis is a city of almost 20,000 inhabitants. Its name comes from the Latin Pertus, meaning the gap, the passage, which gave it a major role in the economic development of its region. The Durance has been the driving force behind agricultural development, favouring a plain landscape rich in crops which have made Pertuis famous through products such as asparagus and potatoes.
Discover Pertuis, a dynamic town, concerned about the quality of its environment a few kilometres from Aix en Provence, in the heart of two privileged entities : the Luberon Regional Natural Park and the mythical Sainte Victoire mountain.
The visit of the old town will enchant you, small streets full of flowers, old houses restored with taste. There reigns a soft Provencal atmosphere sheltered from the Mistral wind where the play of light and shadow embellishes the rich cultural and historical heritage that the town has managed to preserve.
Weekly appointments that are tasteful: Friday morning, the Provencal market in the town centre, Wednesday and Saturday morning, the farmers' market on the Place Garcin.

label: Le lavoir
description: Senas once owned three wash houses. This one was built at the same time as the first water tower, in 1924. Every morning, the country guard would put water in the wash-house. It was completely renovated in 2005.

label: Bibliothèque municipale
comment: Come and take advantage of the books available at the municipal library of St Paul lez Durance
shortDescription: Come and take advantage of the books available at the municipal library of St Paul lez Durance
description: Novels, comics, poetry, theatre... there's something for everyone!

label: Hôtel Maurel de Pontèves dit d'Espagnet
description:
This mansion was built between 1647 and 1651 by Jean Lombard and then Pierre Pavillon for Pierre Maurel, a rich cloth merchant who rose to the highest echelons of society and made alliances with the foremost families of Provence. 

His mansion was one of the first to be built in the Mazarin district. 

The Hôtel Maurel de Pontevès marks the transition from Mannerism to Baroque. 

The picturesque decor of its eye-catching frontage is of Michelangelesque inspiration. Two remarkable atlantes support a balcony

label: Eygalières
description:
Eygalières is a small, quiet village 5 minutes from Saint Rémy de Provence. Surrounded by superb Alpilles landscapes, the village faces vast fields of olive groves, verdant valleys and vines. Beautiful estates with superb, tastefully restored Mas are scattered throughout this picture-postcard landscape.
In the distance, before you arrive in the village, you will see Eygalières perched on top of its small hill. As you approach, you will gradually be able to make out the houses spread out on the hill facing the panoramic view... and your only thought will be to stop and visit this village.
You will discover an extremely charming village which has retained its authentic atmosphere. The village's old houses are made of stone and are very beautiful; there is always a hint of greenery or a flower bush peeping out from the gate, hinting at the presence of beautiful gardens. The houses stretch serenely along the narrow winding streets. The main street climbs up to the old village; as you climb Rue de l'Eglise you will come across the ruins of the château, the esplanade of the old keep and Saint Laurent Church.

label: Espace festif le Palio
comment: These new arenas welcome bullfighting events (Corridas, Camargue races) as well as cultural shows (music, humor, singers, tradition...)
shortDescription: These new arenas welcome bullfighting events (Corridas, Camargue races) as well as cultural shows (music, humor, singers, tradition...)
description: These new arenas host both demonstrations of bullfighting (Corridas, Camargue races) as cultural performances (music, comedy, singers, tradition...)

label: La Préfecture des Bouches du Rhône
comment: In October 1861, Napoleon III appointed Senator Charlemagne-Emile de Maupas as head of the department, with orders to modernize Marseille.
shortDescription: In October 1861, Napoleon III appointed Senator Charlemagne-Emile de Maupas as head of the department, with orders to modernize Marseille.
description:
The Prefecture, located since the First Empire in the Hôtel Roux de Corse (now the Lycée Montgrand), is too small for a city of great importance.

 Maupas decided to build a new 7500m2 building in the rue Saint-Ferréol. In the shape of a quadrilateral, it is organized around two courtyards: a semi-circular main courtyard, and a rectangular courtyard housing the stables. The plans and specifications were approved by the General Council in February 1862.

The departmental architect, Auguste Martin, carried out the structural work until his resignation in November 1864, when the cost overruns, which Maupas did not care about, became a cause for concern. François-Joseph Nolau, Second Prize of Rome, succeeded him until 1869 to complete the interior of the monument: painting and stucco decorations, furniture, bronzes, crystal chandeliers, etc. The expenses were colossal.
To create the ceiling decorations, Nolau chose, with Maupas' approval, the Marseille artist Antoine Dominique Magaud, famous for his portraits and religious paintings. The work was considerable: four main rooms and the senator's apartments. The whole was completed in 1868, except for the Salon de l'Horloge which was finished in 1872. The painted cycle and the ornamental sculptures glorify the Second Empire and its benefits. The grand staircase, comparable in its majesty to the staircases of the Palais Longchamp, and whose structure has two double revolutions, leads on one side to the apartments of honour, and on the other to the rooms of the General Council.
The new Prefecture was inaugurated at the end of 1866, but on 31 December Maupas was dismissed. His successor, Prefect Levert, was forced to pay the debts while continuing the work undertaken

label: Mas de la Samatane
comment: The Mas de la Samatane, former post and stagecoach house.
shortDescription: The Mas de la Samatane, former post and stagecoach house.
description:
The Samatane building was the first magnificent Mas to be built in the commune and was a former coaching inn known as the Auberge de Chatillon. This name is demonstrated by the term Coussoul de Chatillon, which designates the location.
In 1791, the property belonged to the Church and was confiscated and auctioned off. The Coussoul de Chatillon belonged to the Commandery of Trinquetaille of the Order of Malta. The land had different owners after 1798, but in 1825 was given over to Mr. Gontard, a master jeweller from Marseille. It was Mr. Gontard who constructed the buildings and hence the inn we know today.
The 1837 inscription on the fanlight of the main entrance, with the intertwined initials LS, suggests that Louis de Samatan bought the property on this date. The 400 ha taken from the land of the Coussouls de Chatillon were acquired by a single tenant in one transaction.
It remains a remarkable Mas, consisting of a splendid building and land that is still cultivated (despite a considerable reduction in surface area). The Maison de la Chasse et de la Nature (Hunting and Nature Museum) moved there several years ago and even received the Départemental 'Rubans du Patrimoine' Award in 2007.

label: Les Oratoires de Cabannes
comment: The Oratories of Cabannes.
shortDescription: The Oratories of Cabannes.
description:
- The Oratory of the Virgin (Route de Cavaillon): Also known as the Oratory of the Saint or of Our Lady commemorates the Marian Jubilee of 1851. It is dedicated to Our Lady of Hope.
Monumental building built in the 19th century. It is similar to a small temple because of its architecture: it has a base in ashlar, with square pillars with capitals projecting at the corners, topped by a cornice supporting a high niche, open in the middle of the arch, framed by beautiful columns with bases and capitals under a flat roof on cornice.

Inscription under the niche: "Spes. Our Hope Salvation" and on a marble plaque placed on the base "Tribute of the inhabitants of Cabannes to the Virgin Mary. Jubilee -1851-".
It is completely protected by a fence.

- Oratory of Saint-Alphonse de Liguori (Route de Noves) : St. Alphonsus de Liguori, to whom the building is dedicated, was an eighteenth-century clergyman, traditionally known for his fight against injustice and his generosity to the little people. The oratory is located at the entrance of a private property.
Erected in 1905, the aedicula was blessed by Mgr Meffre, archbishop of Aix, on his return from Africa. The original bronze statue was stolen fifty years later, replaced by a stone statue which was stolen a year later, a third plaster statue was broken during an attempted theft. The owners of the Mas decided to build an identical oratory in the courtyard of their estate to protect it from malicious acts.
Above a beautiful molded base, a short pillar made of two levels of ashlar is topped by a cornice on which rests an ogival niche topped by a steeply pitched gable roof. An inscription is engraved in Gothic characters: Saint Alphonsus.

- Oratory of Saint Magdalene (Route d'Avignon): This oratory is dedicated to Sainte-Madeleine, patron saint of the village of Cabannes
Built in large stone, it is composed of a quadrangular cippe bearing the name and date of construction (1765) on three steps. A molded cornice separates it from the semi-circular niche. The whole is topped by a pyramidal roof surmounted by a metal cross.
The oratory is located at the edge of the road but it is possible to park on the side of the road.

- Saint-Roch's Oratory (Chemin de Saint-Roch): A very well known saint in the Arles region, Saint-Roch was invoked during the great plague and cholera epidemics.
People used to go there in procession in August for the feast of the saint. The brotherhood of the White Penitents of Avignon going on pilgrimage to the chapel of Saint-Sixte d'Eyguières stopped in front of this oratory.
Above a stone base and a small molded pedestal, the base is surmounted by a double cornice on which rests a high recessed semicircular niche. The stone pyramid roof is topped by a small stone cross. Under the niche one can distinguish a heart pierced by an arrow surmounted by a five-pointed star as well as the inscription: "The inhabitants of Cabannes grateful". Two iron gallows are used to hang the bread crowns during the August festival.

label: Parc'en ciel
description: 1 hectare of greenery - children's areas with playground equipment - structure pomme d'api (net, shelter, footbridge) 2 to 6 years old - Spring games 2 to 12 years old - Swing 2 to 12 years old - Climbing structure le clover 7 to 11 years old - Table tennis tables - Draughts, fountain - small fitness trail - kiosk with bleachers - shaded plots - multi-sports areas nearby (Victor Hugo and Pin Vert areas)

label: Centre International de la Poésie
comment: Temporary  exhibitions, readings, writing workshops, reviews. Library specializing with poetry, on the spot  consultation. A cinema with  100 seats.The Library is open from wednesday to saturday from 2 pm to 7 pm.
shortDescription: Temporary  exhibitions, readings, writing workshops, reviews. Library specializing with poetry, on the spot  consultation. A cinema with  100 seats.The Library is open from wednesday to saturday from 2 pm to 7 pm.
streetAddress: ['2 Rue De la Charité', 'Centre de la Vieille Charité']

label: Oratoire Saint Roch
description: This oratory was built in 1720-1721 after the plague, to thank Saint Roch for protecting the village; it marked the start of the village on the road from Mouriès.

label: Oratoire Saint-Mitre
description:
Situated in the Favary estate, near the Arc river, this shrine was erected on 16 June 1890 by Mr Animard, a lawyer of Aix.

It consists of a base resting on two steps and surmounted by a niche containing the statue of Saint Mitre to protect the harvests from lightning and hail.

label: Artisanat monastique saint Germain
comment: The Community of Benedictine Sisters and Brothers of Simiane offers a place of silence, prayer and retreat.
shortDescription: The Community of Benedictine Sisters and Brothers of Simiane offers a place of silence, prayer and retreat.
description:
An exhibition of the work of their workshops can be seen on site: art weavings, batik, terracotta, glass workshop making original models of stained glass, mosaics, lamps and enamelled dishes...

Opening hours: 10am-12pm / 3.30pm-5pm (weekdays) 9.30am-10.45am / 4pm-5.30pm (Sundays).
streetAddress: ['530 chemin des Mérentiers', 'Communauté bénédictines de Sainte Lioba']

label: Porte d'Eyguières
comment: To access the valley of the Fountain, you just have to take the path of the Calade through the Gate of Eyguières. It is through this gate - which was the only access to the village until the 17th century - that the water for the occupants arrived.
shortDescription: To access the valley of the Fountain, you just have to take the path of the Calade through the Gate of Eyguières. It is through this gate - which was the only access to the village until the 17th century - that the water for the occupants arrived.
description: Four successive gates protected the only access to the village prior to 1632. To reach the Valley of la Fontaine, visitors can follow the gravel path of La Calade and pass through the Porte d'Eyguières or Porte de l'Eau (because it was through this gate that the water for the villagers arrived), which was the only entrance to the village until 1866. Rebuilt by the Constable of Montmorency, in the 18th century the gate was raised by the Prince of Monaco, who had received the Barony of Les Baux in 1643. The coats of arms of the Maison Grimaldi can still be seen above the doorway in a cartouche adorned with Baroque rinceaux. The gate still has its defensive system, a wall walk with a cornice cut through with gun casements. Coats of arms of the Maison Grimaldi (almost invisible today): the shield is tapered with silver and gules and surrounded by the collar of the Order of Saint Charles, placed on a red cloak lined with ermine and topped with the princely crown. Bearers: two long-haired, bearded Friars Minor wearing boots, each one holding a raised sword, standing on a banner which reads 'Deo Juvante' (With the help of God).

label: Niches urbaines
comment: Along the alleys are hidden niches, some occupied by virgins.
shortDescription: Along the alleys are hidden niches, some occupied by virgins.
description: There are 11 urban niches dedicated to the Virgin, only six of which contain a statue.

label: Jardin Lapidaire
comment:
This monument which has not been the subject of reasoned excavations or surveys accurate was dismantled in the 1970s and is found today
partially reassembled in the lapidary garden.
shortDescription:
This monument which has not been the subject of reasoned excavations or surveys accurate was dismantled in the 1970s and is found today
partially reassembled in the lapidary garden.
description: On the edge of the Gallifet canal, it brings together some archaeological remains, stelae, fragments of a Gallo-Roman temple and in particular the altar discovered in the hamlet of St-Pierre (witness to imperial worship).

label: Ecomusée de la Crau-Maison de la Crau
comment: La Crau has its own house: the Ecomuseum
shortDescription: La Crau has its own house: the Ecomuseum
description:
The Crau Ecomuseum was created in 1987 by the Conservatory of Provence Ecosystem Studies (CEEP), now the Conservatory of Natural Areas (CEN PACA), with the support of the City and the Foundation for Natural Heritage in Europe (STIFTUNG). It now plays an important role in the St Martinoise cultural life and in the development of tourism in the town.
Located in an old barn in the heart of the city, it invites you to discover all the wonders of Crau, with:
- A permanent exhibition - Temporary exhibitions - The Draille des Coussouls discovery trail - A shop The permanent exhibition highlights the richness and traditions of the Crau land: its geology, history, flora and fauna, rare and protected, such as the sand grouse, little bustard, the lesser kestrel... Temporary exhibitions are renewed every three months. Artistic or educational, they refer to the Crau and the protection of nature. 
The Draille des Coussouls trail leads you into the heart of the Nature Reserve. 
The shop offers a selection of French naturalist books, maps, books and regional products. 
Moreover, the entrance to the Ecomuseum allows you to access the Retro Museum, a space dedicated to the reproduction of scenes of everyday life in the past.

label: Synagogue d'Aix-en-Provence
comment: The Synagogue of Aix-en-Provence is located in the heart of the city, a few steps from the Rotunda in the direction of the bus station.
shortDescription: The Synagogue of Aix-en-Provence is located in the heart of the city, a few steps from the Rotunda in the direction of the bus station.
description:
To see on the spot: one of the stained glasses which was carried out by Elisabeth Brenas, in collaboration with the calligrapher Franck Lalou.

A work of high technicality to marry matter and writing.
